column1: 4184235900,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-science-analyst-at-generali-4184235900?position=1&pageNum=0&refId=1iXeVSvVxBuRKZ7DtrrO%2BA%3D%3D&trackingId=a6Ykm4q%2FwzAtlT5hxSeZxw%3D%3D,Data Science Analyst,Generali,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","For the Central Team of Generali Global Corporate & Commercial (GC&C), we are looking for a Data Science Analyst to join our Insurance Department. Reporting to the Head of Technical Excellence, this position is key to leveraging data insights for comprehensive technical analysis, pricing strategies, and effective portfolio management. With a dynamic, cross-functional approach, the role includes demanding data integration across key domains such as Underwriting, Risk Engineering, and Claims, thereby contributing significantly to the company's strategic objectives. In addition, you will contribute to the development of the sustainability agenda of GC&C, working on carbon emission, green energy, and climate change initiatives.
Supporting the analysis of the overall GC&C portfolio results, trends and patterns
Designing and deploying the portfolio management discipline
Assisting BU in the target setting and supporting BU in achieving targets
Performing data quality checks at all stages of portfolio management
Preparation and steering of Portfolio review meetings
Assisting UW functions in steering the business accordingly.
Working collaboratively on pioneering new actuarial tools, integrating Machine Learning algorithms to enhance predictive capabilities
Actively participate in defining business requirements to evolve the TechEx technology stack, in partnership with Operations
Facilitate training sessions for the GC&C underwriting community on the TechEx tool suite, promoting skill enhancement and tool.
Driving forward GC&C sustainability initiatives also in collaboration with Group Head Office
Contributing to the development of a technical framework to embed Net Zero targets into GC&C underwriting strategy.
The ideal candidate will meet the following requirements:
Studied Actuarial Science, Mathematics or Statistics or other quantitative disciplines, e.g. Engineering, Physics etc.
Quantitative, analytical mindset, problem solving skills
Insurance business processes knowledge experience is welcome
Familiarity with Python and R is valued
Must be fluent in Italian, English, additional languages are an advantage
Generali is a major player in the global insurance industry ‚Äì a strategic and highly important sector for the growth, development and welfare of modern societies.

Over almost 200 years, we have built a multinational group that is present in more than 50 countries, with 470 companies and nearly 82,000 employees. Our group aims to become the standard bearer and industry leader in the European retail insurance market, building on our existing base of 50 million retail clients, out of an overall total of 72 million.

Global Corporate & Commercial is the Generali Group unit developing P&C business and insurance services for medium and large companies. The unit acts on a global scale and deploys an integrated approach at Group level with a central management team and specialized teams active in individual countries. Through GC&C, Generali aims to become a key world player in the corporate-commercial segment.

Generali is proud to be an inclusive employer that considers applicants regardless of gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, disability, religion, political views, marital status or philosophy of life.
If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation or assistance, we will support you during the selection process.

3930437766,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-at-prima-3930437766?position=4&pageNum=0&refId=1iXeVSvVxBuRKZ7DtrrO%2BA%3D%3D&trackingId=pQ5PnuukrH9LbMQzBHuvsA%3D%3D,Data Scientist,Prima,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Got the drive to shape the future of insurance?
At Prima, you could take on a whole new challenge. As part of our global community, you‚Äôd be in the driving seat of your career
column2: learning and growing with a top-tier team around you. Prima is a place where no matter who you are or what your role is ‚Äî your voice is valued.

column1: Back in 2015, we embarked on a mission: to provide great value car insurance that is designed for everyone. And we‚Äôve come a long way, we‚Äôve created a culture where we can fuel each other‚Äôs success. But we need your expertise, as we steer things in a new and exciting direction.
You‚Äôre probably thinking‚Ä¶ ‚ÄòThat sounds pretty good‚Äô. We agree.

As well as great colleagues and engaging projects, there are loads of ways we can help you do the best work of your life. We‚Äôve shaped our offering to place a focus on wellbeing, autonomy and development. We see benefits as the fuel that will empower you to succeed, if you decide to embark on this journey with us.

Step into the spotlight at Prima in the Pricing team and play a pivotal role in making Prima the most successful insurance company in the world. With the power of creativity, data and machine learning, you'll be at the forefront of our competitive advantage: predict the future and set prices accordingly.
ü§∏üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Working in a way that works for you

We believe in work-life balance and flexibility. Whether you like working from the office, home or a mixture of both. We‚Äôll help you find a balance that works best for you. We even have a policy that means you can work from any location for 30 days a year. We trust you to steer us forward.
üèÅ The freedom to explore the possibilities
We may move fast at Prima, but we move together. We‚Äôre invested in your growth
column2: so we‚Äôll give you access to a teaching and learning marketplace. And you‚Äôll have regular sessions with your manager to establish a personal growth plan.

column1: üåà Our winning formula: happy and high-performing

From private medical insurance to discounted gym memberships and wellbeing initiatives: we‚Äôre here to support you. We know how important your health and well-being is, so we‚Äôll go the extra mile to help you when we can.
If it sounds like we‚Äôve got something that‚Äôs up your street, let‚Äôs see if you‚Äôve got the skills we‚Äôre looking for!

Step into the spotlight at Prima as a Data Scientist of the Pricing team and play a pivotal role in making Prima the most successful insurance company in the world. With the power of creativity, data and machine learning, you'll be at the forefront of our competitive advantage: predict the future and set prices accordingly.

As a Data Scientist at Prima, your role is crucial in leveraging the power of artificial intelligence and advanced data analytics to decode the risks and opportunities presented by each new client. Your work directly influences our company's growth and long-term success, contributing to the achievement of our strategic goals.
Are you the ideal candidate for this exciting role? Here's what we're looking for:
Academic Excellence : Impressive academic achievements in Mathematics, Physics, Engineering Mathematics, Engineering Physics, or Statistics are a plus.
Experience Not Required : No prior work experience? No problem! We're eager to invest in your talent and education.
Analytical Prowess : Strong quantitative, logical, and analytical skills are essential. At Prima, you'll tackle diverse and stimulating challenges that will put your skills to the test.
Curiosity and Innovation : We value curiosity, proactivity, and pragmatism. You'll be encouraged to pursue common goals in original and innovative ways, shaping the future with your ideas.
We're Also Interested In Candidates Who
Have international experience and are fluent in English and Italian.
Possess a solid foundation in programming and machine learning.
Know how to create and manipulate datasets using data mining languages like MySQL or Redshift.

Got the drive to shape the future of insurance?

At Prima, you could take on a whole new challenge. As part of our global community, you‚Äôd be in the driving seat of your career
column2:
learning and growing with a top-tier team around you. Prima is a place where no matter who you are or what your role is ‚Äî your voice is valued.

Back in 2015, we embarked on a mission: to provide great value car insurance that is designed for everyone. And we‚Äôve come a long way, we‚Äôve created a culture where we can fuel each other‚Äôs success. But we need your expertise, as we steer things in a new and exciting direction.

You‚Äôre probably thinking‚Ä¶ ‚ÄòThat sounds pretty good‚Äô. We agree.

As well as great colleagues and engaging projects, there are loads of ways we can help you do the best work of your life. We‚Äôve shaped our offering to place a focus on wellbeing, autonomy and development. We see benefits as the fuel that will empower you to succeed, if you decide to embark on this journey with us.

Step into the spotlight at Prima in the Pricing team and play a pivotal role in making Prima the most successful insurance company in the world. With the power of creativity, data and machine learning, you'll be at the forefront of our competitive advantage: predict the future and set prices accordingly.

ü§∏üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Working in a way that works for you

We believe in work-life balance and flexibility. Whether you like working from the office, home or a mixture of both. We‚Äôll help you find a balance that works best for you. We even have a policy that means you can work from any location for 30 days a year. We trust you to steer us forward.

üèÅ The freedom to explore the possibilities

We may move fast at Prima, but we move together. We‚Äôre invested in your growth
column3:
so we‚Äôll give you access to a teaching and learning marketplace. And you‚Äôll have regular sessions with your manager to establish a personal growth plan.

üåà Our winning formula: happy and high-performing

From private medical insurance to discounted gym memberships and wellbeing initiatives: we‚Äôre here to support you. We know how important your health and well-being is, so we‚Äôll go the extra mile to help you when we can.

If it sounds like we‚Äôve got something that‚Äôs up your street, let‚Äôs see if you‚Äôve got the skills we‚Äôre looking for!

Step into the spotlight at Prima as a Data Scientist of the Pricing team and play a pivotal role in making Prima the most successful insurance company in the world. With the power of creativity, data and machine learning, you'll be at the forefront of our competitive advantage: predict the future and set prices accordingly.

As a Data Scientist at Prima, your role is crucial in leveraging the power of artificial intelligence and advanced data analytics to decode the risks and opportunities presented by each new client. Your work directly influences our company's growth and long-term success, contributing to the achievement of our strategic goals.

Are you the ideal candidate for this exciting role? Here's what we're looking for:

  • Academic Excellence : Impressive academic achievements in Mathematics, Physics, Engineering Mathematics, Engineering Physics, or Statistics are a plus.
  • Experience Not Required : No prior work experience? No problem! We're eager to invest in your talent and education.
  • Analytical Prowess : Strong quantitative, logical, and analytical skills are essential. At Prima, you'll tackle diverse and stimulating challenges that will put your skills to the test.
  • Curiosity and Innovation : We value curiosity, proactivity, and pragmatism. You'll be encouraged to pursue common goals in original and innovative ways, shaping the future with your ideas.

We're Also Interested In Candidates Who

  • Have international experience and are fluent in English and Italian.
  • Possess a solid foundation in programming and machine learning.
  • Know how to create and manipulate datasets using data mining languages like MySQL or Redshift.

4190564888,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-at-globant-4190564888?position=8&pageNum=0&refId=1iXeVSvVxBuRKZ7DtrrO%2BA%3D%3D&trackingId=IUsnC0SNb2H%2FqMXkOw%2Fm0w%3D%3D,Data Scientist,Globant,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","At Globant, we are working to make the world a better place, one step at a time. We enhance business development and enterprise solutions to prepare them for a digital future. With a diverse and talented team present in more than 30 countries, we are strategic partners to leading global companies in their business process transformation.

We seek a Data Scientist Senior who shares our passion for innovation and change. This role is critical to helping our business partners evolve and adapt to consumers' personalized expectations in this new technological era.
You will get the chance to:
Design and implement robust machine learning models to address complex business challenges.
Conduct advanced statistical analyses and predictive modeling to uncover patterns and trends in large datasets.
Develop end-to-end data workflows, including feature engineering, data preparation, and model evaluation.
Collaborate with data engineers to ensure data pipelines and infrastructure support modeling needs effectively.
Leverage LLM technologies (e.g., LangChain) to develop AI-driven applications and solutions.
Translate data insights into actionable business recommendations, presenting findings to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Optimize models for deployment in production, ensuring scalability, reliability, and performance.
Stay at the forefront of advancements in AI, machine learning, and LLM frameworks to apply state-of-the-art techniques.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related field
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R.
Deep knowledge of machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn).
Experience with big data processing tools (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) and cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
Strong expertise in SQL and familiarity with NoSQL databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, MongoDB).
Hands-on experience preparing and optimizing data for machine learning models.
Proficiency with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Matplotlib).
Familiarity with LLM frameworks like LangChain and their application in real-world scenarios.
Understanding of REST API integration and backend architectures.
Proven ability to work in Agile teams and deliver enterprise-grade solutions.
Experience with containerization and orchestration tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
Familiarity with data governance, security best practices, and compliance requirements.
Knowledge of advanced machine learning concepts, including model explainability and monitoring.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.
Create with us digital products that people love. We will bring businesses and consumers together through AI technology and creativity, driving digital transformation to positively impact the world.

At Globant, we believe in fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued and respected. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating a thriving and inclusive environment for all employees and candidates, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristic. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know by applying through our Career Site or contacting your assigned recruiter.

We may use AI and machine learning technologies in our recruitment process. Compensation is determined based on skills, qualifications, experience, and location. In addition to competitive salaries, we offer a comprehensive benefits package. Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion and Globant‚Äôs Benefits.

4155842723,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-italy-bcg-x-at-bcg-x-4155842723?position=12&pageNum=0&refId=1iXeVSvVxBuRKZ7DtrrO%2BA%3D%3D&trackingId=xedvGyinNLoBQUeZPJZSpA%3D%3D,"Data Scientist, Italy - BCG X",BCG X,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures‚Äîand business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

We‚Äôre a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world‚Äôs most complex problems. Leveraging BCG‚Äôs global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.

Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

Our Data Scientists and Senior Data Scientist are part of our rapidly growing team to apply data science methods and analytics to real-world business situations across industries to drive significant business impact. You'll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions.

Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X. Successful candidates are intellectually curious builders who are biased toward action, creative, and communicative.

We Are Looking For Dedicated Individuals With a Passion For Data Science, Statistics, Operations Research And Redefining Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following
Comfortable in a client-facing role with the ambition to lead teams
Likes to distill complex results or processes into simple, clear visualizations
Explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner
Love building things and are comfortable working with modern development tools and writing code collaboratively (bonus points if you have a software development or DevOps experience)
Significant experience applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data
Deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings, and can translate this into business implications for our clients
Fluency in both Italian and English
Master‚Äôs or PhD degree program in Computer Research Science, Data Science, Statistics, Operations Research, or related field

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.
BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

Our Data Scientists and Senior Data Scientist are part of our rapidly growing team to apply data science methods and analytics to real-world business situations across industries to drive significant business impact. Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X. Successful candidates are intellectually curious builders who are biased toward action, creative, and communicative.

  • Love building things and are comfortable working with modern development tools and writing code collaboratively (bonus points if you have a software development or DevOps experience)
  • Significant experience applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data
  • Deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings, and can translate this into business implications for our clients
  • Have strong project management skills
  • Fluency in both Italian and English

4183360108,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-global-teams-at-prima-4183360108?position=13&pageNum=0&refId=1iXeVSvVxBuRKZ7DtrrO%2BA%3D%3D&trackingId=csMP2WQRBUVfVvdR8%2FxmBA%3D%3D,Data Scientist - Global Teams,Prima,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Got the drive to shape the future of insurance?
At Prima, you could take on a whole new challenge. As part of our global community, you‚Äôd be in the driving seat of your career
column2: learning and growing with a top-tier team around you. Prima is a place where no matter who you are or what your role is ‚Äî your voice is valued.

column1: Back in 2015, we embarked on a mission: to provide great value car insurance that is designed for everyone. And we‚Äôve come a long way, we‚Äôve created a culture where we can fuel each other‚Äôs success. But we need your expertise, as we steer things in a new and exciting direction.
You‚Äôre probably thinking‚Ä¶ ‚ÄòThat sounds pretty good‚Äô. We agree.

As well as great colleagues and engaging projects, there are loads of ways we can help you do the best work of your life. We‚Äôve shaped our offering to place a focus on well-being, autonomy and development. We see benefits as the fuel that will empower you to succeed, if you decide to embark on this journey with us.
ü§∏üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Working in a way that works for you

We believe in work-life balance and flexibility. Whether you like working from the office, home or a mixture of both. We‚Äôll help you find a balance that works best for you. We even have a policy that means you can work from any location for 30 days a year. We trust you to steer us forward.
üèÅ The freedom to explore the possibilities
We may move fast at Prima, but we move together. We‚Äôre invested in your growth
column2: so we‚Äôll give you access to a teaching and learning marketplace. And you‚Äôll have regular sessions with your manager to establish a personal growth plan.

column1: üåà Our winning formula: happy and high-performing

From private medical insurance to discounted gym memberships and wellbeing initiatives: we‚Äôre here to support you. We know how important your health and well-being is, so we‚Äôll go the extra mile to help you when we can.
If it sounds like we‚Äôve got something that‚Äôs up your street, let‚Äôs see if you‚Äôve got the skills we‚Äôre looking for!

At Prima, Data Scientists are part of the Pricing & Underwriting department , working within global teams that drive our international strategy. By applying for this role, you'll be considered for one of two global teams, and during the hiring process, we'll determine the best fit for your skills and expertise.

Our Global Pricing & Underwriting Teams are at the forefront of shaping our international strategy through data, analytics, and innovation. They transform complexity into structured, proactive solutions, enabling each market to identify opportunities for improvement and drive continuous growth.

By combining strategic vision with cutting-edge analytics, the team ensures a seamless approach to pricing and underwriting. Their work spans from defining and executing global strategies to developing advanced machine learning models and optimizing data pipelines. Through collaboration across multiple markets, they extract insights, identify scalable best practices, and enhance technical capabilities, making data-driven decision-making a core strength of Prima.
This unified approach empowers us to stay ahead in a dynamic industry, leveraging data and expertise to drive innovation, efficiency, and sustainable success. üöÄ
Join us and be part of a global team pushing the boundaries of Pricing & Underwriting through data.
As a Data Scientist in these teams, some of your activities could be

Design, build and evolve Prima‚Äôs proprietary predictive technology, in topics such as the prediction of future claims, tactical pricing, renewal probability, fraud detection and customer lifetime value, etc

Define and support the implementation in each country of the key tools to understand how the business is growing, for example, conversion, retention, emerging profitability. The monitoring tools need to be consistent at a global level and at the same time able to adapt to the different stages of evolution of each country
Support the countries in planning the pricing and UW strategy and consequent follow up
Develop a strong critical spirit and creativity that can act as an engine for Prima's growth.
Are you the ideal candidate for this exciting role? Here's what we're looking for
Impressive academic achievements in Mathematics, Computer science, Physics, Statistics, Mathematical Engineering or Physical Engineering
From graduates to people with 2+ years of working/research experience: we‚Äôre open to evaluate the seniority during the recruitment process
Strong Python programming skills - especially in the data domain - and fluent use of GIT
You have a genuine, collaborative mindset that inspires and guides others.
In addition to the basic requirements, we will carefully evaluate these characteristics as a plus
You have previous work experience in similar roles
Knowledge of Spark, SQL or any other data-oriented programming language and proficiency with standard data wrangling and modeling libraries (Pandas, Sklearn. Keras, XGBboost, LightGBM, etc.)
Knowledge of BI tools (Tableau or similar)

Strong background in mathematical optimization, linear and nonlinear programming, convex optimization, combinatorial optimization techniques, metaheuristics (such as genetic algorithms, simulated annealing, and particle swarm optimization), and stochastic optimization methods.

column2:
learning and growing with a top-tier team around you. Prima is a place where no matter who you are or what your role is ‚Äî your voice is valued.

Back in 2015, we embarked on a mission: to provide great value car insurance that is designed for everyone. And we‚Äôve come a long way, we‚Äôve created a culture where we can fuel each other‚Äôs success. But we need your expertise, as we steer things in a new and exciting direction.

You‚Äôre probably thinking‚Ä¶ ‚ÄòThat sounds pretty good‚Äô. We agree.

As well as great colleagues and engaging projects, there are loads of ways we can help you do the best work of your life. We‚Äôve shaped our offering to place a focus on well-being, autonomy and development. We see benefits as the fuel that will empower you to succeed, if you decide to embark on this journey with us.

ü§∏üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Working in a way that works for you

We believe in work-life balance and flexibility. Whether you like working from the office, home or a mixture of both. We‚Äôll help you find a balance that works best for you. We even have a policy that means you can work from any location for 30 days a year. We trust you to steer us forward.

üèÅ The freedom to explore the possibilities

We may move fast at Prima, but we move together. We‚Äôre invested in your growth
column3:
so we‚Äôll give you access to a teaching and learning marketplace. And you‚Äôll have regular sessions with your manager to establish a personal growth plan.

üåà Our winning formula: happy and high-performing

From private medical insurance to discounted gym memberships and wellbeing initiatives: we‚Äôre here to support you. We know how important your health and well-being is, so we‚Äôll go the extra mile to help you when we can.

If it sounds like we‚Äôve got something that‚Äôs up your street, let‚Äôs see if you‚Äôve got the skills we‚Äôre looking for!

Moviri started as a research spinoff at Politecnico of Milan and was incubated at its startup accelerator.

Data and experimentation are part of our DNA: it is for this reason that we continuously focus on research, emerging ideas, and new technologies, routinely partnering with top academic and engineering research institutions.

Moviri Consulting is the first company of Moviri and its foundation. Moviri‚Äôs professionals use data, software, and insights to solve substantial business challenges for Fortune 500 corporations, multinational banks, global media conglomerates and some of the most respected brands in a variety of industries. The Moviri Consulting Performance Engineering team optimizes performance of IT systems to make them responsive, infinitely scalable, reliable, resilient and cost-effective.
As a Junior Data Scientist in the Moviri Consulting Analytics team, you will be involved in a project related to:
Have the ability to work autonomously, solve complex data science problems, design and code scalable, maintainable solutions.
Leverage machine learning and statistical methods to develop, train, optimize, and evaluate models in the areas of Advanced Analytics, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, and Generative AI.
Own the process of data collection, extraction, and aggregation from various sources using main Big Data paradigms, ensuring data is properly formatted, synthesized, and validated for accuracy.
Deploy AI models and systems into production environments, ensuring smooth integration with existing infrastructures and workflows.
Enhance algorithms and models for optimal performance, efficiency, and reliability in real-world applications.
Full-time position at the Milan Office on Hybrid Mode.
If you share our passion for consulting in the Data & AI field and possess the following characteristics, we are waiting for you:
Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, Engineering, Physics or STEM related field
Experience on software development and programming (e.g., Python, C++, Java, R)
column2: experience on Data Science libraries (Pandas, Scikit Learn, Keras, TensorFlow, Matplotlib, fastAPI)

column1: Familiarity with GIT, AGILE methodology, and Continuous Integration and Delivery
Familiarity with data management and related languages/tools, database programming in SQL and NoSQL
Familiarity with Cloud Platforms (e.g. AWS, GCP, or Azure) and Big Data Domains (e.g. Hadoop, Spark)
Familiarity with Cloud Orchestration tools to automate deployment, scaling, and management of containers (e. g. Kubernetes) and containerization technologies (e. g. Docker)
Passionate about development of Machine Learning models (e.g. Time Series Analysis, Clustering, Classification, Anomaly Detection), Computer Vision, NLP, and Generative AI.
Make a Real Impact joining Moviri: we're on the lookout for dynamic individuals who want to be a driving force in their field, making a significant difference from day one.

Flexibility and Trust: from the moment you step in, you're not just an employee, but you're part of the team of talented colleagues. Moviri value freedom and responsibility, giving you the autonomy to excel and contribute your best in Hybrid mode

Competitive Salary and Company Welfare: Your hard work deserves recognition! Enjoy a competitive salary that reflects your skills and dedication. As a part of our team, you'll also receive a company welfare package of ‚Ç¨600, useful for fuel, bills, as well as wellness and well-being!

Sustainability: in our office, you will always have access to fresh fruit thanks to Cortilia. In Moviri, we are committed to connecting conscious customers with local products and producers, all while prioritizing environmental and social responsibility.

Tech Your Way: choose your weapon in the tech battle! Whether you're team Mac or team Windows, we believe in equipping you with the tools that spark joy. After all, the only thing better than coding your next big idea is doing it on a laptop that suits your style!
We cannot realize any of our ambitions or achieve any of our goals without the right talent. If this sounds like you, please apply now. It may be the start of your next chapter!

  • Non Relational Databases (MongoDB, Cassandra, Redis, , Elastic Search, Splunk)

Management Solutions is an international consulting firm whose core mission is to deliver business, risk, financial, organisational and process-related advisory services, targeting both functional aspects and the implementation of related technologies. We currently have a multidisciplinary team (functional, mathematical, technical and systems integration) of around 4,000 professionals.


We operate through 50 offices (22 in Europe, 23 in the Americas, 3 in Asia, 1 in Africa and 1 in Oceania) from where we regularly serve clients that operate in more than 50 countries across five major geographical areas (Europe, Americas, Asia, Africa and Oceania).

¬∑ Mathematical support to the business: developing algorithms, statistics and probability models

4184181188,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-manager-at-kiko-milano-4184181188?position=31&pageNum=0&refId=1iXeVSvVxBuRKZ7DtrrO%2BA%3D%3D&trackingId=gtfiT%2F%2Fbo2lTK8H6u7u8hQ%3D%3D,Data Scientist Manager,KIKO MILANO,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","The Company

KIKO MILANO was founded in 1997 in Milan and since then has revolutionized how cosmetics are sold globally. We thrive to offer an incredible variety of products, textures & colours, a multi-sensorial experience in innovative technology yet always at an affordable price. Based in Italy, and truthful to its DNA, KIKO MILANO takes advantage of combining trustworthy quality, creativity and stunning aesthetics
We are looking for a Data Scientist Manager to join KIKO MILANO‚Äôs Data Analytics and Insights team.

Such talent will will bridge business strategy and AI-driven solutions, working closely with executives to translate challenges into data-driven opportunities. You will lead analytics projects, oversee AI model deployment, and mentor data scientists while driving innovation and operational efficiency.
Work executives to understand business problems and map them to state-of-the-art analytics and AI solutions

Help think strategically about how to leverage technology to create fundamental business impact, from formulating tech-driven growth strategies to enabling more efficient operations through the use of technology
Develop and lead AI and advanced analytics roadmaps, ensuring alignment with business objectives.
Help lead digital and analytics projects that include the development and deployment of AI technologies and models
Establish best practices, ensuring high standards in modeling, experimentation, and AI deployment.
Play an active role in all aspects of a project, typically working in teams including business stakeholders and technical stakeholders (e.g., data scientists, data engineers)
column2: this will include gathering and analyzing information, formulating and testing hypotheses, and developing and communicating recommendations for the business

column1: Mentor data scientists, fostering technical excellence, innovation, and a data-driven mindset within the team to maximize their impact on the business.
What you will need to succeed
Advanced degree, preferably an MBA or PhD in a relevant field (such as computer science, machine learning, applied statistics, mathematics)
5+ years of work experience after completing your undergraduate degree, with strong functional knowledge and hands-on experience in data analytics and cloud data systems and platforms
Proficient in at least one relevant coding language required (e.g., Python, etc.)
Experience of working with large data sets, simulation/ optimization and distributed computing tools (Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, etc.) is a plus
Experience in machine learning, statistics, optimization or related fields, understands underlying methodologies and algorithms
Combination of strategic and analytical insights with a passion for technology
Experience in applying data science methods to business problems
Good presentation and communication skills with a knack for explaining complex analytical concepts to people from other fields
Skills to communicate complex ideas effectively in English
We would love if you had
Strong organizational skills with an ability to re-prioritize tasks as required to meet deadlines, rigorous, well organized, ability to coordinate multiples activities with many stakeholders
Experience working in a fast-paced environment

4149023507,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/machine-learning-scientist-intern-at-integral-ad-science-4149023507?position=33&pageNum=0&refId=1iXeVSvVxBuRKZ7DtrrO%2BA%3D%3D&trackingId=AXwoLQp3VrW57kS8wrFTsA%3D%3D,Machine Learning Scientist Intern,Integral Ad Science,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Integral Ad Science (IAS) is a global technology and data company that builds verification, optimization, and analytics solutions for the advertising industry and we‚Äôre looking for a Machine Learning Scientist (ML) Intern to join our Multimedia Core Service team in Modena, Italy. If you are excited by technology that has the power to handle hundreds of thousands of transactions per second
column2: collect tens of billions of events each day
column3: and evaluate thousands of data-points in real-time all while responding in just a few milliseconds, then IAS is the place for you!

column1: As a ML Scientist Intern you will work on advancing the understanding and application of dimensionality reduction techniques for sparse feature matrices generated by semantic engines. You will prototype, implement and evaluate a range of dimensionality reduction approaches. The second phase of the project will involve comparing the reduced-dimensional embedding spaces with existing pre-trained embeddings, to study similarities, overlaps, and differences in representation. This analysis will provide insights into how rule-based semantic features compare with context-aware neural representations This internship is an opportunity for you to gain practical experience with deep learning, interacting with large scale production environments and having the opportunity to research novel methods that can push the state of the art of media understanding and content evaluation.

Conduct in-depth research and experimentation on a wide array of dimensionality reduction techniques, with a particular focus on their applicability to sparse feature matrices commonly produced by semantic engines. This will involve prototyping, implementing, and rigorously evaluating methods such as Principal Component Analysis (PCA), Truncated Singular Value Decomposition (SVD), and neural embedding models (e.g., autoencoders).

Leverage these feature representations to construct and train machine learning models that can effectively address a variety of downstream tasks, such as classification, regression, clustering, or anomaly detection.
Work with the framework of your choice, e.g. PyTorch, TensorFlow, etc.
Integrate machine learning models into production systems.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in the field of machine learning and contribute to knowledge sharing within the team.
You should apply if you have most of this experience:
Currently pursuing a Master‚Äôs or PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, Computer Engineering, Statistics, or a related field.
Familiarity with machine learning and deep learning methods.
Proficiency in Python and experience with libraries such as NumPy, SciPy, Pandas, PyTorch, and TensorFlow.
Familiarity with SVD, BERT, ViT, or CLIP is a plus.
Experience with Self-Supervised Learning methods is also a plus.

Integral Ad Science (IAS) is a leading global media measurement and optimization platform that delivers the industry‚Äôs most actionable data to drive superior results for the world‚Äôs largest advertisers, publishers, and media platforms. IAS‚Äôs software provides comprehensive and enriched data that ensures ads are seen by real people in safe and suitable environments, while improving return on ad spend for advertisers and yield for publishers. Our mission is to be the global benchmark for trust and transparency in digital media quality. For more information, visit integralads.com.

IAS is an equal opportunity employer, committed to our diversity and inclusiveness. We will consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, nationality, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, disability or age. We strongly encourage women, people of color, members of the LGBTQIA community, people with disabilities and veterans to apply.

We collect personal information (PI) from you in connection with your application for employment or engagement with IAS, including the following categories of PI: identifiers, personal records, commercial information, professional or employment or engagement information, non-public education records, and inferences drawn from your PI. We collect your PI for our purposes, including performing services and operations related to your potential employment or engagement. For additional details or if you have questions, contact us at compliance@integralads.com.
To learn more about us, please visit http://integralads.com/

Attention agency/3rd party recruiters: IAS does not accept any unsolicited resumes or candidate profiles. If you are interested in becoming an IAS recruiting partner, please send an email introducing your company to recruitingagencies@integralads.com. We will get back to you if there's interest in a partnership.

Integral Ad Science (IAS) is a global technology and data company that builds verification, optimization, and analytics solutions for the advertising industry and we‚Äôre looking for a Machine Learning Scientist (ML) Intern to join our Multimedia Core Service team in Modena, Italy. If you are excited by technology that has the power to handle hundreds of thousands of transactions per second
column2: collect tens of billions of events each day
column3:
and evaluate thousands of data-points in real-time all while responding in just a few milliseconds, then IAS is the place for you!

As a ML Scientist Intern you will work on advancing the understanding and application of dimensionality reduction techniques for sparse feature matrices generated by semantic engines. You will prototype, implement and evaluate a range of dimensionality reduction approaches. The second phase of the project will involve comparing the reduced-dimensional embedding spaces with existing pre-trained embeddings, to study similarities, overlaps, and differences in representation. This analysis will provide insights into how rule-based semantic features compare with context-aware neural representations This internship is an opportunity for you to gain practical experience with deep learning, interacting with large scale production environments and having the opportunity to research novel methods that can push the state of the art of media understanding and content evaluation.

What you‚Äôll get to do:

  • Conduct in-depth research and experimentation on a wide array of dimensionality reduction techniques, with a particular focus on their applicability to sparse feature matrices commonly produced by semantic engines. This will involve prototyping, implementing, and rigorously evaluating methods such as Principal Component Analysis (PCA), Truncated Singular Value Decomposition (SVD), and neural embedding models (e.g., autoencoders).
  • Leverage these feature representations to construct and train machine learning models that can effectively address a variety of downstream tasks, such as classification, regression, clustering, or anomaly detection.
  • Work with the framework of your choice, e.g. PyTorch, TensorFlow, etc.
  • Integrate machine learning models into production systems.
  • Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in the field of machine learning and contribute to knowledge sharing within the team.


You should apply if you have most of this experience:

  • Currently pursuing a Master‚Äôs or PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, Computer Engineering, Statistics, or a related field.
  • Familiarity with machine learning and deep learning methods.
  • Proficiency in Python and experience with libraries such as NumPy, SciPy, Pandas, PyTorch, and TensorFlow.
  • Familiarity with SVD, BERT, ViT, or CLIP is a plus.
  • Experience with Self-Supervised Learning methods is also a plus.


About Integral Ad Science

Integral Ad Science (IAS) is a leading global media measurement and optimization platform that delivers the industry‚Äôs most actionable data to drive superior results for the world‚Äôs largest advertisers, publishers, and media platforms. IAS‚Äôs software provides comprehensive and enriched data that ensures ads are seen by real people in safe and suitable environments, while improving return on ad spend for advertisers and yield for publishers. Our mission is to be the global benchmark for trust and transparency in digital media quality. For more information, visit integralads.com.

Equal Opportunity Employer:

IAS is an equal opportunity employer, committed to our diversity and inclusiveness. We will consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, nationality, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, disability or age. We strongly encourage women, people of color, members of the LGBTQIA community, people with disabilities and veterans to apply.

California Applicant Pre-Collection Notice:

We collect personal information (PI) from you in connection with your application for employment or engagement with IAS, including the following categories of PI: identifiers, personal records, commercial information, professional or employment or engagement information, non-public education records, and inferences drawn from your PI. We collect your PI for our purposes, including performing services and operations related to your potential employment or engagement. For additional details or if you have questions, contact us at compliance@integralads.com.

To learn more about us, please visit http://integralads.com/

Attention agency/3rd party recruiters: IAS does not accept any unsolicited resumes or candidate profiles. If you are interested in becoming an IAS recruiting partner, please send an email introducing your company to recruitingagencies@integralads.com. We will get back to you if there's interest in a partnership.

Per rafforzare la funzione Data & Innovation e diventare una Data Driven Company, siamo alla ricerca di un* Data Scientist che sar√† responsabile di trasformare i dati in informazioni utili a supportare le decisioni aziendali strategiche. Il candidato ideale ha una solida esperienza nell'analisi dei dati e nella modellazione AI (machine learning, deep learning, etc.).
Definire e realizzare modelli di machine e deep learning da innestare nei processi operativi, gestionali e decisionali di AMCO
Analizzare grandi set di dati per identificare tendenze e modelli sintetizzando i risultati per il top management
Collaborare con team interfunzionali per comprendere le esigenze aziendali e tradurle in soluzioni basate su modelli supervised/unsupervised/reinforcement learning
Definire e realizzare dashboard per comunicare i risultati delle analisi ai principali stakeholder
Proporre con idee innovative modifiche per migliorare i processi e la qualit√† dei dati
Comprovata esperienza come Data Scientist o ruolo analoghi
Conoscenza approfondita di linguaggi di programmazione come Python, R, Pyspark o linguaggi similari
Esperienza con strumenti di visualizzazione dei dati (es. Tableau, Power BI).
Capacit√† di lavorare con database relazionali e non relazionali
Eccellenti capacit√† analitiche e di problem-solving
Buone capacit√† comunicative e attitudine al lavoro di squadra

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Valorizziamo il talento e lo premiamo: il piano di¬†incentivazione MBO √® esteso a tutti i livelli professionali
¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Smart working fino a 10 giorni al mese, che potrai gestire con flessibilit√†
¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Buoni pasto, di valore superiore a quello di mercato, anche nei giorni di smart working
¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Abbiamo a cuore il tuo benessere: una¬†polizza assicurativa sanitaria a copertura di spese mediche e infortunistiche e un programma di welfare per tutti i dipendenti

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Per noi il tuo futuro √® importante: puoi aderire al nostro¬†Fondo di previdenza complementare¬†e beneficiare del contributo integrativo da parte dell‚Äôazienda,¬†anche sulla retribuzione variabile
¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Borse di studio per i figli¬†dei dipendenti

<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

We are a global leader in the tire industry, specialized in designing, developing, manufacturing, and marketing high-performance tires for cars, motorcycles, and bicycles. With a presence in over 160 countries and around 18 production facilities, we pride ourselves on our cutting-edge technology and commitment to sustainability. Innovation is at the heart of everything we do, and it is fueled by our commitment to the inclusion of unique perspectives and different experiences. Because power is nothing without our people!
We are offering a rewarding role with scope for career progression along with:
* Bespoke training and development programs accessible to all.

You will be part of an international agile team of data scientists and data engineers. Together you will solve problems and deliver value across R&D, manufacturing, sales & marketing and connected tyres. You will apply statistical analysis and machine-learning techniques to a wide range of data (from sensors, to telemetry, to manufacturing) and you will change how decisions are made across all business units.
You will be in charge of coming up with effective and scalable solutions that, leveraging internal and external data, will answer questions such as:
1. How can we optimize our supply chain flow in a particular geographic region?
2. How can we build an effective and scalable real time monitoring system for production quality control?
3. How can we use IoT data to derive crucial insights and deliver impactful results?
4. How to improve B2C services with data-driven solutions?
5. How to drive new product development?
6. How to design personalized campaign based on consumer behavior?
* Translate business questions to data science problems, often exploring data and finding insights
* Develop, tune, and deploy custom, scalable, predictive models
* Present to non-technical stakeholders, even complex concepts, in a simple manner
* Manage a data science product end-to-end from concept to production
* Excellent knowledge of machine learning models
* Experience in model development (from business question to the model application)
* Extensive knowledge of scientific libraries (pandas, scipy, numpy, jupyter), scikit-learn, statsmodels and related machine learning/stats/data mining packages
* Deep knowledge of applied statistics including multivariate statistical analysis, Bayesian statistics, Time Series analysis
* Experience in machine learning model deployment
* Working experience with AWS cloud framework and services
* Ability to effectively communicate findings and rationale behind predictive models implemented to executives and management
* Ability to communicate and collaborate with other team members
WHAT PUTS YOU IN POLE POSITION
* Prior experience using agile and scrum
* Previous experience in professional end-to-end deep learning projects using TensorFlow

Job description:

DISCOVER PIRELLI
We are a global leader in the tire industry, specialized in designing, developing, manufacturing, and marketing high-performance tires for cars, motorcycles, and bicycles. With a presence in over 160 countries and around 18 production facilities, we pride ourselves on our cutting-edge technology and commitment to sustainability. Innovation is at the heart of everything we do, and it is fueled by our commitment to the inclusion of unique perspectives and different experiences. Because power is nothing without our people!

WHY JOIN US
We are offering a rewarding role with scope for career progression along with:
* Fast-paced, multidisciplinary and supportive environment.
* Global onboarding process.
* Bespoke training and development programs accessible to all.
* Competitive welfare and benefits package.
* International mobility opportunities.
DRIVE YOUR FUTURE
You will be part of an international agile team of data scientists and data engineers. Together you will solve problems and deliver value across R&
column2: D, manufacturing, sales &amp
column3:
marketing and connected tyres. You will apply statistical analysis and machine-learning techniques to a wide range of data (from sensors, to telemetry, to manufacturing) and you will change how decisions are made across all business units.

YOUR CORE ACTIVITIES
You will be in charge of coming up with effective and scalable solutions that, leveraging internal and external data, will answer questions such as:
1. How can we optimize our supply chain flow in a particular geographic region?
2. How can we build an effective and scalable real time monitoring system for production quality control?
3. How can we use IoT data to derive crucial insights and deliver impactful results?
4. How to improve B2C services with data-driven solutions?
5. How to drive new product development?
6. How to design personalized campaign based on consumer behavior?

* Translate business questions to data science problems, often exploring data and finding insights
* Develop, tune, and deploy custom, scalable, predictive models
* Present to non-technical stakeholders, even complex concepts, in a simple manner
* Manage a data science product end-to-end from concept to production

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
Must-have:
* Excellent knowledge of machine learning models
* Experience in model development (from business question to the model application)
* Advanced knowledge of Python
* Data visualization expertise
Required:

* 3/6 years of experience
* Advanced knowledge of SQL
* Broad knowledge of statistical learning
* Extensive knowledge of scientific libraries (pandas, scipy, numpy, jupyter), scikit-learn, statsmodels and related machine learning/stats/data mining packages
* Deep knowledge of applied statistics including multivariate statistical analysis, Bayesian statistics, Time Series analysis
* Experience in machine learning model deployment
* Experience with GIT
* Knowledge of CI/CD
Desired skills:
* Experience with deep learning
* Experience in Apache Spark
* Working experience with AWS cloud framework and services
* Experience with Docker
Core skills:
* Ability to effectively communicate findings and rationale behind predictive models implemented to executives and management
* Ability to communicate and collaborate with other team members

WHAT PUTS YOU IN POLE POSITION
* Prior experience using agile and scrum
* Previous experience in professional end-to-end deep learning projects using TensorFlow

APPLY NOW, DRIVE YOUR FUTURE!
#WePirelli

4155842723,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-italy-bcg-x-at-bcg-x-4155842723?position=1&pageNum=2&refId=EXQctpSzXN1EWfcxKQNMuw%3D%3D&trackingId=X%2Fw%2FCCgFteqmdTS8v0GRgQ%3D%3D,"Data Scientist, Italy - BCG X",BCG X,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures‚Äîand business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

We‚Äôre a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world‚Äôs most complex problems. Leveraging BCG‚Äôs global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.

Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

Our Data Scientists and Senior Data Scientist are part of our rapidly growing team to apply data science methods and analytics to real-world business situations across industries to drive significant business impact. You'll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions.

Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X. Successful candidates are intellectually curious builders who are biased toward action, creative, and communicative.

We Are Looking For Dedicated Individuals With a Passion For Data Science, Statistics, Operations Research And Redefining Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following
Comfortable in a client-facing role with the ambition to lead teams
Likes to distill complex results or processes into simple, clear visualizations
Explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner
Love building things and are comfortable working with modern development tools and writing code collaboratively (bonus points if you have a software development or DevOps experience)
Significant experience applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data
Deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings, and can translate this into business implications for our clients
Fluency in both Italian and English
Master‚Äôs or PhD degree program in Computer Research Science, Data Science, Statistics, Operations Research, or related field

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

AXA Italia cerca un/una Machine Learning Engineer specializzato in AI generativa per la direzione Operations. Il candidato ideale avr√† esperienza nella industrializzazione di modelli di machine learning, con particolare focus su tecnologie generative come GAN, VAE e modelli di linguaggio avanzati. Il ruolo prevede la collaborazione con team multidisciplinari per industrializzare soluzioni innovative che sfruttino l'intelligenza artificiale generativa.

In particolare, la risorsa selezionata si occuper√† di:

  • Rimanere aggiornati sulle ultime tendenze e migliori pratiche nelle architetture di dati e ML, con un focus specifico su applicazioni di Intelligenza Artificiale Generativa.

  • Esperienza con tool di NLP/ML e librerie come scikit-learn, Spacy, HuggingFace, LangChain, LlamaIndex.
  • Esperienza con tecniche ed algoritmi di machine learning/NLP come classifcazione, clustering, tokenization, parsing, embedding e chatbots
  • Conoscenza di altri linguaggi di programmazione √® un plus.
  • Esperienza nel design ed implementazione di framework di MLOps √® un plus

4203325897,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/machine-learning-developer-at-best-engage-4203325897?position=6&pageNum=2&refId=EXQctpSzXN1EWfcxKQNMuw%3D%3D&trackingId=%2BOsigrl0ZzFXMS6OiLiShw%3D%3D,Machine Learning Developer,Best Engage,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Best Engage azienda leader nel settore della ricerca e selezione del personale, √® alla ricerca di un Machine Learning Developer di talento ed esperienza per inserimento diretto presso cliente operante nel settore IT. Sarai parte di un ambiente stimolante, focalizzato sulla creazione di soluzioni all'avanguardia basate sull'intelligenza artificiale e sul machine learning.
Progettare, sviluppare e implementare modelli di machine learning avanzati utilizzando TensorFlow e altre librerie di deep learning.
Sviluppare soluzioni cloud scalabili ed efficienti utilizzando gli strumenti di computing offerti da Azure e/o AWS.
Gestire e ottimizzare l'infrastruttura cloud per l'elaborazione e l'archiviazione di grandi volumi di dati.
Implementare pipeline end-to-end complete sui provider cloud Azure e/o AWS, garantendo l'integrazione e l'automazione dei processi.
Applicare i principi fondamentali di MLOps per garantire la manutenzione, il monitoraggio e l'evoluzione delle soluzioni di machine learning nel tempo.
Collaborare strettamente con team multidisciplinari (Data Scientists, Data Engineers, Product Owners) per comprendere le esigenze di business e tradurle in soluzioni tecniche efficaci.
Mantenersi aggiornato sulle ultime tendenze e tecnologie nel campo del machine learning e del deep learning.
Contribuire alla definizione delle best practice e degli standard di sviluppo all'interno del team.
Esperienza comprovata (minimo 3 anni) come Data Scientist con un focus specifico su machine learning e deep learning.

Machine Learning Developer

  • Contribuire alla definizione delle best practice e degli standard di sviluppo all'interno del team.

4149023507,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/machine-learning-scientist-intern-at-integral-ad-science-4149023507?position=8&pageNum=2&refId=EXQctpSzXN1EWfcxKQNMuw%3D%3D&trackingId=h8yc7KhnE4%2BES%2FokfSjGlw%3D%3D,Machine Learning Scientist Intern,Integral Ad Science,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Integral Ad Science (IAS) is a global technology and data company that builds verification, optimization, and analytics solutions for the advertising industry and we‚Äôre looking for a Machine Learning Scientist (ML) Intern to join our Multimedia Core Service team in Modena, Italy. If you are excited by technology that has the power to handle hundreds of thousands of transactions per second
column2: collect tens of billions of events each day
column3: and evaluate thousands of data-points in real-time all while responding in just a few milliseconds, then IAS is the place for you!

column1: As a ML Scientist Intern you will work on advancing the understanding and application of dimensionality reduction techniques for sparse feature matrices generated by semantic engines. You will prototype, implement and evaluate a range of dimensionality reduction approaches. The second phase of the project will involve comparing the reduced-dimensional embedding spaces with existing pre-trained embeddings, to study similarities, overlaps, and differences in representation. This analysis will provide insights into how rule-based semantic features compare with context-aware neural representations This internship is an opportunity for you to gain practical experience with deep learning, interacting with large scale production environments and having the opportunity to research novel methods that can push the state of the art of media understanding and content evaluation.

Conduct in-depth research and experimentation on a wide array of dimensionality reduction techniques, with a particular focus on their applicability to sparse feature matrices commonly produced by semantic engines. This will involve prototyping, implementing, and rigorously evaluating methods such as Principal Component Analysis (PCA), Truncated Singular Value Decomposition (SVD), and neural embedding models (e.g., autoencoders).

Leverage these feature representations to construct and train machine learning models that can effectively address a variety of downstream tasks, such as classification, regression, clustering, or anomaly detection.
Work with the framework of your choice, e.g. PyTorch, TensorFlow, etc.
Integrate machine learning models into production systems.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in the field of machine learning and contribute to knowledge sharing within the team.
You should apply if you have most of this experience:
Currently pursuing a Master‚Äôs or PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, Computer Engineering, Statistics, or a related field.
Familiarity with machine learning and deep learning methods.
Proficiency in Python and experience with libraries such as NumPy, SciPy, Pandas, PyTorch, and TensorFlow.
Familiarity with SVD, BERT, ViT, or CLIP is a plus.
Experience with Self-Supervised Learning methods is also a plus.

Integral Ad Science (IAS) is a leading global media measurement and optimization platform that delivers the industry‚Äôs most actionable data to drive superior results for the world‚Äôs largest advertisers, publishers, and media platforms. IAS‚Äôs software provides comprehensive and enriched data that ensures ads are seen by real people in safe and suitable environments, while improving return on ad spend for advertisers and yield for publishers. Our mission is to be the global benchmark for trust and transparency in digital media quality. For more information, visit integralads.com.

IAS is an equal opportunity employer, committed to our diversity and inclusiveness. We will consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, nationality, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, disability or age. We strongly encourage women, people of color, members of the LGBTQIA community, people with disabilities and veterans to apply.

We collect personal information (PI) from you in connection with your application for employment or engagement with IAS, including the following categories of PI: identifiers, personal records, commercial information, professional or employment or engagement information, non-public education records, and inferences drawn from your PI. We collect your PI for our purposes, including performing services and operations related to your potential employment or engagement. For additional details or if you have questions, contact us at compliance@integralads.com.
To learn more about us, please visit http://integralads.com/

Attention agency/3rd party recruiters: IAS does not accept any unsolicited resumes or candidate profiles. If you are interested in becoming an IAS recruiting partner, please send an email introducing your company to recruitingagencies@integralads.com. We will get back to you if there's interest in a partnership.

Integral Ad Science (IAS) is a global technology and data company that builds verification, optimization, and analytics solutions for the advertising industry and we‚Äôre looking for a Machine Learning Scientist (ML) Intern to join our Multimedia Core Service team in Modena, Italy. If you are excited by technology that has the power to handle hundreds of thousands of transactions per second
column2: collect tens of billions of events each day
column3:
and evaluate thousands of data-points in real-time all while responding in just a few milliseconds, then IAS is the place for you!

As a ML Scientist Intern you will work on advancing the understanding and application of dimensionality reduction techniques for sparse feature matrices generated by semantic engines. You will prototype, implement and evaluate a range of dimensionality reduction approaches. The second phase of the project will involve comparing the reduced-dimensional embedding spaces with existing pre-trained embeddings, to study similarities, overlaps, and differences in representation. This analysis will provide insights into how rule-based semantic features compare with context-aware neural representations This internship is an opportunity for you to gain practical experience with deep learning, interacting with large scale production environments and having the opportunity to research novel methods that can push the state of the art of media understanding and content evaluation.

What you‚Äôll get to do:

  • Conduct in-depth research and experimentation on a wide array of dimensionality reduction techniques, with a particular focus on their applicability to sparse feature matrices commonly produced by semantic engines. This will involve prototyping, implementing, and rigorously evaluating methods such as Principal Component Analysis (PCA), Truncated Singular Value Decomposition (SVD), and neural embedding models (e.g., autoencoders).
  • Leverage these feature representations to construct and train machine learning models that can effectively address a variety of downstream tasks, such as classification, regression, clustering, or anomaly detection.
  • Work with the framework of your choice, e.g. PyTorch, TensorFlow, etc.
  • Integrate machine learning models into production systems.
  • Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in the field of machine learning and contribute to knowledge sharing within the team.


You should apply if you have most of this experience:

  • Currently pursuing a Master‚Äôs or PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, Computer Engineering, Statistics, or a related field.
  • Familiarity with machine learning and deep learning methods.
  • Proficiency in Python and experience with libraries such as NumPy, SciPy, Pandas, PyTorch, and TensorFlow.
  • Familiarity with SVD, BERT, ViT, or CLIP is a plus.
  • Experience with Self-Supervised Learning methods is also a plus.


About Integral Ad Science

Integral Ad Science (IAS) is a leading global media measurement and optimization platform that delivers the industry‚Äôs most actionable data to drive superior results for the world‚Äôs largest advertisers, publishers, and media platforms. IAS‚Äôs software provides comprehensive and enriched data that ensures ads are seen by real people in safe and suitable environments, while improving return on ad spend for advertisers and yield for publishers. Our mission is to be the global benchmark for trust and transparency in digital media quality. For more information, visit integralads.com.

Equal Opportunity Employer:

IAS is an equal opportunity employer, committed to our diversity and inclusiveness. We will consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, nationality, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, disability or age. We strongly encourage women, people of color, members of the LGBTQIA community, people with disabilities and veterans to apply.

California Applicant Pre-Collection Notice:

We collect personal information (PI) from you in connection with your application for employment or engagement with IAS, including the following categories of PI: identifiers, personal records, commercial information, professional or employment or engagement information, non-public education records, and inferences drawn from your PI. We collect your PI for our purposes, including performing services and operations related to your potential employment or engagement. For additional details or if you have questions, contact us at compliance@integralads.com.

To learn more about us, please visit http://integralads.com/

Attention agency/3rd party recruiters: IAS does not accept any unsolicited resumes or candidate profiles. If you are interested in becoming an IAS recruiting partner, please send an email introducing your company to recruitingagencies@integralads.com. We will get back to you if there's interest in a partnership.

4196521525,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/ai-software-development-engineer-at-gruppo-san-donato-4196521525?position=9&pageNum=2&refId=EXQctpSzXN1EWfcxKQNMuw%3D%3D&trackingId=vaKcXc3iNJk9AsZZwgbPYA%3D%3D,AI & Software Development Engineer,Gruppo San Donato,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Gruppo San Donato √® alla ricerca di una risorsa da inserire come AI & Software Development Engineer desideroso di entrare a far parte di un contesto sfidante e in crescita.
La figura del AI & Software Development Engineer verr√† inserita nel team di Segreteria di Presidenza con l‚Äôobiettivo di sviluppare ed ottimizzare i prodotti basati sull‚Äôintelligenza artificiale.

Il candidato ideale √® motivato e dotato di una forte passione per la tecnologia e l‚Äôinnovazione, √® in possesso di una solida comprensione del linguaggio di programmazione Python, preferibilmente con un background statistico e con un‚Äôesperienza/formazione pregressa come Data Analyst.
E' importante specificare che i dati su cui lavorer√† la risorsa non sono dati sanitari.
La risorsa inserita dovr√† occuparsi di:
Contribuire allo sviluppo ed al perfezionamento di prodotti AI, collaborando strettamente con il team di prodotto e tecnologia
Implementare modelli e algoritmi di machine learning utilizzando Python
Analizzare grandi set di dati per trarne insights e guidare le decisioni di sviluppo del prodotto
Testare e validare i modelli di previsione per garantire l‚Äôaccuratezza e l‚Äôefficacia
Preparare report dettagliati sui risultati e le performance dei modelli AI
Mantenere un aggiornamento continuo sulle ultime tendenze e tecnologie con particolare attenzione al campo AI
