4204807632,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-machine-learning-engineer-at-motork-4204807632?position=4&pageNum=5&refId=OfBi2onRErmCkQNrQ8ZSmg%3D%3D&trackingId=QbaOnBcizFMUsupbl1GEQg%3D%3D,Senior Machine Learning Engineer,MotorK,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","MotorK is the leading sales and marketing technology company in Europe, specialized in the automotive sector. At MotorK our mission is to empower manufacturers and dealerships to sell more with innovative, cloud-based products and services to offer the best digital customer experience.

We are on a fast and ambitious trajectory and serving 90% of the automotive manufacturers. To continue our growth, we are hiring new talents. If you want to spark the future of the automotive world, join us.

As a Machine Learning Engineer at MotorK, you will be pivotal in driving innovation and improving customer experience. You will develop and deploy machine learning models to power automotive maintenance prediction, product classification, and marketing asset generation. Your work will directly impact the company's revenue, customer satisfaction, and overall business success.
Design, develop, and train machine learning models, including recommendation systems, predictive analytics, and classification algorithms.
Collaborate with data engineers to extract, clean, and transform large datasets from various sources.
Deploy models into production environments, ensuring scalability and reliability.
Conduct A/B testing and other experiments to evaluate the impact of machine learning models on key metrics.
Work closely with product managers and software engineers to translate business requirements into technical solutions.
Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior ML engineers on best practices and business-oriented problem-solving.
5+ years experience as a machine learning engineer or data scientist in a digital product environment
Strong foundation in machine learning, including deep learning and statistical modelling.
Proficiency in Python and relevant ML libraries (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, or XGBoost).
Experience with cloud platforms and MLOps, preferably AWS.
Ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Passion for data-driven innovation and a desire to make a significant impact.
Opportunity to develop and move within the company

MotorK is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any kind. Our company is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at MotorK are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, colour, religion or belief, age, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

MotorK is the leading sales and marketing technology company in Europe, specialized in the automotive sector. At MotorK our mission is to empower manufacturers and dealerships to sell more with innovative, cloud-based products and services to offer the best digital customer experience.

We are on a fast and ambitious trajectory and serving 90% of the automotive manufacturers. To continue our growth, we are hiring new talents. If you want to spark the future of the automotive world, join us.



About the Role

As a Machine Learning Engineer at MotorK, you will be pivotal in driving innovation and improving customer experience. You will develop and deploy machine learning models to power automotive maintenance prediction, product classification, and marketing asset generation. Your work will directly impact the company's revenue, customer satisfaction, and overall business success.


What You'll Do

  • Design, develop, and train machine learning models, including recommendation systems, predictive analytics, and classification algorithms.
  • Collaborate with data engineers to extract, clean, and transform large datasets from various sources.
  • Deploy models into production environments, ensuring scalability and reliability.
  • Conduct A/B testing and other experiments to evaluate the impact of machine learning models on key metrics.
  • Work closely with product managers and software engineers to translate business requirements into technical solutions.
  • Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior ML engineers on best practices and business-oriented problem-solving.


Requirements

  • 5+ years experience as a machine learning engineer or data scientist in a digital product environment
  • Strong foundation in machine learning, including deep learning and statistical modelling.
  • Proficiency in Python and relevant ML libraries (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, or XGBoost).
  • Experience with cloud platforms and MLOps, preferably AWS.
  • Ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Passion for data-driven innovation and a desire to make a significant impact.


Benefits

Working pattern and location

  • 40 hours per week, permanent contract

  • Supportare il team di Data Engineering nello sviluppo e nell'implementazione di soluzioni avanzate di gestione e analisi dei dati.



Requisiti:

  • 3 anni di esperienza nell'adozione di framework ML end-to-end e personalizzazione di modelli in base alle necessit√† progettuali.

  • Solida conoscenza della raccolta, modellazione e gestione dei dati.

  • Preferibile esperienza in Data Engineering, con competenze in:

    • Strumenti Big Data (Spark, Kafka, etc.).

    • Google Cloud Platform, Airflow e Python.

  • Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese, sia scritta che parlata.

  • Preferibile certificazione Google Professional Machine Learning Engineer.





Benefit:

  • Modalit√† di lavoro ibrida con flessibilit√† smart working.

  • Percorsi di crescita e sviluppo professionale..

  • Spazio di lavoro immerso nella natura nelle Marche, aperto anche a familiari e amici.

  • Iniziative di sostenibilit√† e impatto sociale.

  • Rimborso chilometrico e possibilit√† di utilizzo di auto aziendale per trasferte.

  • Contratto a tempo indeterminato con retribuzione e incentivi in linea con l'esperienza.

Se vuoi far parte di un team innovativo e lavorare su progetti all'avanguardia nel mondo del Machine Learning, invia la tua candidatura!


Montreal Associates is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

4150242919,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/graduate-program-2025-data-science-analytics-at-nexi-group-4150242919?position=9&pageNum=5&refId=OfBi2onRErmCkQNrQ8ZSmg%3D%3D&trackingId=%2Bgf7xKATgJHNH%2FVJE9nuYg%3D%3D,Graduate Program 2025 - Data Science & Analytics,Nexi Group,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Are you looking to kick off your career journey?
Do you like the idea of joining the European PayTech?
If so, you are at the right place!

Our graduate program offers you the chance to create your unique career path within our diverse international team, operating in more than 25 countries. Rotate among different departments, learn from experienced professionals, and make a difference by working on real business cases.
Our Graduate Program is more than a learning path - it's a journey where you will work on real business cases and have a direct impact on business results.
Permanent position in one of the business departments from the start of your employment.
Two rotations between different business departments during the 12-month program.
Project Management and Communication training path after the first six months.
Continuous learning and skill improvement through structured training sessions at our Digital PayTech University.
Opportunity to develop business ideas, implement them, and build your network of stakeholders within a group of highly skilled business leaders from all over Europe.
Exciting Opportunities in Data Science and Analytics

As part of our Data Science and Analytics team, you will contribute to data-driven decision-making in the Paytech industry. You'll work in positions such as Data Scientist, Data Engineer, and BI Data Engineer.

In this department, you'll analyse large datasets, transform data into insights, develop predictive models, and create data visualisations to support business strategies. This role offers the opportunity to work with cutting-edge tools and technologies, enhancing your analytical skills and significantly impacting our company's success.

As part of our selection process, the top candidates will be invited to participate in an exciting hackathon at our office location. This is a fantastic opportunity to showcase your skills, collaborate with peers, and potentially secure a spot on our team. Stay tuned for more details!
What makes you stand out as the ideal participant for this program?
If you see yourself in the description that follows, you should definitely take the first step and apply!
You have a master's degree in Engineering, STEM or Economics & Business, graduated within the last 12 months or will graduate in 2025.
You are a career starter with no more than one year of working experience.
You are fluent in English and in the local language of the country you are applying for (any additional language is beneficial).

You can easily imagine working in an international environment and actively collaborating with colleagues from all over Europe (if you have study or work-related international experience from abroad, that will be considered a beneficial qualification).
You are committed to your work, have an exciting university career with proven great results, enjoy learning new things, feel confident to own projects by yourself and like being part of a team.
For you, formal training is a starting point - you always look for more and want to make a difference in everything you work on.
Don't miss out on this amazing opportunity. Apply today and discover what's in it for you!
We are committed to creating a diverse culture where talents from all walks of life can feel like they truly belong. By applying to our Graduate Program, you're one step closer to joining us.
We're excited to learn more about you!

Are you looking to kick off your career journey?

Do you like the idea of joining the European PayTech?


If so, you are at the right place!


Our graduate program offers you the chance to create your unique career path within our diverse international team, operating in more than 25 countries. Rotate among different departments, learn from experienced professionals, and make a difference by working on real business cases.


About the program

Our Graduate Program is more than a learning path - it's a journey where you will work on real business cases and have a direct impact on business results.


What can you expect?

  • Permanent position in one of the business departments from the start of your employment.
  • Two rotations between different business departments during the 12-month program.
  • Project Management and Communication training path after the first six months.
  • Continuous learning and skill improvement through structured training sessions at our Digital PayTech University.
  • Opportunity to develop business ideas, implement them, and build your network of stakeholders within a group of highly skilled business leaders from all over Europe.


Exciting Opportunities in Data Science and Analytics

As part of our Data Science and Analytics team, you will contribute to data-driven decision-making in the Paytech industry. You'll work in positions such as Data Scientist, Data Engineer, and BI Data Engineer.


In this department, you'll analyse large datasets, transform data into insights, develop predictive models, and create data visualisations to support business strategies. This role offers the opportunity to work with cutting-edge tools and technologies, enhancing your analytical skills and significantly impacting our company's success.


As part of our selection process, the top candidates will be invited to participate in an exciting hackathon at our office location. This is a fantastic opportunity to showcase your skills, collaborate with peers, and potentially secure a spot on our team. Stay tuned for more details!


What makes you stand out as the ideal participant for this program?

If you see yourself in the description that follows, you should definitely take the first step and apply!

  • You have a master's degree in Engineering, STEM or Economics &
column2:
Business, graduated within the last 12 months or will graduate in 2025.
  • You are a career starter with no more than one year of working experience.
  • You are fluent in English and in the local language of the country you are applying for (any additional language is beneficial).
  • You can easily imagine working in an international environment and actively collaborating with colleagues from all over Europe (if you have study or work-related international experience from abroad, that will be considered a beneficial qualification).
  • You are committed to your work, have an exciting university career with proven great results, enjoy learning new things, feel confident to own projects by yourself and like being part of a team.
  • For you, formal training is a starting point - you always look for more and want to make a difference in everything you work on.


    • Apply Now!

    Don't miss out on this amazing opportunity. Apply today and discover what's in it for you!


    We are committed to creating a diverse culture where talents from all walks of life can feel like they truly belong. By applying to our Graduate Program, you're one step closer to joining us.


    We're excited to learn more about you!

4201845462,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-at-warman-o-brien-4201845462?position=1&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=Y1LpzKSnyINfHCakvc6coA%3D%3D,Data Scientist,Warman O'Brien,"Brussels Region, Belgium","We are looking for a Medior Data Scientist to join our team and support the rollout of a cutting-edge data reduction system for a prominent pharma client. This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to a large-scale data strategy, helping to shape data structures, integrate data, and develop new analytical functionalities to enhance data visualization.

As part of the Data Strategy & Reduction Group, you will play a pivotal role in improving analytical capabilities, ensuring robust data transformation, and enabling seamless integration across systems. Your work will directly support the broader data strategy, delivering actionable insights and driving innovation in the pharmaceutical sector.
Develop and optimize data models to support data reduction and insights generation.
Manage and integrate efficient data pipelines.
Collaborate with business analysts to understand data requirements and provide effective technical solutions.
Implement advanced analytical models and statistical techniques to enhance data processing and visualization, specifically within Spotfire.
Design and deploy automated workflows for scalable, impactful insights.
Contribute to data quality initiatives, including anomaly detection, data cleansing, and validation.
Develop and refine best practices for data science applications in a pharmaceutical environment.
Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior team members (if applicable).
Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a relevant field (e.g., Computer Science, Data Science, Bioinformatics).
3+ years of experience in data science, preferably in the life sciences or pharmaceutical sector.
Strong expertise in data management, visualization, and analytics concepts.
Proficiency with Tibco software platform, especially for data visualization (Tibco Spotfire, Tableau, Power BI are a plus).
Solid programming skills in Python, R, or SQL.
Experience with large datasets, ETL processes, and optimizing data pipelines.
Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to translate complex data challenges into clear, actionable solutions.
Strong communication skills and the ability to present technical insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Fluent in English (French is a plus).
Availability to work from the office at least once a week.
Experience with cloud-based platforms and agile methodologies is an advantage.
Familiarity with laboratory workflows, scientific data handling, and regulatory standards is desirable.

We are looking for a Medior Data Scientist to join our team and support the rollout of a cutting-edge data reduction system for a prominent pharma client. This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to a large-scale data strategy, helping to shape data structures, integrate data, and develop new analytical functionalities to enhance data visualization.


As part of the Data Strategy &
column2:
Reduction Group, you will play a pivotal role in improving analytical capabilities, ensuring robust data transformation, and enabling seamless integration across systems. Your work will directly support the broader data strategy, delivering actionable insights and driving innovation in the pharmaceutical sector.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop and optimize data models to support data reduction and insights generation.
  • Manage and integrate efficient data pipelines.
  • Collaborate with business analysts to understand data requirements and provide effective technical solutions.
  • Implement advanced analytical models and statistical techniques to enhance data processing and visualization, specifically within Spotfire.
  • Design and deploy automated workflows for scalable, impactful insights.
  • Contribute to data quality initiatives, including anomaly detection, data cleansing, and validation.
  • Develop and refine best practices for data science applications in a pharmaceutical environment.
  • Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior team members (if applicable).


What We're Looking For:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a relevant field (e.g., Computer Science, Data Science, Bioinformatics).
  • 3+ years of experience in data science, preferably in the life sciences or pharmaceutical sector.
  • Strong expertise in data management, visualization, and analytics concepts.
  • Proficiency with Tibco software platform, especially for data visualization (Tibco Spotfire, Tableau, Power BI are a plus).
  • Solid programming skills in Python, R, or SQL.
  • Experience with large datasets, ETL processes, and optimizing data pipelines.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to translate complex data challenges into clear, actionable solutions.
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to present technical insights to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Fluent in English (French is a plus).
  • Availability to work from the office at least once a week.
  • Experience with cloud-based platforms and agile methodologies is an advantage.
  • Familiarity with laboratory workflows, scientific data handling, and regulatory standards is desirable.


Contract Details

  • 6-12 month Contract (Extendable)
  • Work with leading Pharma
  • Daily Rate: 350‚Ç¨-400‚Ç¨
  • Start Date: May 2025
  • Interviews as soon as possible

  • Work closely with data engineers to ensure data integrity and availability
  • Contribute to the development of the company‚Äôs data strategy and best practices


ü§ì Skills &

qualifications

4192038057,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-at-engie-global-energy-management-sales-gems-4192038057?position=5&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=CC%2F8Ay3yGNP9JLxQOYK3QQ%3D%3D,Data Scientist,ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales (GEMS),"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","About US (GEMS):

ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales (GEMS) provides energy supply solutions and risk management services to support its clients through their decarbonization journey, while optimizing ENGIE‚Äôs assets and contributing to value creation.

ENGIE is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services with a leading energy management business, piloted by its entity ""Global Energy Management & Sales"" who built its savoir-faire managing the Group‚Äôs large and diverse asset portfolio over 20+ years.

3,600 employees around the world develop our solutions, through +20 international business platforms. We cover the full energy mix: renewable and thermal power, natural gas & LNG, biomass, environmental products. Our experts provide tailor made solutions based on a wide range of savoir-faire in energy management with a strong focus on decarbonation and decentralization.

Our 190,000 clients span the entire value chain: producers, asset developers, financial players, utilities, distributors and industrials. Our global reach and strong local presence enable us to offer these diverse clients tailor-made services and respond to rapid changes in mature or emerging markets alike.
At GEMS we encourage breakthrough results, team spirit, curiosity and innovation while preserving the right work/life balance for you.
More info on GEMS Hub ( https://gems.engie.com ) or LinkedIn ( https://www.linkedin.com/company/engie-global-energy-management-solutions ).

Context: The position belongs to the Quantitative Data Analysts team in Belgium (Brussels) specifically dedicated to assist the management of risks for belgian B2C and B2B Energy Suppliers. As a member of the quantitative analysts community of the Business Platform Downstream, one can also contribute to transversal projects impacting the activity of other commercial BUs. The main missions associated with the position are :
Based on data collection and analysis, to build models, tools, processes and data representations, that are used to manage the commodity risks linked to the dynamics of a Supply portfolio
The purpose of this work is to operate and optimize costing, forecasting, sourcing and hedging strategies, within a defined mandate

The quantitative analyst / data scientist will do the design, but also the development and ensure the delivery of these models and tools. Beyond that, he will also provide scientific expertise for bespoke analysis, related to data or models. Role:
The daily responsibilities of the new role will include:
Contribute to the development of the tools, models, process and portfolio/data representation used for
Representation of all commodity exposures and associated risks (evolution of the commercial position, climatic impact on short term consumption forecasts, ...)
Ensure the run of models and derived operations
Provide BUs B2C and B2B Belgium with a deep knowledge of its commodity sales portfolios (Natural Gas, Power and Certificates) and optimally structure the portfolio representation
Use large range of data to ensure correct representation
Promote good practice, especially around data and code
Ensure code quality by following general rules and standards
Interact with other quantitative analysts/data scientists, to exchange about models, data, business or technical topics beyond the team
Strong scientific background: mathematics (probability/statistics), data science, machine learning, ideally with good command of time series forecasting
Strong skills in software (ideally Python) programming and related tools (versioning, etc.)
Willingness to embrace data handling and operational analytics
Ability to explain and convey messages about complex issues to non-experts in a simple and pedagogic way
Interest for the Energy markets and Energy-transition topics
Knowledge of modern data science platforms and engines such as Databricks and Spark is a plus
Team-player, Transparent, Favor collaboration and working together
University degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics or Physics
Ideally 1-2 years of experience in the development of modelling tools, ideally with a good knowledge of electricity & gas markets
F lu ent in En g lish
If you meet these requirements, then you are the talent we are looking for. Do not waste time!
Apply by attaching your updated CV, regardless your gender.

ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales is committed to create a gender-neutral environment that unlocks the potential of everyone and provides equal employment opportunities for all individuals. All our positions are open to people with disabilities, please let your recruiter know if you need reasonable accommodations to be able to participate in the recruitment process, they will be happy to assist you.

Our group is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services. Context: The position belongs to the Quantitative Data Analysts team in Belgium (Brussels) specifically dedicated to assist the management of risks for belgian B2C and B2B Energy Suppliers. As a member of the quantitative analysts community of the Business Platform Downstream, one can also contribute to transversal projects impacting the activity of other commercial BUs. The main missions associated with the position are :

  • Based on data collection and analysis, to build models, tools, processes and data representations, that are used to manage the commodity risks linked to the dynamics of a Supply portfolio
  • The purpose of this work is to operate and optimize costing, forecasting, sourcing and hedging strategies, within a defined mandate

The quantitative analyst / data scientist will do the design, but also the development and ensure the delivery of these models and tools. Beyond that, he will also provide scientific expertise for bespoke analysis, related to data or models. Role:

The daily responsibilities of the new role will include:

  • Contribute to the development of the tools, models, process and portfolio/data representation used for
    • Representation of all commodity exposures and associated risks (evolution of the commercial position, climatic impact on short term consumption forecasts, ...)
    • New commercial offers
    • Customer behavior analysis
  • Ensure the run of models and derived operations
  • Provide BUs B2C and B2B Belgium with a deep knowledge of its commodity sales portfolios (Natural Gas, Power and Certificates) and optimally structure the portfolio representation
  • Use large range of data to ensure correct representation
  • Promote good practice, especially around data and code
  • Ensure code quality by following general rules and standards
  • Interact with other quantitative analysts/data scientists, to exchange about models, data, business or technical topics beyond the team
Hard skills:

  • Must have:
    • Strong scientific background: mathematics (probability/statistics), data science, machine learning, ideally with good command of time series forecasting
    • Strong skills in software (ideally Python) programming and related tools (versioning, etc.)
    • Willingness to embrace data handling and operational analytics
    • Practical thinking, hands-on approach
    • Ability to explain and convey messages about complex issues to non-experts in a simple and pedagogic way
  • Good to have:
    • Interest for the Energy markets and Energy-transition topics
    • Knowledge of modern data science platforms and engines such as Databricks and Spark is a plus
Soft skills:

  • Must have:
    • Team-player, Transparent, Favor collaboration and working together


  • Good to have:
    • Practical thinking
Education and professional background:

  • University degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics or Physics
  • Ideally 1-2 years of experience in the development of modelling tools, ideally with a good knowledge of electricity &
column7:
gas markets

Languages:

  • F lu ent in En g lish

Travels:

  • Occasional travels (mostly to CWE countries)

If you meet these requirements, then you are the talent we are looking for. Do not waste time!

Apply by attaching your updated CV, regardless your gender.

O√π allez-vous travailler ?

4156956547,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-data-scientist-at-n-side-4156956547?position=11&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=IiLqqBrRl1mN3eKcMck%2F9w%3D%3D,Junior Data Scientist,N-SIDE,Brussels Metropolitan Area,"N-SIDE Careers Junior Data Scientist
We are looking for a Junior Data Scientist to join our Energy department based in Louvain-la-Neuve.

N-SIDE is a world leader in increasing the efficiency of life sciences and energy industries by providing software and services that optimize the use of natural resources, facilitating the transition to a more sustainable world.

To achieve this, N-SIDE leverages its deep industry knowledge, technical expertise, and understanding of applied mathematics to help global pharmaceutical and energy companies anticipate, adapt, and optimize their decisions.
In the energy industry, N-SIDE helps electricity market and grid operators in enabling a safer and faster transition toward renewable sources.

As a Junior Data Scientist, you will be part of our Energy team. You will deliver machine learning-based software solutions and consultancy services. You will contribute to innovative and challenging advanced analytics projects for various European Transmission System operators, power exchanges, and possibly market participants, helping the different actors better address the complex challenges of the energy transition.

You will provide hands-on contributions to analytical projects for various European Transmission System Operators, power exchanges, and possibly market participants, as part of our internal projects teams of power market experts and energy data scientists

You will develop AI-based Python prototypes, maintain and improve production code, perform data engineering tasks (e.g. extract, transform, load), run simulations, analyze results, and extract key findings. While most projects will have a strong data science focus, you may also be exposed to other analytical techniques (e.g. optimization, power flow simulations) depending on business needs and priorities.
You will communicate insights effectively by preparing reports, slides, and presentations for our customers that translate complex analytical findings into actionable business recommendations.
You will engage with customers to understand their needs, gather feedback, and propose improvements and ideas while explaining advanced analytics concepts in a clear, and business-oriented manner.
You will contribute to the maintenance, support, and continuous improvement of our in-house forecasting solution based on Machine Learning

You will support clients in their use of our Energy applications. This will constitute a minor portion of your responsibilities, yet may occasionally (one weekend every five weeks) require completion outside of regular business hours (with additional compensation and/or benefits provided).
You hold a Master‚Äôs degree in Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Energy Economics, or a related field, with a strong focus on Data Science.
You are a young graduate or have a maximum of 1-2 years years of experience
You have a solid foundation in machine learning and artificial intelligence, with a strong analytical mindset and a passion for the field
You are proficient in Python and can efficiently develop prototypes to perform data-driven analyses.
You can effectively communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders, demonstrating a customer-focused approach and a genuine enthusiasm for assisting users.
You possess strong written and verbal communication skills and can clearly articulate insights and findings.
You are customer-oriented, results-driven, and have a problem-solving mindset
You are curious, proactive, and a strong team player, eager to collaborate and continuously learn.

You are interested in expanding your knowledge of the energy sector, particularly in electricity markets and power system operations. While prior experience in the field is a plus, it is not required.
You have fully professional proficiency in English

At N-SIDE, we develop leaders. What‚Äôs important for us is that you grow and learn, because we care about you, which is N-SIDE‚Äôs hallmark.You will be part of a fun and flexible work environment in which creativity, freedom and initiative are rewarded.

You will join a diverse team of over 200 passionate engineers, computer scientists, and business experts from 30+ different nationalities, with 25% holding PhDs. Together, we are committed to making a meaningful impact toward a more sustainable future.
N-SIDE offers a great compensation package, which includes a company car and full range of benefits which can be personalised thanks to our Flex Income Plan.

At N-SIDE we value diversity. All candidates will be treated equally without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, citizenship, disability, gender identity, marital or family status, veteran status or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law. N-SIDE will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics.
We are headquartered in Belgium with offices in the USA and Japan. The company is certified B Corporation, Best Managed Company by Deloitte Belgium, ISO 14001 and ISO 27001.
Motivated to join our team and bring N-SIDE to the next level?
We are looking forward to receiving your application!

We are committed to respecting your privacy and protecting your personal data, including any information which allows us to identify you as an individual person. N-SIDE uses the applicant‚Äôs personal data in a fair and lawful manner. N-SIDE collects and processes personal data in accordance with the privacy statement available in the privacy policy. Personal information (applicant data) submitted by an applicant will only be used by N-SIDE to ensure an effective recruitment process and will be used for recruitment purposes only.

N-SIDE Careers Junior Data Scientist

We are looking for a Junior Data Scientist to join our Energy department based in Louvain-la-Neuve.

Who We Are

N-SIDE is a world leader in increasing the efficiency of life sciences and energy industries by providing software and services that optimize the use of natural resources, facilitating the transition to a more sustainable world.

To achieve this, N-SIDE leverages its deep industry knowledge, technical expertise, and understanding of applied mathematics to help global pharmaceutical and energy companies anticipate, adapt, and optimize their decisions.

In the energy industry, N-SIDE helps electricity market and grid operators in enabling a safer and faster transition toward renewable sources.

As a Junior Data Scientist, you will be part of our Energy team. You will deliver machine learning-based software solutions and consultancy services. You will contribute to innovative and challenging advanced analytics projects for various European Transmission System operators, power exchanges, and possibly market participants, helping the different actors better address the complex challenges of the energy transition.

What You‚Äôll Do

  • You will provide hands-on contributions to analytical projects for various European Transmission System Operators, power exchanges, and possibly market participants, as part of our internal projects teams of power market experts and energy data scientists
  • You will develop AI-based Python prototypes, maintain and improve production code, perform data engineering tasks (e.g. extract, transform, load), run simulations, analyze results, and extract key findings. While most projects will have a strong data science focus, you may also be exposed to other analytical techniques (e.g. optimization, power flow simulations) depending on business needs and priorities.
  • You will communicate insights effectively by preparing reports, slides, and presentations for our customers that translate complex analytical findings into actionable business recommendations.
  • You will engage with customers to understand their needs, gather feedback, and propose improvements and ideas while explaining advanced analytics concepts in a clear, and business-oriented manner.
  • You will contribute to the maintenance, support, and continuous improvement of our in-house forecasting solution based on Machine Learning
  • You will support clients in their use of our Energy applications. This will constitute a minor portion of your responsibilities, yet may occasionally (one weekend every five weeks) require completion outside of regular business hours (with additional compensation and/or benefits provided).

About You

  • You hold a Master‚Äôs degree in Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Energy Economics, or a related field, with a strong focus on Data Science.
  • You are a young graduate or have a maximum of 1-2 years years of experience
  • You have a solid foundation in machine learning and artificial intelligence, with a strong analytical mindset and a passion for the field
  • You are proficient in Python and can efficiently develop prototypes to perform data-driven analyses.
  • You can effectively communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders, demonstrating a customer-focused approach and a genuine enthusiasm for assisting users.
  • You possess strong written and verbal communication skills and can clearly articulate insights and findings.
  • You are customer-oriented, results-driven, and have a problem-solving mindset
  • You are curious, proactive, and a strong team player, eager to collaborate and continuously learn.
  • You are interested in expanding your knowledge of the energy sector, particularly in electricity markets and power system operations. While prior experience in the field is a plus, it is not required.
  • You have fully professional proficiency in English

Travel: 0%

Start date: ASAP

Our offer

At N-SIDE, we develop leaders. What‚Äôs important for us is that you grow and learn, because we care about you, which is N-SIDE‚Äôs hallmark.You will be part of a fun and flexible work environment in which creativity, freedom and initiative are rewarded.

You will join a diverse team of over 200 passionate engineers, computer scientists, and business experts from 30+ different nationalities, with 25% holding PhDs. Together, we are committed to making a meaningful impact toward a more sustainable future.

N-SIDE offers a great compensation package, which includes a company car and full range of benefits which can be personalised thanks to our Flex Income Plan.

At N-SIDE we value diversity. All candidates will be treated equally without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, citizenship, disability, gender identity, marital or family status, veteran status or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law. N-SIDE will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics.

We are headquartered in Belgium with offices in the USA and Japan. The company is certified B Corporation, Best Managed Company by Deloitte Belgium, ISO 14001 and ISO 27001.

Motivated to join our team and bring N-SIDE to the next level?

We are looking forward to receiving your application!

We are committed to respecting your privacy and protecting your personal data, including any information which allows us to identify you as an individual person. N-SIDE uses the applicant‚Äôs personal data in a fair and lawful manner. N-SIDE collects and processes personal data in accordance with the privacy statement available in the privacy policy. Personal information (applicant data) submitted by an applicant will only be used by N-SIDE to ensure an effective recruitment process and will be used for recruitment purposes only.

The AI Scientist at Keytrade Bank is a critical role in leveraging the potential of artificial intelligence to drive innovation, efficiency, and compliance within the bank. This individual will design, develop, and maintain AI systems while addressing governance, compliance, and ethical considerations. They will also enhance existing AI products and integrate advanced cloud-based technologies, ensuring Keytrade Bank remains a leader in the responsible and effective use of AI within the financial sector.
The AI Scientist will report to the AI Innovation Lead and collaborate closely with the data feature team.
Design, implement and test AI models to enhance decision-making, customer experiences, and operational efficiencies.
Maintain, optimize and test existing AI solutions, ensuring they adapt to emerging technologies and evolving business needs.
Collaborate with teams to integrate AI systems with UI technologies, such as Mendix, to enhance usability and functionality.
Implement and enhance MLOps/DevOps best practices for streamlined development, deployment, and monitoring of AI solutions.
Ensure responsible and ethical use of AI at Keytrade Bank, following guidelines of EU regulations (EU AI Act, GDPR‚Ä¶)
Help in establishing policies to govern the lifecycle of AI models, including accountability, fairness, and transparency.
Work with cross-functional teams to embed governance practices into the deployment of AI systems.
Collaborate with internal security and risk teams to assess and mitigate AI-related risks.
Stay informed about emerging trends in AI and cloud computing to recommend innovative solutions.
Translate technical AI concepts into actionable insights for stakeholders, including non-technical teams.
Support product teams in implementing AI-driven solutions and aligning them with business objectives.
Provide insights on AI products, data and AI governance, and emerging technology trends to colleagues and stakeholders through targeted workshops and ‚Äúlunch and learn‚Äù sessions.
Participate in training sessions, conferences, and industry events to enhance professional growth.
Provide training sessions as trainer in our data & AI Academy.
Proficiency in Python, SQL, and familiarity with machine learning libraries (e.g., scikit-learn, TensorFlo

Keytrade Bank is a young and dynamic organization with a lean structure, that evolves in an Agile ecosystem. The tempo and the atmosphere are upbeat and no day goes by without an element of fun!
The company works in an agile setup with a lot of flexibility regarding remote work. This means that you will be guaranteed at least 50% homework with a high degree of flexibility.
Offices are in Watermael-Boitsfort in a peaceful, green surrounding.
A competitive salary with extra-legal advantages such as meal vouchers, group insurance, health insurance and many other.
Continued education and access to trainings.
Stepping stone for a continued career within Keytrade Bank.
Open, inclusive culture and dynamic working environment.

Do you want to belong to one of the most advanced Data Science groups in the industry, developing advanced AI, ML and optimization algorithms, and applying Operations Research techniques?
Do you have passion for technology and desire to learn and grow continuously?

A career in IT Data Science & Analytics at P&G will build your Data Science and Analytics skills, develop your ability to influence and think strategically and will provide you a breadth of experience across multiple internal businesses and type of work (whether you do Analytics for Marketing, Sales, Supply Chain).
As a Data Scientist for the Supply Chain you will belong to an award-winning Analytics / Operations Research community that is global in scope, and operates across P&G‚Äôs supply chains.
Find out more about IT at P&G at www.youtube.com/watch?v=1ial3aeA9SE .
Our Data Scientists in IT Data & Analytics at P&G are:

Passionate about Analytics: the ability to mine terabytes of data, develop models and algorithms to derive actionable insights, and then translate those insights into business is important in our work. In this role you will provide consulting services to P&G business units in Europe, India, Middle East and Africa
column2: you will use mathematical modelling, decision analysis and simulation to provide business insights to various aspects of the supply network (supply chain design, inventory modelling, capacity analysis, distribution flow and purchasing analytics). You will get to know a wide variety of supply chains and you will influence multi million-dollar decisions. You will act as primary enthusiast for the power of technology, data, and predictive and prescriptive analysis.

column1: Effective communicators, self-driven and able to drive insights into actions that improve business results. Interpersonal and communication skills are crucial to thrive in a multi-functional leadership team. Your job is to communicate complex data or algorithms into simple conclusions that will empower others to act based on the insights you derive.

Technically Capable: Data Scientists ‚Äúroll up their sleeves‚Äù, using data visualization (Spotfire, Tableau), and analytic tools (R, Python, SAS, JMP, Hive/Impala, etc.) to grasp the business building insights in our mountains of data. You should be adept at applying such technologies for solving ad hoc business problems, innovating on potential future solutions, and working with technology partners to translate your innovations into robust, scaled, analytic solutions.
YOU ARE THE RIGHT FIT IF YOU ARE/HAVE:
A Master in a quantitative degree (Operation Research, Statistics, Systems Engineering, Decision Sciences, Computer Science, Applied Math, Economics etc.)
Strong technical & analytical skill (R, SAS, SQL, optimization, simulation, predictive modeling etc)
Great leadership skills, problem solving and priority setting
Excellent collaboration skills and working comfortably across teams
have passion to transform how decisions are made through adhoc & scaled application of analytics
preferably have some experience in CPG (FMCG), supply chain, analytics or consulting
column2: can demonstrate success at deriving insight from data and effectively communicating those insights to drive action.

column1: A fixed contract, with an attractive compensation package
Competitive pay, including monthly salary, 13th month at the end of the year as well as an annual variable bonus.
A flexible benefits plan to customize to your personal needs and kilometer allowance/public transport reduction
Hospitalization plan after 6 months of employment, pension plan, life insurance plan, long term illness insurance and stock purchase plan

Access to Benefits at work platform: A large benefits platform with employee discounts on renowned shops and online commercial platforms as well as on leisure activities and well-known amusement parks
Working in an international and inclusive environment, with diverse and supporting colleagues.
Continuous self-development via coaching, trainings and a general Growth Mindset working environment
A vibrant and modern working environment, supporting employees‚Äô wellbeing:
On-site vibrant Caf√© for breaks and less formal meetings
On-site fitness room and possibility to join regular group sport activities
Flexibility in terms of working hours and remote working for a good balance between personal needs and the job to be done.
Employee Assistance Program: free professional counseling services, work-life resources, and mental health support.
Supporting employees‚Äô commute: plenty of parking facilities for both cars and bikes, shower facilities, shuttle between Heizel metro and the office, carpooling community.

4199652387,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-science-internship-at-procter-gamble-4199652387?position=15&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=RKX4z38wyuIzyo6sWvHK%2BA%3D%3D,Data Science Internship,Procter & Gamble,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Job Location

Do you have passion for technology and desire to learn and grow continuously? Do you want to belong to one of the most advanced Data Science & Analytics group in the industry, developing sophisticated mathematical models and algorithms and applying Operations Research techniques?

Then join P&G as a Data Science intern for Supply Chain! Through your internship, you will build your Data Science and Analytics skills, develop your ability to influence and think strategically and learn how to work across domains and functions to make P&G‚Äôs supply chain more performant, more resilient and more sustainable.
Find out more about IT at P&G at www.youtube.com/watch?v=1ial3aeA9SE.
AS A DATA SCIENCE FOR SUPPLY CHAIN INTERN, YOU WILL:

Influence decisions from daily through to strategic ones, made across functions, at all levels of leadership, to have a meaningful impact on the performance, resiliency and environmental footprint of one of the largest CPG companies in the world
Build the next generation of supply chain analytics, using:
Mathematical modeling techniques: decision analysis, optimization, machine learning, simulation etc.
Programming languages (at least one of these): Python, SQL, R, Hive/Impala, MATLAB, etc.
Data Visualization: Power BI, Tableau, etc.
Work with technology partners to translate your innovations into robust, scaled, analytical solutions
Communicate insights from complex data or algorithms into simple conclusions that will empower others to act based on the insights you derive
Belong to an award-winning Analytics / Operations Research community that is global in scope and operates across P&G‚Äôs supply chains.
YOU ARE THE RIGHT FIT IF YOU:
Are currently pursuing a Master's degree in a quantitative field (Engineering, Statistics, Operation Research, Decisions Sciences, Computer Science, Applied Math, Economics, Data Science, etc.)

Have strong analytical skills and proficiency in at least one programming language (R, Python, SQL, etc.) or family of techniques (optimization, simulation, machine learning, predictive modeling, etc.)
Are adaptable and able to handle multiple priorities effectively, both independently and as part of a collaborative team
Are proficient in English, both written and spoken
We are offering internships of at least 3 months throughout the year.
If studying at a Belgian university, please make sure you consult with the internship department at your school to agree on the paid internship we offer.
A temporary contract for the duration of your internship, with an attractive compensation package
Monthly allowance: 2319,5 EUR brut/month, prorated 13th month based on the months worked during your internship period
A flexible benefits plan to customize to your personal needs and kilometer allowance/public transport reduction

Access to Benefits at work platform: A large benefits platform with employee discounts on renowned shops and online commercial platforms as well as on leisure activities and well-known amusement parks
Working in an international and inclusive environment, with diverse and supporting colleagues
Continuous self-development via coaching, trainings and a general Growth Mindset working environment
A vibrant and modern working environment, supporting employees‚Äô wellbeing:
On-site vibrant Caf√© for breaks and less formal meetings
On-site fitness room and possibility to join regular group sport activities
Flexibility in terms of working hours
Employee Assistance Program: free professional counseling services, work-life resources, and mental health support.
Supporting employee's commute: plenty of parking facilities for both cars and bikes, shower facilities, shuttle between Heizel metro and the office, carpooling community.

4202543307,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/full-remote-junior-data-scientist-ai-%E2%82%AC50k-%E2%82%AC80k-at-joinrs-uk-4202543307?position=16&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=%2FC%2Fyo99OnAiBw2sVah%2Flhw%3D%3D,[Full Remote] Junior Data Scientist & AI (‚Ç¨50k-‚Ç¨80k),Joinrs UK,European Union,"Our goal is to help every recent graduate worldwide find a job that aligns with their ambitions: join us to make the aspirations of a community of over 1,000,000 users come true!

We are constantly looking for students, recent graduates, and junior professionals who aspire to join our team around Europe. Apply for this position, and our HR team will contact you as soon as a role in this area becomes available and your CV matches the profile we are seeking.

For all Junior positions in the Tech Field, we offer a full remote contract (Annual Salary: ‚Ç¨50k-‚Ç¨80k) in the EMEA Region, you will have the opportunity to grow exponentially thanks to on-the-job training, you will be able to work fully remote for as long as you want and we will equip you with a latest generation MacBook.
We are looking only for Junior profiles, with 0 to 3 years of experience.
Within the team, you may be responsible for one or more of the following tasks:

Implementation of Machine Learning Algorithms: You will have the opportunity to implement and test machine learning algorithms, contributing to the development of intelligent solutions for business challenges. Specifically, working alongside our tech team, you will be involved in Joinrs AI: our Artificial Intelligence model that assists our community in finding employment.
Data Analysis and Modeling: You will participate in data analysis, developing predictive models and contributing to provide meaningful insights to enhance business decisions.

Data Visualization: You will learn to create clear and informative data visualizations to effectively communicate complex results to various stakeholders. In particular, you will create interactive dashboards to showcase data and Key Performance Indicators (Data Visualization) to the team, clients, investors, and all key stakeholders.
Optimization of Business Processes: You will collaborate in identifying and optimizing business processes through the application of data-driven solutions.

Participation in Technological Brainstorming Sessions: You will be involved in brainstorming sessions to generate innovative ideas and contribute to identifying new opportunities in the field of Artificial Intelligence.

Continuous Training and Updates on the Latest Trends: You will have access to continuous training programs to stay updated on the latest trends and advancements in the fields of Data Science and Artificial Intelligence.
Working in the Joinrs team means being able to choose the best psychophysical conditions for tranquility and productivity. This translates into:
Remote working and flexibility. You'll have the opportunity to work remotely full-time, but you can also use one of our offices.

Dynamic work environment. Our offices remain open, providing shared workspaces, meeting rooms, break areas, and a bar with fresh fruit and various snacks. You'll also find a foosball table and a gaming station. We aim for an informal work environment that encourages shared moments, always respecting individual activities.
Team building & fun. We frequently organize aperitifs, games, and leisure moments, which are integral parts of life at Joinrs, both inside and outside the office.
Company welfare. We guarantee you a company welfare package that meets your expectations.
Tech pack. You'll use advanced software and modern technologies, and you'll be provided with the latest-generation MacBook.

Training. You'll always have a mentor in your Joinrs journey, acting as a reference for both technical and team aspects. We ensure constant professional growth with progressively increasing responsibilities. You can participate in industry events and training courses, along with continuous education on the best e-learning platforms.
Social Impact. Your contribution will support thousands of recent graduates in finding the job they aspire to.
Our mission is to support every recent graduate and junior professional in achieving their goals, helping them start their careers with optimism and a clear vision for their future.
We are a united team that strongly believes in collaboration: together we work, discuss, and achieve results that inspire us to aim for ever more ambitious goals.
Our community includes over 1,000,000 members across the US, UK, Europe, and Brazil, as well as 300+ companies like PwC, Accenture, Gi Group, Danone, and Siemens. And we‚Äôre growing fast‚Äîjoin us!
For all Junior positions we offer a full remote contract (Annual Salary: ‚Ç¨50k-‚Ç¨80k).
Salary reviews are scheduled every six months, with your compensation increasing rapidly as you gain experience and translate it into a more significant impact.
CV Screening: The first step is a curriculum vitae (CV) screening (usually within 20 days of application).
Phone Interview: The second step involves a 15-minute phone interview with our HR Manager.
Video Interview: The final step is a video interview with both the HR Manager and your future supervisor, lasting at least 45 minutes.
Social Impact: You'll have the opportunity to support our community in realizing their ambitions, as well as your own.
Successful Startup: Joinrs was selected among the top 10 startups globally at the Web Summit in Lisbon.
Exponential Personal Growth: You'll have the opportunity for exponential growth, both in hard and soft skills, thanks to a training program based on on-the-job training and online support.

Founded in Luxembourg in 2003, we have grown to encompass 12 entities worldwide, employing over 2,500 employees in Luxembourg, Belgium, Greece, Italy, Portugal and Bulgaria. Our bold company culture is built around working hard and playing hard, with a flat and agile structure that lends itself to efficiency and employee empowerment. We value our diverse workplace of close-knit teams and provide a place where everyone can be supported to learn and evolve.
ARHS Group - part of Accenture - is looking for a Data Scientist for one of its clients at the EU Institutions in Brussels.
Collect business requirement and develop advanced data mining solutions or identify, assess and deploy relevant existing data mining, machine learning and business intelligence solution

Produces data models according to specific problems statements.

Write the different documentation associated with the tasks and liaise with other project teams as necessary to address cross-project interdependencies.

Ability to work in a team as well as autonomously
Good communication skills in English, both orally and in written form
Excellent knowledge of Data Science techniques especially in machine learning and NLP. Prior experience with Large Language Model is considered an asset
Extensive experience in data analysis, with the ability to work with large datasets and extract meaningful insights
Clean and transform raw data into a usable format for analysis. This includes designing and deploying Extraction Transformation and Load (ETL) processes

Knowledge and experience working in cloud environments
Technical proficiency regarding database design development, data models, techniques for data mining, and segmentation
Ability to deliver presentation to both business and technical audiences
Ability to cope with fast changing technologies used in application developments

Minimum 5 years of professional experience in Data Science and AI. Excellent command of Python and proficiency with relevant libraries, including but not limited to NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, PyTorch, TensorFlow, HuggingFace

4130566837,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-at-proximus-group-4130566837?position=18&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=cBhgUuyJEEV%2FHRzEfaibzA%3D%3D,Data Scientist,Proximus Group,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","As an Data Scientist, you will play a key role in developing end-to-end solutions for AI use cases. By taking up a use case right from the start you will help business define and scope the problem, pick the right ML solution and technology as well as ensure implementation, integration and deployment of your solution to production. You will do so while ensuring that our internal governance processes and best practices are respected. You will also collaborate with other team members in knowledge sharing as well as continuously improving our way of working.
Develop AI applications using state-of-the-art (Gen)AI technology
Translate business requests into AI applications
Identify high-value use cases through data exploration and visualization
Pilot prototypes in production processes to demonstrate their value
Deploy prototypes to production, with support of IT, to obtain reliable, scalable systems
Present your results in a clear manner and discuss them with multi-functional project teams

Work in close collaboration with business experts (e.g. for requirement gathering, data source identification, data and process understanding, feature engineering, result validation, etc.), with IT (e.g. for ETL, deployment to production, etc.) and with other AI engineers in the team (e.g. for knowledge sharing).
PhD or Master's degree in a quantitative field (Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, etc.)
3+ years of relevant work experience in a business environment
Hands-on experience with Python and its AI ecosystem
Strong knowledge of state-of-the-art AI and statistical methods
Experience using LLM‚Äôs and commonly used libraries to interact with LLM‚Äôs (Langchain, Llamaindex, ...) is an asset
Proven proficiency in the end-to-end AI project life cycle, including:
Translating business requests into data requirements.
Identifying high-value use cases through data exploration and visualization.
Developing AI solutions (incl. feature engineering, model fitting, etc.).
Deploying scalable AI applications to production.
Any experience with following elements is a plus:
MLOps practices, e.g. orchestration with Airflow, Gitlab CI/CD, etc.
Passionate about AI and a constant learner
Result-oriented and highly proficient in transforming data into actionable insights that create business value
Team player with strong communication and presentation skills
Able to manage AI projects in an autonomous way and drive collaboration with domain experts, data engineers and other AI engineers
Knowledge in the field of telecommunications is a plus.
Fluent in Dutch and/or French (mandatory) + Fluent in English.

You will also collaborate with other team members in knowledge sharing as well as continuously improving our way of working.

4192081999,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-at-trilations-4192081999?position=20&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=J%2BTw5sqcLjB9CWoUMWyOXA%3D%3D,Data Scientist,Trilations,"Kontich, Flemish Region, Belgium","Trilations is een open-minded, no-nonsense consultancy organisatie. Wij geloven sterk in langdurig engagement, met zowel onze klanten als onze medewerkers. Wij investeren in het delen van kennis, levenslang leren en coaching en bouwen voort op onze pragmatische cultuur, die is gebaseerd op vertrouwen, professionaliteit, integriteit en betrokkenheid.
De consultants van Trilations onderscheiden zich door hun expertise en hun professionele en klantgerichte, vriendelijke houding. Momenteel zijn wij op zoek naar een Data Scientist.

De klanten van Trilations zijn Business Insights verantwoordelijken en hun team binnen toonaangevende bedrijven in de pharma sector zowel in het binnen- als buitenland (EU, LATAM, Americas and Asia). Onze consultants werken nauw samen met het team van de klant en ondersteun het team in het vertalen van hun business-uitdaging naar concrete projecten, het opzetten en uitvoeren van het analyse plan en finaal het delen van de nieuw bekomen inzichten.

In je rol als data scientist werk je nauw samen met zowel het intern project team van Trilations als het team van de klant. Je ondersteunt onze consultants in het aanleveren van waardevolle inzichten die je haalt uit analyses van omvangrijke kwantitatieve & kwalitatieve datasets afkomstig van klanten of eigen marktonderzoek. Het resultaat van je analyses helpt de klant om in te zetten op verbeteringen die het meeste ROI opleveren.
Om deze inzichten te bekomen ga je concreet aan de slag met:
Statistische technieken zoals regressie, factor analyse, clustering, etc
Machine learning technieken zoals SVM, random forests,...
Large language models om inzichten te verwerven uit teksten
Je werkt mee aan de innovatie van Trilations door het ontwikkelen van nieuwe services obv data.

Je hebt een masterdiploma in een kwantitatieve richting (Wiskunde, Statistics, Data Science, AI, IT, Ingenieurswetenschappen, Experimentele Psychologie,...). Een doctoraatservaring wordt ook in overweging genomen
Je hebt bij voorkeur een minimum van 3 jaar ervaring in een rol als scientist of analyst
Je hebt een grondige kennis van Python (pandas, numpy, scikit-learn,...) en SQL
Ervaring met LLMs en LangChain is een grote troef
Kennis van SPSS is een plus
Je analytische geest en flexibiliteit zijn belangrijk voor het uitvoeren van je job. Je hebt ook ervaring met het beheren en interpreteren van datasets voor het leveren van bruikbare inzichten
Je hebt een proactieve houding en bent in staat om zelfstandig projecten te beheren en effectief samen te werken met diverse teams binnen een organisatie
Je bent gepassioneerd door data en werkt zeer graag in een team
Je beschikt over een grote interesse in de lifesciences sector en hebt ambitie om te groeien. Ervaring en/of kennis in de pharma sector is een pluspunt.
Je krijgt een boeiende en gevarieerde functie die je de mogelijkheid biedt je expertise en vaardigheden verder uit te bouwen in een dynamisch team
De mogelijkheid om voor toonaangevende bedrijven te werken, zowel nationaal als internationaal
Een aantrekkelijk salaris met extralegale voordelen, 32 vakantiedagen en een firmawagen of mobiliteitsbudget
Een persoonlijk groeitraject in functie van je mogelijkheden en ambities.

Bij Trilations streven we naar gelijke kansen in ons rekruteringsproces, vrij van vooroordelen of discriminatie op basis van (maar niet beperkt tot) ras, kleur, religie, geslacht, genderidentiteit, seksuele geaardheid, nationaliteit, genetica, beperking of leeftijd. We cre√´ren een bedrijfscultuur waarin iedereen zich gerespecteerd, gewaardeerd en ondersteund voelt. Zowel binnen als buiten ons bedrijf zetten we ons in voor een omgeving zonder discriminatie, waarin iedereen zichzelf kan zijn.

4195688954,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-at-visser-van-baars-4195688954?position=21&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=bblbiMHU4gWePflnMYCstw%3D%3D,Data Scientist,Visser & Van Baars,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","üìç Brussels, Belgium - Hybrid (2 days in-office, 3 days remote)
Make real impact with data in the world of DIY & retail

For a leading company in the DIY and home improvement retail sector in the Benelux, we are looking for an experienced Senior or Mid-level Data Scientist. With millions of customers across Belgium, the Netherlands, and Luxembourg, this organization helps people build, improve, and personalize their homes.
As they move through a major data-driven transformation, they are seeking a data expert who can turn complex data into real business value through insights and AI-powered solutions.
Turn data into business impact: Work closely with Marketing, Operations, Finance, and other departments to solve challenges using data and AI
Build end-to-end solutions: Develop and deploy machine learning models and optimize processes from A to Z
Work with big data: Analyze large and complex datasets from retail stores, e-commerce platforms, and supply chain systems
Collaborate with stakeholders: Work alongside data engineers, product owners, and external partners to deliver scalable, high-quality solutions
Translate data into insights: Communicate complex findings in a clear, actionable way to non-technical stakeholders
Stay ahead of the curve: Keep up with the latest developments in AI, machine learning, and cloud technology
Operate in an agile environment: Use Agile/Kanban methods to prioritize and deliver value efficiently
Hands-on experience with Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery), Databricks, Python, and PySpark
Skilled in Power BI for dashboarding and reporting
Experience building and deploying machine learning models
Familiarity with retail, e-commerce, or supply chain datasets
Experience with end-to-end data pipelines and putting ML models into production
Experience with SAP systems (CAR, BW, ECOMMERCE) is a strong plus
Able to translate data insights into strategic business advice
Strong communicator with the ability to tell clear stories with data
Comfortable managing internal and external stakeholders
Thrives in a fast-paced Agile environment
Knowledge or interest in DIY/retail sector is a plus
French or Dutch is a plus
A key role in the digital transformation of a leading Benelux retailer
Work with modern technologies and cloud tools
Hybrid working with flexibility and autonomy
Join an ambitious team making a real impact on millions of customers

üìç Brussels, Belgium - Hybrid (2 days in-office, 3 days remote)

Make real impact with data in the world of DIY &
column2:
retail
For a leading company in the DIY and home improvement retail sector in the Benelux, we are looking for an experienced Senior or Mid-level Data Scientist. With millions of customers across Belgium, the Netherlands, and Luxembourg, this organization helps people build, improve, and personalize their homes.

As they move through a major data-driven transformation, they are seeking a data expert who can turn complex data into real business value through insights and AI-powered solutions.

What you'll do

  • Turn data into business impact: Work closely with Marketing, Operations, Finance, and other departments to solve challenges using data and AI

  • Build end-to-end solutions: Develop and deploy machine learning models and optimize processes from A to Z

  • Work with big data: Analyze large and complex datasets from retail stores, e-commerce platforms, and supply chain systems

  • Collaborate with stakeholders: Work alongside data engineers, product owners, and external partners to deliver scalable, high-quality solutions

  • Translate data into insights: Communicate complex findings in a clear, actionable way to non-technical stakeholders

  • Stay ahead of the curve: Keep up with the latest developments in AI, machine learning, and cloud technology

  • Operate in an agile environment: Use Agile/Kanban methods to prioritize and deliver value efficiently

Who we're looking for



Technical skills

  • Hands-on experience with Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery), Databricks, Python, and PySpark

  • Skilled in Power BI for dashboarding and reporting

  • Experience building and deploying machine learning models

  • Familiarity with retail, e-commerce, or supply chain datasets

  • Experience with end-to-end data pipelines and putting ML models into production

  • Experience with SAP systems (CAR, BW, ECOMMERCE) is a strong plus

Business &
column3:
soft skills

  • Able to translate data insights into strategic business advice

  • Strong communicator with the ability to tell clear stories with data

  • Comfortable managing internal and external stakeholders

  • Thrives in a fast-paced Agile environment

  • Knowledge or interest in DIY/retail sector is a plus

Language requirements

  • English is required

  • French or Dutch is a plus

What's in it for you

  • A key role in the digital transformation of a leading Benelux retailer

  • Work with modern technologies and cloud tools

  • Hybrid working with flexibility and autonomy

  • Join an ambitious team making a real impact on millions of customers

4194799066,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-data-scientists-ai-ml-engineers-at-vectr-consulting-4194799066?position=23&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=K0kVbUY14gzN7zhf8Z3NWg%3D%3D,Junior Data scientists & AI/ML Engineers,Vectr.Consulting,"Kontich, Flemish Region, Belgium","Studeer je af als computerwetenschapper, ingenieur AI of soortgelijke opleiding, dan horen we graag van je! Zin om als Data scientist fraudedetectie systemen en modellen vorm te geven, onder meer bij de Vlaamse overheid? Passie om AI systemen te engineeren? Heb je expertise om bvb Machine learning toe te passen? Dan raden we je aan om meer over onze projecten te lezen op onze website.

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency‚Ä¶but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.
WHAT IS A DATA SCIENTIST AT CREAM?

As Robin, Data Scientist, you will have a key role in the implementation of innovative data models to solve specific business issues. You will be part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team. You will discover various industries.
You gather business requirements to better understand your client‚Äôs needs
You dive in a large amount of data to discover is hidden
You provide data-driven recommendations to the client
Based on your client‚Äôs needs, you apply predictive analysis and machine learning
You bring out concrete and predictive models
At the end, you help the business to better optimize the use of their data
HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?
You have at least 2 years of experience in Data Science
You want to learn more about Machine Learning, Robotics Process Automation (RPA)‚Ä¶
You are used to work with one of the following technologies : MATLAB, R, SAS, Python, Java ‚Ä¶
You have good communication and synthesis skills
You are fluent in French and English

4188003756,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-ii-agriculture-analytics-machine-learning-geospatial-at-mckinsey-company-4188003756?position=28&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=Fk%2F%2B%2ByYRceH4WjMmO1UrpQ%3D%3D,Data Scientist II - Agriculture Analytics (Machine Learning / Geospatial),McKinsey & Company,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Who You'll Work With
You‚Äôll work with McKinsey‚Äôs agricultural analytics team (ACRE) in Brussels.

Our Agriculture Practice advises agribusiness, consumer food, government, and investor clients on strategic, marketing & sales, and operations issues, helping support industry-shaping decisions that impact the future of global food production.

Within this group, ACRE is a team of expert consultants, data scientists, and engineers focused on bringing cutting-edge analytics to our agribusiness clients. We apply real-time data and advanced analytics ‚Äì generally predictive or geospatial in nature ‚Äì to solve the biggest problems currently facing global agricultural markets, driving insights at the micro and macro levels.

ACRE is an agile team within the firm whose goal is to use the latest analytical methods, incubate new technologies and drive innovative ways to develop new opportunities for the firm to make significant and lasting client impact ‚Äì redefining what it means to provide the ‚Äúbest of the firm‚Äù to our clients.

You will leverage industry knowledge and analytical expertise to provide insights both to clients as part of client service teams and within the agricultural analytics team (ACRE) by strengthening the core products and algorithms we build for clients. You can expect to split your time delivering impact at clients (including up to ~50% travel to client sites) and building up ACRE‚Äôs core analytical offerings.

As a member of client service teams, you will leverage your creativity and problem-solving skills to tackle clients‚Äô most pressing issues using an analytical lens, meeting client needs and communicating your work to executive audiences. Issues to solve could include determining the suitability (now and in the future given impacts of climate change) of growing different types of crops across different geographies, using local agronomic data and satellite imagery to determine market potential for input products, or optimizing farm operations using yield forecasting. Your work will often include heavy geospatial components and/or predictive analytics components.

When working internally with the ACRE team, you will build innovative algorithms and products (what we call ‚ÄúIP development‚Äù) to best meet our most common client needs. You will use global data such as geospatial, biological, economic and climatological data to develop proprietary solutions. You will work with our engineers to design new interfaces to deliver faster, more impactful insights to our clients.

Along the way, you will receive best-in-class training in structuring business problems and serving as a client adviser and have opportunities to work closely with and learn from our senior agriculture practitioners and industry players that are shaping the future of food production. You will get access to unparalleled career acceleration, with a huge amount of ownership and responsibility from the get-go in a collaborative, diverse, non-hierarchical environment. You will get the opportunity to travel to client sites, locally and around the world. Lastly, you will be able to provide direct and measurable impact to some of the largest agribusiness players around the globe.
We encourage you to submit a cover letter to highlight why you believe that you are a unique fit for our team and what we do! We will read it.

Bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative and/or agriculture-related discipline, such as data science/computer science, crop science/agronomy, animal sciences, geography/GIS, mathematics/statistics, environmental sciences & engineering
Agronomy/crop science, animal sciences, field-level yield forecasting experience preferred
Geospatial and spatiotemporal analysis, remote sensing, image processing experience preferred
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, paired with the ability to develop creative and efficient solutions
Proven experience in applying data science and machine learning techniques to solve real-world problems, preferably in the agriculture sector
Strong proficiency in Python to develop clean, efficient pipelines and workflows, ensuring reproducibility and effective team collaboration
Experience with version control and frameworks methodologies, preferred
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar
Strong multitasking and parallel development abilities
Creative, naturally curious, and willing to take intellectual risks
Able to work under competing, quickly changing priorities, manage expectations effectively and support the team under pressure
column2: highly organized with exceptional attention to detail and follow-through
