Development, maintenance and documentation software, mostly in python, with a focus on implementing and testing data analytics applications, data engineering and data collection tools.

Participate in data science projects led by ECAT scientific staff, and assume responsibility for software engineering tasks, including among others, requirement analysis, software development testing and documentation.
Participation in project update and review meetings and other meetings with project stakeholders.
Level 6 of the European Qualification Framework which typically corresponds to a bachelor degree of 3 years.
Excellent software development skills, in particular, experience implementing python libraries, software and services.

Demonstrated experience in implementing best practices for software testing, from unit and component testing to user acceptance, including negative testing and stress tests, to ensure software quality and reliability.
Experience deploying software tools and services, including definition of APIs, using DevOps tools and practices, CI/CD practices, e.g. in Gitlab or similar environments.

Experience in debugging complex software in python, and troubleshooting aspects related to the deployment of software, such as setting up execution environments, resolving dependencies, installing drivers, analysing networking aspects and using GPU hardware.
Experience in containerization and orchestration technologies such as Docker, Kubernetes or equivalent for the deployment and scaling of data science applications.
Ability and willingness to stay up to date with technologies and libraries for machine learning and data science.
Ability to write clear technical documentation of software for users and other developers, in English language.
Ability to understand, speak and write English (C1)
Ability to design and implement robust data pipelines for the ingestion, cleaning, transformation and
Strong experience in testing software, including frameworks for defining and automating software tests, including regression testing and negative testing.

Job Description

Tasks

  • Development, maintenance and documentation software, mostly in python, with a focus on implementing and testing data analytics applications, data engineering and data collection tools.
  • Participate in data science projects led by ECAT scientific staff, and assume responsibility for software engineering tasks, including among others, requirement analysis, software development testing and documentation.
  • Participation in project update and review meetings and other meetings with project stakeholders.

Level of Education

  • Level 6 of the European Qualification Framework which typically corresponds to a bachelor degree of 3 years.

Knowledge And Skills

  • Excellent software development skills, in particular, experience implementing python libraries, software and services.
  • Demonstrated experience in implementing best practices for software testing, from unit and component testing to user acceptance, including negative testing and stress tests, to ensure software quality and reliability.
  • Experience deploying software tools and services, including definition of APIs, using DevOps tools and practices, CI/CD practices, e.g. in Gitlab or similar environments.
  • Experience in debugging complex software in python, and troubleshooting aspects related to the deployment of software, such as setting up execution environments, resolving dependencies, installing drivers, analysing networking aspects and using GPU hardware.
  • Experience in containerization and orchestration technologies such as Docker, Kubernetes or equivalent for the deployment and scaling of data science applications.
  • Ability and willingness to stay up to date with technologies and libraries for machine learning and data science.
  • Ability to write clear technical documentation of software for users and other developers, in English language.
  • Ability to understand, speak and write English (C1)

Specific Expertise

  • Ability to design and implement robust data pipelines for the ingestion, cleaning, transformation and
  • storage of diverse data sources.
  • Strong experience in testing software, including frameworks for defining and automating software tests, including regression testing and negative testing.

Languages

  • French
  • English

Hiring Team Member

Pulaparthi Yamini Priya

Talent Acquisition Specialist

  • Mail

4195702404,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/applied-research-scientist-at-scipro-4195702404?position=32&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=qusA3aGahMc0MDfD1o0oUA%3D%3D,Applied Research Scientist,SciPro,European Union,"I partner with an AI-driven startup developing a universal foundation model to transform and accelerate drug discovery and biomedical research. They are seeking an Applied Research Scientist, with a strong foundation in Computational Biology (10+ years), including 5+ years in translational science and AI-driven biomarker development.

This role sits at the intersection of AI-driven biopharma R&D and product, making it ideal for someone who can bridge the gap between research and commercial teams. You‚Äôll need to be highly technical while capable of engaging with business stakeholders across pharma and biotech, translating complex scientific challenges into AI-driven solutions that drive real-world impact.

Translate pharma challenges into AI-driven solutions, unlocking insights across target discovery, biomarker development & clinical trial design and collaborating closely with product to align key features with industry needs.
Be the scientific expert during pre and technical sales, enabling trusted knowledge sharing through proof-of-concept studies, domain-specific queries, and compelling presentations.
Guide and educate pharma, biotech and healthcare partners on how to leverage foundation models and extract meaningful insights from multi-modal data.
Represent us at top conferences & industry events, establishing thought leadership in AI-driven drug discovery.
Work closely with the research team to explore and integrate emerging AI and foundation model methodologies into our product.

Deep knowledge of biopharma processes and their challenges, from target discovery to clinical trial design and biomarker development. Able to translate complex R&D needs into actionable AI solutions. Big Pharma experience would be a plus.
Extensive hands-on experience with Computational Biology
column2: genomics, proteomics, and histology data‚Äîcovering everything from data curation to applying machine learning for scientific discovery. Strong publication record in leading journals or top AI/biology conferences.

column1: Strategic thinker and skilled at engaging both technical and business audiences, delivering insights that drive decision-making.
PhD (or equivalent) in Computational Biology, Bioinformatics, or a related field, with a proven track record in AI-driven biopharma innovation.
Desirable: Entrepreneurship mindset and innovative start-up environment ready.
To learn more about how you can advance and shape the future of Biology and AI apply below or reach out to me directly on i.shirley@sciproglobal.com or 020 3744 4313
This is a full time permanent role, remote (UK/EU) or Hybrid in Paris.

4195448177,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-ml-at-red-global-4195448177?position=33&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=gLswmlkZf81RCDp63zkdNg%3D%3D,Data Scientist - ML,RED Global,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","RED Global is currently recruiting for a Data Scientist - ML for our client, a global organisation who are scaling up their data capability. They are looking to bring on board an experienced Data Scientist with experience of Machine Learning, GenAI and solution architecture and software engineering.
Responsible to support and advice various clients to identify and define problems and resolve these complex issues for the business.
You will interact with graph databases through standardized APIs and query languages and work with ETL Prosses.
Use AI techniques such as GenAI, supervised and un-supervised machine learning techniques.
Work across the latest data science platforms (Databricks, Dataiku, AzureML, SageMaker) and frameworks (e.g., Tensorflow, PyTorch, MXNet, scikit-learn).
Support with building and deploying solutions to Cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) including Cloud provisioning tools (e.g., Terraform).
Advising to the business stakeholders on data driven marketing - working closely with third parties and, internally, with digital teams, IT, and others.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and French/Dutch with good senior-level stakeholder management soft skills and competencies.
3-5 years experiences as a Data Scientist working within global organisations.
Extensive work experience of various Data Science Platforms such as Databricks, Dataiku, AzureML, SageMaker) and frameworks such as Tensorflow, PyTorch, MXNet, scikit-learn.
Experience building and deploying solutions to Cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
Must have technical knowledge of Machine Learning (ML) or GenAI.
Industry skills: Manufacturing or Life sciences would be a plus.
Strong analytical skills and appreciation of coding languages, data sources, data matching and data acquisition.

RED Global is currently recruiting for a Data Scientist - ML for our client, a global organisation who are scaling up their data capability. They are looking to bring on board an experienced Data Scientist with experience of Machine Learning, GenAI and solution architecture and software engineering.



Key Responsibilities:

  • Responsible to support and advice various clients to identify and define problems and resolve these complex issues for the business.
  • You will interact with graph databases through standardized APIs and query languages and work with ETL Prosses.
  • Use AI techniques such as GenAI, supervised and un-supervised machine learning techniques.

Required skills:

  • 3-5 years experiences as a Data Scientist working within global organisations.
  • Extensive work experience of various Data Science Platforms such as Databricks, Dataiku, AzureML, SageMaker) and frameworks such as Tensorflow, PyTorch, MXNet, scikit-learn.

4143434522,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-science-manager-at-kpmg-belgium-4143434522?position=34&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=7XKZiCJiy%2BGPSRAlmJJGQQ%3D%3D,Data Science Manager,KPMG Belgium,"Zaventem, Flemish Region, Belgium","Function

In a world where stakeholders are consistently expected to provide more diverse digital experiences, data scientists are continuously challenged ‚Äì to work is to grow. The KPMG Lighthouse is currently looking for talents in the field of data science, people who are able to exploit data to create smart digital solutions, but who are also able to inspire about the art of the possible.
Contributing to the growth of Advanced Analytics and Machine Learning as a topic and as a competence at KPMG
Contributing to the growth of our project portfolio
Stepping ito conversations with clients, and translating their business needs into Artificial Intelligence solutions Gathering and organizing data
Deciding on an analytical approach, and executing the analysis with a good eye for detail, all the while efficiently working towards the best possible solution
Communicating with clients: absorbing their thoughts, convincing them of the strengths of your models
Bringing your model into production ‚Äì and communicating with specialist
Creating and maintaining good relationships with stakeholders ‚Äì clients, vendors, KPMG colleagues,‚Ä¶
The tasks of a data scientist manager are diverse, and we are not looking for the unicorn data scientist, but a mindset focused on learning on the job is vital!
Elements we hope to see in our data scientist managers:
Concrete experience delivering concrete AI products.
A master degree with strong elements of modern data science techniques: Machine Learning algorithms, coding, statistics,‚Ä¶
Other types of eduction are also valued.
A sound knowledge of algorithms, and the ability to critically apply this knowledge to practical problems.

Knowledge of common data science software. We have a Python-first setup, but will if needed tackle problems using R, SAS, SQL, Spark, and work with tools such as Jupyter Notebooks, IDE‚Äôs, Git, Microsoft Azure,
Obviously, additional bonus points for PhD‚Äôs, and more specific knowledge like e.g. Keras, D3.js
The desire to learn and grow
A positive, collaborative, and flexible mindset
Fluent professional proficiency in Dutch or French is required.
As a Certified Top Employer We Offer
An international corporate culture in which personal growth, mutual trust and lifelong learning are being fostered.

A competitive and attractive compensation package and a great number of extra-legal advantages (Company car + fuel card, IPhone/IPad, group & hospitalization insurance, Allowances,‚Ä¶) which are customizable with our Reflex@KPMG plan.
Career and business development opportunities combined with trainings based on your personal needs and ambitions.
Learning and growth opportunities designed for leaders through our Management development Track.
Flexible, hybrid work arrangements to enable working from wherever you are.
A team of passionate colleagues to reach higher goals and support eachother
A buddy and performance manager to support and assist you through your first months at KPMG.
Great teambuilding, sport & wellbeing initiatives through our Together@KPMG program.
An inclusive workspace that encourages diversity and pursues mutual respect for each other‚Äôs beliefs and backgrounds.

4198017934,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-v-m-x-at-national-bank-of-belgium-4198017934?position=35&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=TVC%2FnRD04Mw3gS4a7p30iw%3D%3D,Data Scientist (V/M/X),National Bank of Belgium,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Het Data Science Center (DSC) is een dynamisch team binnen het Data & Analytics Office (GO) dat zich inzet om de producten en diensten van NBB te verbeteren met behulp van geavanceerde data science technieken. Het DSC fungeert als een center of expertise, bestaande uit 10 collega's met diepgaande kennis in verschillende data science domeinen. Het DSC stelt zijn expertise ter beschikking van heel de NBB en werkt waar mogelijk samen met andere centrale banken, waardoor zowel de gebruikte technologie√´n als de toepassingsdomeinen zeer gevarieerd zijn en continu evolueren.
Werken in het DSC betekent continu je data science expertise up-to-date houden, en deze inzetten om bij te dragen aan de missies van NBB.

je blijft op de hoogte van de ontwikkelingen binnen data science, in het bijzonder van de mogelijkheden en de beperkingen van kwantitatieve methodes (tijdsreeksanalyse, AI, machine learning, statistiek, wiskunde,‚Ä¶)
je bent bereid je voortdurend bij te scholen in deze technieken, je hebt inzicht in de technieken en legt de voor- en/of nadelen ervan uit aan je collega's

je onderzoekt en werkt mee aan concrete problemen binnen verschillenden entiteiten van de Bank, je geeft coaching aan collega's en je probeert generieke componenten voor transversaal gebruik te detecteren en te implementeren
je documenteert de oplossingen en moedigt het gebruik van de transversale componenten aan bij andere entiteiten van de Bank, bv door het geven van opleidingen in de context van de Data Academy
je zorgt ervoor dat de uitgewerkte oplossingen correct worden uitgevoerd via coaching of opleiding
je houdt hierbij rekening met de Enterprise Data Management (EDM) principes, licht die - zo nodig - toe aan de collega's en past ze toe
je zoekt samen met de collega's op een creatieve en innovatieve manier naar oplossingen voor de gestelde problemen
je zorgt voor een optimale kennisdeling rond data science binnen NBB, onder andere door inhoudelijk en organisationeel bij te dragen aan de goede werking van de NBB data science community
je netwerkt met mogelijke academische partners en andere centrale banken
je hebt een sterke achtergrond in statistiek, wiskunde en computerwetenschappen, aangevuld met de nodige relevante ervaring voor deze functie
je beschikt over een goede kennis van tijdsreeksanalyse, of bent bereid je hierin te verdiepen
je beschikt over een goede kennis van generatieve AI, of bent bereid je hierin te verdiepen
je beschikt over didactische vaardigheden om het waarom en hoe van de gebruikte (vaak complexe) technieken uit te leggen aangepast aan het kennisniveau van de doelgroep
je hebt een goede kennis van Python of R
kennis van de volgende technologie√´n zijn een pluspunt: de beschikbare data science componenten in Azure, Databricks, MLOps
wiskundige technieken (statistiek, algoritmes, machine learning, ...) gebruiken en uitleggen schrikt je niet af
je beschikt over de nodige kennis om oplossingen te ontwikkelen die aan de vereisten van informaticaveiligheid en vertrouwelijkheid van gegevens voldoen
je bent nieuwsgierig en gepassioneerd om innoverende oplossingen te ontwikkelen in een omgeving die voortdurend verandert.
je houdt graag je kennis up to date en schoolt jezelf graag bij in verschillende data science domeinen
je kunt zowel in een multidisciplinair team als zelfstandig werken
je bent houder van een master in de informatica, ingenieurswetenschappen, fysica, wiskunde, statistiek, handelsingenieur of je hebt een gelijkwaardige ervaring
je hebt een goede kennis van het Nederlands, Frans en het Engels (niveau B1)

Een aantrekkelijk loon en tal van bovenwettelijke voordelen (groepsverzekering, uitgebreide hospitalisatieverzekering, iPhone met abonnement...) en een goed evenwicht tussen werk- en priv√©leven evenals de mogelijkheid tot thuiswerk

Een echte carri√®re: de NBB biedt je de mogelijkheid om je voortdurend te blijven ontwikkelen. We bieden je een breed scala aan opleidingen om de vaardigheden te verwerven die je nodig hebt om je carri√®re verder uit te bouwen
Een unieke job, waar we onze kennis en expertise ten dienste stellen van de maatschappij
Een plek waar je initiatief kan nemen en wordt aangemoedigd om te laten zien wat je kunt
Een fijne, collegiale en dynamische werksfeer

Aandacht voor je welzijn: om ervoor te zorgen dat je je goed voelt op de werkvloer en thuis, biedt de NBB een ruim aanbod aan sportactiviteiten (fitnessruimte, groepslessen‚Ä¶), culturele activiteiten en inspirerende workshops.

Alleen de kandidaturen die vergezeld gaan van een motivatiebrief, een CV en een kopie van het/de diploma('s), komen in aanmerking. Buitenlandse diploma's zijn enkel geldig in combinatie met een gelijkwaardigheidsattest.
Please be advised that a valid work permit for Belgium is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient language skills may not be considered.

  • je onderzoekt en werkt mee aan concrete problemen binnen verschillenden entiteiten van de Bank, je geeft coaching aan collega's en je probeert generieke componenten voor transversaal gebruik te detecteren en te implementeren
  • je documenteert de oplossingen en moedigt het gebruik van de transversale componenten aan bij andere entiteiten van de Bank, bv door het geven van opleidingen in de context van de Data Academy
  • je zorgt ervoor dat de uitgewerkte oplossingen correct worden uitgevoerd via coaching of opleiding
  • je houdt hierbij rekening met de Enterprise Data Management (EDM) principes, licht die - zo nodig - toe aan de collega's en past ze toe
  • je zoekt samen met de collega's op een creatieve en innovatieve manier naar oplossingen voor de gestelde problemen
  • je zorgt voor een optimale kennisdeling rond data science binnen NBB, onder andere door inhoudelijk en organisationeel bij te dragen aan de goede werking van de NBB data science community
  • je netwerkt met mogelijke academische partners en andere centrale banken
  • je hebt een sterke achtergrond in statistiek, wiskunde en computerwetenschappen, aangevuld met de nodige relevante ervaring voor deze functie
  • je beschikt over een goede kennis van tijdsreeksanalyse, of bent bereid je hierin te verdiepen
  • je beschikt over een goede kennis van generatieve AI, of bent bereid je hierin te verdiepen
  • je beschikt over didactische vaardigheden om het waarom en hoe van de gebruikte (vaak complexe) technieken uit te leggen aangepast aan het kennisniveau van de doelgroep
  • je hebt een goede kennis van Python of R
  • kennis van de volgende technologie√´n zijn een pluspunt: de beschikbare data science componenten in Azure, Databricks, MLOps
  • wiskundige technieken (statistiek, algoritmes, machine learning, ...) gebruiken en uitleggen schrikt je niet af
  • je beschikt over de nodige kennis om oplossingen te ontwikkelen die aan de vereisten van informaticaveiligheid en vertrouwelijkheid van gegevens voldoen
  • je bent nieuwsgierig en gepassioneerd om innoverende oplossingen te ontwikkelen in een omgeving die voortdurend verandert.
  • je houdt graag je kennis up to date en schoolt jezelf graag bij in verschillende data science domeinen
  • je kunt zowel in een multidisciplinair team als zelfstandig werken
  • je bent houder van een master in de informatica, ingenieurswetenschappen, fysica, wiskunde, statistiek, handelsingenieur of je hebt een gelijkwaardige ervaring
  • je hebt een goede kennis van het Nederlands, Frans en het Engels (niveau B1)
  • Een aantrekkelijk loon en tal van bovenwettelijke voordelen (groepsverzekering, uitgebreide hospitalisatieverzekering, iPhone met abonnement...) en een goed evenwicht tussen werk- en priv√©leven evenals de mogelijkheid tot thuiswerk
  • Een echte carri√®re: de NBB biedt je de mogelijkheid om je voortdurend te blijven ontwikkelen. We bieden je een breed scala aan opleidingen om de vaardigheden te verwerven die je nodig hebt om je carri√®re verder uit te bouwen
  • Een unieke job, waar we onze kennis en expertise ten dienste stellen van de maatschappij
  • Een plek waar je initiatief kan nemen en wordt aangemoedigd om te laten zien wat je kunt
  • Een fijne, collegiale en dynamische werksfeer
  • Aandacht voor je welzijn: om ervoor te zorgen dat je je goed voelt op de werkvloer en thuis, biedt de NBB een ruim aanbod aan sportactiviteiten (fitnessruimte, groepslessen‚Ä¶), culturele activiteiten en inspirerende workshops.

Alleen de kandidaturen die vergezeld gaan van een motivatiebrief, een CV en een kopie van het/de diploma('s), komen in aanmerking. Buitenlandse diploma's zijn enkel geldig in combinatie met een gelijkwaardigheidsattest.

Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Belgium is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient language skills may not be considered.

4158243246,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/research-scientist-jr-at-qplox-engineering-4158243246?position=36&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=c70oSD98y1B2E10lSYr92Q%3D%3D,Research Scientist (Jr),Qplox engineering,"Leuven, Flemish Region, Belgium","Position: Jr. Research Scientist
We seek a motivated Junior Research Scientist with a PhD (up to 2 years post-PhD) in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematical Engineering, or Operational Research.
Develop novel methods and algorithms customized for solving network optimization problems involving nonlinear coupling constraints, nonconvex/nonlinear composite objective functions, etc.
Integrate them as part of product-grade solver framework for automated execution.
Network optimization including network design, network embedding, routing/traffic assignment, resource allocation, flow/resource scheduling, etc.

Optimization Expertise: Mixed-integer nonlinear programming (mandatory) and iterative methods like quasi-Newton, primal-dual methods (Lagrangian methods, etc.), interior point, combinatorial methods: polyhedral methods, etc.
Programming: Proficiency in C/C++, Fortran, and Octave.
Tools: Good knowledge of MI(N)LP solving frameworks such as Gurobi, SCIP, Couenne/COIN-OR, SHOT/COIN-OR, Bonmin, etc. and subsolvers (e.g. MIP: CPlex, NLP: Ipopt, Conopt, Algencan).
Attention to detail, adaptability, teamwork, and responsiveness.
Programming: Outstanding programming skills (experimental code or ICPC winner) in C/C++ and Octave programming (programming skills in FORTRAN is considered as a plus)

Expertise in network optimization methods and algorithms: list of achievements and publications (Springer: JOTA, COAP, AMO, JGO, NUMA, etc. Wiley: Networks, IEEE JSAC, IEEE Transactions on Communications, etc.) ‚Äìnote: theoretical knowledge of abstract algorithms not sufficient

Position: Jr. Research Scientist

Location: Brussels/Leuven, Belgium


Role Overview

We seek a motivated Junior Research Scientist with a PhD (up to 2 years post-PhD) in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematical Engineering, or Operational Research.


Your Responsibilities

  • Develop novel methods and algorithms customized for solving network optimization problems involving nonlinear coupling constraints, nonconvex/nonlinear composite objective functions, etc.
  • Validate (numerically/experimentally) solutions using real-life datasets.
  • Integrate them as part of product-grade solver framework for automated execution.


Required Skills

  • Network optimization including network design, network embedding, routing/traffic assignment, resource allocation, flow/resource scheduling, etc.
  • Optimization Expertise: Mixed-integer nonlinear programming (mandatory) and iterative methods like quasi-Newton, primal-dual methods (Lagrangian methods, etc.), interior point, combinatorial methods: polyhedral methods, etc.
  • Programming: Proficiency in C/C++, Fortran, and Octave.
  • Tools: Good knowledge of MI(N)LP solving frameworks such as Gurobi, SCIP, Couenne/COIN-OR, SHOT/COIN-OR, Bonmin, etc. and subsolvers (e.g. MIP: CPlex, NLP: Ipopt, Conopt, Algencan).


Soft Skills

  • Attention to detail, adaptability, teamwork, and responsiveness.


Application Requirements

  • CV highlighting:
  • Programming: Outstanding programming skills (experimental code or ICPC winner) in C/C++ and Octave programming (programming skills in FORTRAN is considered as a plus)
  • Expertise in network optimization methods and algorithms: list of achievements and publications (Springer: JOTA, COAP, AMO, JGO, NUMA, etc. Wiley: Networks, IEEE JSAC, IEEE Transactions on Communications, etc.) ‚Äìnote: theoretical knowledge of abstract algorithms not sufficient
  • Languages: Proficiency in English (Dutch/Mandarin beneficial).

3899046018,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-h-f-at-littlebigcode-3899046018?position=38&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=OpYYaKN9q39Q1VBz7vdqHA%3D%3D,Data Scientist (H/F),LittleBigCode,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","LittleBigCode is a digital consulting laboratory specializing in Data and Artificial Intelligence. Our mission is to democratize the use of these technologies by co-building useful applications with our customers for the Society of the future, particularly on subjects related to health, mobility or the environment.

For this, we deliver turnkey projects and also work on consulting assignments while developing our own solutions. Finally, we combine Cloud technologies, AGILE methods and DevOps culture to facilitate industrialization and scaling up.
A community of more than 40 enthusiasts of Data Science & Data Engineering domains
International presence & missions ‚Äì we are launching our new office in Belgium!
Workshops, Innovation contests, customers challenges taken up
As such, we are looking to build our technical team in Belgium ! Join us !
What will be your tasks with us ?
You will work in Agile mode and you will support our client on their challenges related to Data and production.
You will be working in the following areas:
Business case study with business teams
Analysis of customer data and processes in order to study their valuation
Going into production with Data Engineers
Ensure a technological watch in order to propose innovations
You have a Master in engineering (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics‚Ä¶) and you have some experiences as a Data Scientist !
You have bases in the realization of POC, the development of models and applications starting from- scratch as well as in the putting into production
You master programming best practices such as code versionning (git), IDE use (PyCharm fore.g.), testing, use of CI/CD tools
You are fully proficient in Python, Machine learning & Deep learning frameworks (Scikit-Learn & Tensorflow for e.g.) and DataViz tools
You have experiences with Data services of at least one the major Cloud Provider (Azure, AWS, GCP)
You are familiar with some of the following domains: time series, NLP, Computer Vision, reinforcement learning, IoT
Note that we are also big devotees of DevOps so the more you are comfortable with it, all the better!
Fluent in English + in Dutch and/or French

4192243934,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-at-seedtag-4192243934?position=39&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=VsBv9eEOAU7y34EYEprdjg%3D%3D,Data Scientist,Seedtag,European Union,"We‚Äôre looking for a Data Scientist to join our team and help shape the future of contextual advertising as we continue to expand globally.
At Seedtag our goal is to lead the change in the advertising industry because we believe that effective advertising should not be at odds with users‚Äô privacy.

By combining Natural Language Processing and Computer Vision our proprietary, Machine Learning-based technology provides a human-like understanding of the content of the web that finds the best context for each ad while providing unparalleled risk-mitigation capabilities that protect advertisers from showing their ads on pages that could be damaging for their brand. All of this, without relying on cookies or any other tracking mechanisms.

Every day, our teams develop new services that reach over 200 million users worldwide with fast response times to ensure that we deliver the best user experience. We‚Äôre fully committed to the DevOps culture, where we provide the platform that our Software Developers and Data Scientists use to manage over 100 different microservices, pushing dozens of changes to production every day. All of this is built on top of Kubernetes in Google Cloud Platform and Amazon Web Services.
If you are interested in joining one of the fastest-growing scale-ups in Europe and working on massive scalability challenges, this is the place for you.

As a member of our data science team, you will take on the task of developing bidding optimizations through NLP applications, such as large language models, scalable embeddings, and network analysis solutions.
You will be responsible for building and improving bidding functionalities which will have a direct impact on our client‚Äôs advertising KPIs.

You will explore the applicability of LLMs for production, crafting solutions that can handle real-world, large-scale challenges, particularly in areas like contextualization, personalization, and relevance optimization.
You will work on end-to-end projects, taking solutions from concept to production, and focusing on creating scalable, efficient, and impactful solutions.
Collaborating closely with our cross-functional teams, your work will be aligned with business goals and drive the practical application of your solutions.

Our core tech values reflect our commitment to delivering exceptional results, fostering a culture of continuous learning, and always putting the customer's needs first. We believe that success comes from focusing on the outcomes rather than just the output. Our tech team aims to solve problems that make a meaningful difference, and we measure our success by the impact we have on the customer.
Failure is allowed, learning is a must

We also recognize that failure is an inevitable part of the innovation process. Our team understands that setbacks are opportunities to learn and grow. We believe in testing early and often, and we continuously iterate and improve until we arrive at the best solution.

Another core value we hold is that we are all scouts. We believe in leaving things better than we found them. This means we take ownership of our work and strive to improve the systems and processes we touch. We encourage our team members to be proactive in identifying areas for improvement, and we value those who take the initiative to implement positive changes. Our goal is to leave a lasting, positive impact on our projects and our team.

Lastly, our team is data-driven. We believe that making informed decisions based on data is crucial to our success. Our team uses data to guide our decision-making process and to identify opportunities for improvement. We are committed to using data to continuously monitor and optimize our models and processes to ensure that we are delivering the best possible outcome for our customers.

We have to support 120k requests per second running with ML models in production answering within 10 milliseconds! We have this running in production with Python and GoLang microservices using datalakes, GCS, Redis, Kinesis or Kafka. All this is constantly deployed in GCP using Kubernetes and other kinds of production stacks. The current stack outputs 20 TB of daily data having them ready to use for analytics and more with easy and low latency access.
In the rest of the company, we also develop in Typescript for Nodejs and Scala making use of technologies like Kafka, Druid and MongoDB all over the Google Cloud Platform.
You bring 3-5 years of experience in data science and machine learning, with relevant experience in developing ML/NLP applications at scale to address real-world business challenges.

You possess strong software engineering skills and a track record of deploying machine learning models in production environments, with proficiency in Python and experience in libraries relevant to NLP and embedding frameworks.
You have a strong academic background in fields such as Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or similar, with a focus on quantitative analysis and problem-solving.

You have hands-on experience with end-to-end project workflows, from data exploration to deployment, proven ability to scale embeddings for high-volume data environments, and are skilled at managing both the technical and business aspects of data projects.
You are proactive, entrepreneurial, and adaptable, with a commitment to leveraging data and machine learning to drive impactful, measurable business outcomes in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Growth & Opportunity: A key moment to join with vast career development prospects.

Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you to balance work and life effortlessly with the option to a 100% remote (Please note that while we operate as a 100% remote company, we can only extend contracts within Europe in countries where we have established legal entities: Spain, Italy, the UK, Belgium, the Netherlands, France, and Germany) or hybrid work setup, depending on what works best.
Learning & Development: Online courses in ODILO, and optional English or Spanish group classes.
Inclusive Culture: We foster a supportive environment that values personal growth.
Fun & Connection: Participate in team activities, company offsites, and more!
Flexible benefits plan: Restaurant, transportation, and kindergarten vouchers.
Gympass: Access to wellness programs and fitness classes.
Seedsave Program: Exclusive discounts to help you save for the future.
Build your home office with a gross budget of up to 1K‚Ç¨ (external screen, chair, table...)
Paid travels to our HQ in Madrid to work p2p with your squad members
Ready to join the Seedtag adventure? Send us your CV and let‚Äôs grow together!

At Seedtag, we‚Äôre committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. We welcome diverse perspectives as they fuel our innovation and growth. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the hiring process and we‚Äôll ensure a positive and accessible experience.

We‚Äôre looking for a Data Scientist to join our team and help shape the future of contextual advertising as we continue to expand globally.


Who We Are

At Seedtag our goal is to lead the change in the advertising industry because we believe that effective advertising should not be at odds with users‚Äô privacy.

By combining Natural Language Processing and Computer Vision our proprietary, Machine Learning-based technology provides a human-like understanding of the content of the web that finds the best context for each ad while providing unparalleled risk-mitigation capabilities that protect advertisers from showing their ads on pages that could be damaging for their brand. All of this, without relying on cookies or any other tracking mechanisms.

Every day, our teams develop new services that reach over 200 million users worldwide with fast response times to ensure that we deliver the best user experience. We‚Äôre fully committed to the DevOps culture, where we provide the platform that our Software Developers and Data Scientists use to manage over 100 different microservices, pushing dozens of changes to production every day. All of this is built on top of Kubernetes in Google Cloud Platform and Amazon Web Services.

If you are interested in joining one of the fastest-growing scale-ups in Europe and working on massive scalability challenges, this is the place for you.


Your Challenge

  • As a member of our data science team, you will take on the task of developing bidding optimizations through NLP applications, such as large language models, scalable embeddings, and network analysis solutions.
  • You will be responsible for building and improving bidding functionalities which will have a direct impact on our client‚Äôs advertising KPIs.
  • You will explore the applicability of LLMs for production, crafting solutions that can handle real-world, large-scale challenges, particularly in areas like contextualization, personalization, and relevance optimization.
  • You will work on end-to-end projects, taking solutions from concept to production, and focusing on creating scalable, efficient, and impactful solutions.
  • Collaborating closely with our cross-functional teams, your work will be aligned with business goals and drive the practical application of your solutions.


Our core values

  • Outcome over output

Our core tech values reflect our commitment to delivering exceptional results, fostering a culture of continuous learning, and always putting the customer's needs first. We believe that success comes from focusing on the outcomes rather than just the output. Our tech team aims to solve problems that make a meaningful difference, and we measure our success by the impact we have on the customer.

  • Failure is allowed, learning is a must

We also recognize that failure is an inevitable part of the innovation process. Our team understands that setbacks are opportunities to learn and grow. We believe in testing early and often, and we continuously iterate and improve until we arrive at the best solution.

  • We are all scouts

Another core value we hold is that we are all scouts. We believe in leaving things better than we found them. This means we take ownership of our work and strive to improve the systems and processes we touch. We encourage our team members to be proactive in identifying areas for improvement, and we value those who take the initiative to implement positive changes. Our goal is to leave a lasting, positive impact on our projects and our team.

  • We are data-driven

Lastly, our team is data-driven. We believe that making informed decisions based on data is crucial to our success. Our team uses data to guide our decision-making process and to identify opportunities for improvement. We are committed to using data to continuously monitor and optimize our models and processes to ensure that we are delivering the best possible outcome for our customers.


Tech Stack

We have to support 120k requests per second running with ML models in production answering within 10 milliseconds! We have this running in production with Python and GoLang microservices using datalakes, GCS, Redis, Kinesis or Kafka. All this is constantly deployed in GCP using Kubernetes and other kinds of production stacks. The current stack outputs 20 TB of daily data having them ready to use for analytics and more with easy and low latency access.

In the rest of the company, we also develop in Typescript for Nodejs and Scala making use of technologies like Kafka, Druid and MongoDB all over the Google Cloud Platform.


What You‚Äôll Need to Succeed

  • You bring 3-5 years of experience in data science and machine learning, with relevant experience in developing ML/NLP applications at scale to address real-world business challenges.
  • You possess strong software engineering skills and a track record of deploying machine learning models in production environments, with proficiency in Python and experience in libraries relevant to NLP and embedding frameworks.
  • You have a strong academic background in fields such as Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or similar, with a focus on quantitative analysis and problem-solving.
  • You have hands-on experience with end-to-end project workflows, from data exploration to deployment, proven ability to scale embeddings for high-volume data environments, and are skilled at managing both the technical and business aspects of data projects.
  • You are proactive, entrepreneurial, and adaptable, with a commitment to leveraging data and machine learning to drive impactful, measurable business outcomes in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.


Why Join Seedtag?

Growth &
column2:
Opportunity: A key moment to join with vast career development prospects.

Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you to balance work and life effortlessly with the option to a 100% remote (Please note that while we operate as a 100% remote company, we can only extend contracts within Europe in countries where we have established legal entities: Spain, Italy, the UK, Belgium, the Netherlands, France, and Germany) or hybrid work setup, depending on what works best.

Learning &
column3:
Development: Online courses in ODILO, and optional English or Spanish group classes.

Inclusive Culture: We foster a supportive environment that values personal growth.

Fun &
column4:
Connection: Participate in team activities, company offsites, and more!


Additional Perks

  • Flexible benefits plan: Restaurant, transportation, and kindergarten vouchers.
  • Health insurance: Comprehensive coverage included.
  • Gympass: Access to wellness programs and fitness classes.
  • Seedsave Program: Exclusive discounts to help you save for the future.
  • Build your home office with a gross budget of up to 1K‚Ç¨ (external screen, chair, table...)
  • Paid travels to our HQ in Madrid to work p2p with your squad members
  • Macbook Pro M3


Ready to join the Seedtag adventure? Send us your CV and let‚Äôs grow together!


At Seedtag, we‚Äôre committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. We welcome diverse perspectives as they fuel our innovation and growth. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the hiring process and we‚Äôll ensure a positive and accessible experience.

4203776536,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/machine-learning-engineer-at-curvecatch-4203776536?position=40&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=R6wQ%2BkEBsVw6kmjSA3WKBg%3D%3D,Machine Learning Engineer,CurveCatch,Antwerp Metropolitan Area,"Are you an AI aficionado with a passion for building models that make a real-world impact? Do you dream in Python and get excited by large, clean datasets? Forget needing 100 years of experience, we're looking for a brilliant Machine Learning Engineer ready for a new adventure at a fast-paced, mission-driven startup! If you love tackling complex problems & working with real-world datasets, owning the ML lifecycle, and working with a unique, energetic team, keep reading!

CurveCatch is a Belgian venture-backed startup revolutionising the way people shop for intimate apparel. We‚Äôre a bra shopping companion that plugs into any intimate apparel webshop and uses AI to help shoppers find the perfect bra. We help shoppers with style, shape and size and reduce the number of decisions and clicks they have to make. This way we fast-track them to conversion to grow webshop revenue and shopper delight. We operate on a SaaS business model.
Before launching as a SaaS, we were our own first customer with our home-try-on e-commerce service. It‚Äôs a 7-figure profitable business that allows us to be very close to end-users.

We started from the local specialty shops of founder Kimia‚Äôs parents during Covid. Since then, we‚Äôre a team of 5 and have raised just under ‚Ç¨1 million in pre-seed funding from strategic angels, accelerator XX in San Francisco, an innovation grant, and a grant from Y Combinator.
Never thought your next adventure would be in the lingerie sector? Stick around and find out!

As our Machine Learning Engineer, you'll be pivotal in developing and deploying the AI that powers CurveCatch's personalization magic. You'll work across the ML lifecycle to deliver impactful models and shape our AI strategy. Your responsibilities will likely include:
Designing, developing, training, and deploying machine learning/deep learning(DL) models to enhance product personalization (style, shape, size) and recommendation systems.
Researching and implementing novel ML and/or deep learning techniques and algorithms suitable for our unique lingerie domain datasets.
Managing and improving the end-to-end ML workflow, including data preparation, feature engineering, model training, validation, deployment, and monitoring in production.
Optimizing ML/DL models and infrastructure for performance, scalability, and cost-effectiveness (leveraging tools like AWS Sagemaker, Metaflow, W&B and making smart use of cloud credits).

Collaborating closely with the CTO (Nils) on the AI/R&D roadmap, data strategy, and continuous improvement of our MLOps processes and lean ML toolstack (DBT, Snowflake, Metaflow, AWS Sagemaker, PyTorch, Metabase, Hex, W&B, etc.).
Working with our full-stack engineer (Denis) on infrastructure decisions impacting data and AI systems.
Providing input on product features related to ML/DL models and data collection, championing data quality (""garbage in, garbage out"").
Actively seeking and implementing ways to automate and streamline ML/DL processes to maximize time spent on ML/DL modelling itself and impact.
Proven 5 years+ of relevant industry experience designing, building, training, and deploying machine learning/deep learning models in a production environment.
Strong theoretical understanding and practical application of ML/DL fundamentals (algorithms, evaluation, statistics, feature engineering).
Strong proficiency in Python and common ML libraries/frameworks (e.g., Pandas, Scikit-learn, PyTorch, ..).
You have a degree (Bachelor's, Master's or PhD) in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Statistics, Mathematics or related discipline.

Hands-on experience with deploying ML systems in the cloud at least 1 major cloud platform (AWS preferred, GCP useful) and familiarity with MLOps principles and tools (e.g., Metaflow, W&B, Sagemaker, or similar).
A pragmatic approach focused on delivering impactful ML solutions efficiently in a small team (""garbage in, garbage out"" mindset, passion for automation).
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to independently drive research and development projects.
Hands-on experience with personalization models or recommendation systems in production.
Hands-on experience with integrating LLMs and fine-tuning GenAI models on customer datasets in production.
Experience working in an e-commerce environment and building ML/DL models for e-commerce use-cases.
Experience working in a start-up environment.
Proficient in SQL and experience with data engineering and data warehousing concepts (experience with tools like DBT, Snowflake is a plus).
Experience with any of our specific stack tools (DBT, Snowflake, Metaflow, W&B, Sagemaker, Hex, Metabase).
Experience mentoring junior data professionals or interns.
üëä WHY IS YOUR ROLE CRUCIAL FOR US?

Your work is core to our product's unique value. You will directly accelerate the development and release of our foundational AI models, making our service significantly more compelling through deeper personalization and accuracy. Without you, our AI development would be slower, limiting the product features and value we can offer to our customers. Your contributions will directly impact business outcomes by optimizing revenue through better recommendations or reducing costs through automation, ensuring CurveCatch stays at the forefront of AI in this domain.
Kimia (CEO): Our growth & finance lead, the push-up bra of the team ‚Äì an eternal dreamer and optimist driving us forward.
Nils (CTO): Our tech & data guru, the spacer bra ‚Äì the experimenter and brain behind our innovations. (You'll work very closely with Nils, defining the roadmap and improving our ML stack).
Lore (Operations Manager): Our process & onboarding expert, the balcony bra ‚Äì keeping us all tightly together.
Denis (Engineering): Our seamless bra, making complex engineering look simple. (You'll collaborate with Denis on engineering/data intersections).
Veerle, Sanne, Marjolein and Eden (Lingerie Guides): Our frontline experts providing incredible customer support.

Machine Learning Engineer (You!): You'll be the driving force behind our production ML models and AI capabilities. You'll have significant autonomy and impact, with the willingness to potentially coach a junior/intern down the line as the team grows.
üíî WHY WOULDN'T YOU LIKE THIS ROLE?
You prefer highly specialized roles (e.g., only doing research for papers, only MLOps) rather than working across the full ML lifecycle from raw data to deployment to model babysitting.
You thrive in large, established teams with extensive existing infrastructure and tooling support (we value a lean setup).
You dislike ambiguity and prefer very clearly defined tasks over exploring datasets and proposing solutions.
You aren't passionate about maintaining high data quality as a foundation for good models.
Honestly ‚Ä¶ we can't think of anything else. This is an out-of-this-world opportunity üöÄ!
Build the Rocket While Flying It: Expect to learn constantly, take ownership, embrace challenges collaboratively, and value progress over perfection. It's an adventure!
Catch the Day, Every Day: We move fast, focus on daily impact, make quick decisions, and enjoy the team journey ‚Äì 'mud splatters and all'.
Brain, Belly, Blast Off: We combine data-driven insights with a strong drive to act, all focused on our mission to close the gender data gap (fuelled by facts... and occasional Indian food!).
üö© WHAT DOES THE PROCESS LOOK LIKE?
We believe in a transparent process and value your time. Here‚Äôs what you can generally expect:
Application Review: We carefully review your application and aim to reply within one week.
Intro Call (30 mins): A brief virtual chat with Lore (HR Manager) to get a first impression and discuss basics like salary expectations.
Technical background interview (45 mins): A meeting with your future manager to ensure technical competencies match, initial alignment and fit.
Take-Home Assignment + debrief meeting (2 hours): We‚Äôll send you a practical assignment relevant to the role's core skills for you to complete at your convenience.

Team Fit Interviews (2 hours, In-Person): If the assignment went well, we'll invite you for the final interview stage. This involves meeting key team members and having a more extensive conversation with your manager. This 2-hour session takes place in person, typically at our Antwerp co-working space.
Final Offer: If it's a great match on both sides, we'll extend an offer!
We'll keep you informed of your status throughout the process, and our goal is to move through all steps within a maximum of 4 weeks.
Stock options? Heck yeah, we're building CurveCatch together!
Work from anywhere (within a 3-hour timezone difference from Belgium). We value connection, so we huddle together 1 day per week in our co-working space in Antwerp (typically Thursdays).
Adventurous team getaways 1x per quarter (expect the unexpected!).
Personal development plan and budget/coaching opportunities.
A super cool, supportive, and mission-driven team applying AI to a unique domain!
The chance to genuinely support (üòú) the lives and confidence of half the population (not a bad stat to tell your family in law at Christmas, right?).

Are you an AI aficionado with a passion for building models that make a real-world impact? Do you dream in Python and get excited by large, clean datasets? Forget needing 100 years of experience, we're looking for a brilliant Machine Learning Engineer ready for a new adventure at a fast-paced, mission-driven startup! If you love tackling complex problems &
column2:

4204357624,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/machine-learning-engineer-at-orange-4204357624?position=41&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=%2Fin%2Fe0a5BEg0z99Tl8LoLw%3D%3D,Machine Learning Engineer,Orange,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","As a collaborator in the Machine Learning team, you ensure the different predictive models and algorithms are running qualitatively and on time in the production environment also called the model factory. The mission of the machine learning engineer is key because this role makes the bridge between the products delivered by the Data Science team and the usage of the business.

The machine learning engineer will also cover some more technical missions as for example web scraping, POC‚Äôs concerning AI & Generative AI (in order to ensure a move to production for those POC‚Äôs).
The Machine Learning team is responsible for the quality of the models and as a consequence of the value created by the models that will be used by all the internal clients.
Deploy large scale machine learning models and other scripts into production environment (in cloud and on-premise environments)
Review, optimize and simplify the code to ensure quality and reusability
Monitor the quality of input variables and the performances of the models‚Äô outputs.
Contribute to parts of the ML pipeline, such as data preprocessing, feature selection, and model evaluation.
Collaborate with data scientists, software engineers, and product teams to integrate models into production.
Monitor model performance and updates models as needed
Solve well-defined machine learning problems and may work on smaller projects or parts of larger projects.
Apply existing algorithms and techniques to specific business problems
Expert understanding of git, experience with CI/CD pipelines
Proficiency at Python and solid knowledge of at least one deep learning framework such as TensorFlow / Keras or PyTorch is a must.
Knowledge of machine learning techniques, general deep learning, predictive modelling and Generative AI in order to be able to challenge the inputs and the outputs produced by the Data Science team
Understanding of Google Cloud Platform, ML Ops principles and software development tools/best practices
Expertise in Data Ingestion / Processing and Modelling: you are able to express complex data needs and understand data quality-cleansing processes & methods
Extensive Corporate Data Knowledge: aware of critical company business processes and underlying data, you are able to challenge data quality
Fluency in SQL for writing efficient queries on large datasets
Good knowledge of Linux operating system
Ability to write robust code in Python, R and Java
Good to have: good knowledge of networking, multiprocessing, parallel computing and real-time computations
Should be able to challenge the inputs and outputs of AI and Gen AI products as well as the way it was built.
Master's degree in a related field (e.g., Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics) or equivalent work experience. with 2-5 years of experience in machine learning or related fields
Proficient in key machine learning tools and frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn)
Strong programming and data analytics skills
Able to work and collaborate transversally
Collaboration skills (with other data scientists, data engineers and other teams)
Capacity to influence and engage, assertiveness and being diplomatic
Fluent English and fluent French or Dutch

You will make the difference in this highly innovative vibe. As a result, you will develop your full potential by working with highly skilled colleagues and through continuous training. Moreover, you can count on a highly competitive and versatile compensation (market competitive salary, company car or legal mobility budget, homeworking and net allowance, performance bonus, meal vouchers) and benefits package.
Inspired? Please send us your resume and we will rapidly get back to you to invite you for further interviews.

4193450441,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-data-scientist-nlp-ml-at-uni-systems-4193450441?position=44&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=5BmS54o1px5QwqT3LT9HlA%3D%3D,Senior Data Scientist (NLP & ML),Uni Systems,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","At Uni Systems, we are working towards turning digital visions into reality. We are continuously growing and we are looking for a Senior Data Scientist (NLP & ML) to join our UniQue team.
What will you be doing in this role?
Collect business requirement and develop advanced data mining solutions or identify, assess and deploy relevant existing data mining, machine learning and business intelligence solutions
Specification and design of presentation interfaces with optimal usability/user experience
Development and maintenance of software applications in the field of Natural Language Processing (NLP), Machine Learning (ML) and/or Artificial Intelligence (AI)
Identify, collect, convert and update different data types/sets in several locations (e.g. ETL)
Produce data models according to specific problems statements
Contribute to the design and implementation of the analytics architecture and its solution stack (including performance aspects, physical design, capacity dimensions)
Write the different documentation associated with the tasks and liaise with other project teams as necessary to address cross-project interdependencies
What do you need to succeed in this position?
Master's degree in IT field with minimum 13 years of relevant experience (or Bachelor's degree with minimum 17 years of relevant experience

At least 5 years of experience with machine learning and Natural Language Processing techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, Neural Network, and/or artificial intelligence frameworks
At least 5 years experience with Python, Perl, Matlab, R and its NLP/ML libraries (SpaCy, NLTK, scikit-learn, pandas)
Minimum 2 years of Data Management and ETL processes and tools (i.e. Talend Open Studio)
At least 2 years with business intelligence tools (Tableau, SAS, SAP, GoodData)
Minimum 2 years of experience with SQL tooling (NoSQL DB, MongoDB, Hadoop, SQL) and Cloud (AWS, Azure)
At least 2 years experience with Linux, Unix and Bash
Proficient in continuous code delivery and unit testing
At least 2 years experience of natural language processing systems lifecycle and agile software development methodologies

Good knowledge of quality assurance and quality control for machine translation (MT) and experience with MT quality procedures, testing methodologies and tools, such as automatic quality metrics (BLEU scores and similar) and human evaluation of MT quality
Knowledge of data visualisation tools, such as D3.js, GGplot
Knowledge in Database Mining systems and in Big Data technologies

Knowledge in one of the following areas{‚Äã{:}} predictive (forecasting, recommendation), prescriptive (simulation), sentiment analysis, topic detection, plagiarism detection, trends/anomalies detection in datasets, recommendation system

Contract Type: Long-term EU Institution Project

We are seeking a Senior Data Scientist to work on advanced data analytics and AI-driven solutions for European institutions. The role involves developing and deploying machine learning models, analyzing complex datasets, and providing strategic insights for decision-making.
Minimum 4 years of higher education in ICT, Mathematics, or a related field
At least 8 years of experience in IT, including 4 years in data science
Expertise in Python, R, SQL, and machine learning frameworks
Experience with data visualization, big data platforms, and statistical modeling
A high-impact role in major EU projects
Long-term stability and career growth opportunities
If you meet the above requirements, please send your CV to:

Senior Data Scientist

Location: Brussels, Belgium (On-site or Remote)

Contract Type: Long-term EU Institution Project

EU Citizenship Required



Job Description

We are seeking a Senior Data Scientist to work on advanced data analytics and AI-driven solutions for European institutions. The role involves developing and deploying machine learning models, analyzing complex datasets, and providing strategic insights for decision-making.



Requirements

  • Minimum 4 years of higher education in ICT, Mathematics, or a related field
  • At least 8 years of experience in IT, including 4 years in data science
  • Expertise in Python, R, SQL, and machine learning frameworks
  • Experience with data visualization, big data platforms, and statistical modeling
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Fluent in English



Offer

  • A high-impact role in major EU projects
  • Long-term stability and career growth opportunities
  • Competitive compensation package



If you meet the above requirements, please send your CV to:

4182360198,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/%E2%9A%99%EF%B8%8F-junior-machine-learning-engineer-at-dataroots-4182360198?position=46&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=cKz3OzqPYPWmL2ByNsO4WA%3D%3D,‚öôÔ∏è Junior Machine Learning Engineer,dataroots,"Leuven, Flemish Region, Belgium","Do you want to kickstart your career in Data & AI? Then you‚Äôll definitely be interested in our training program for young graduates!
Please note that candidates hired for this position will start on Monday, the 1st of September 2025.
If you're excited about data, enjoy exploring new ideas, and want to create machine learning models that make a real difference, you'll fit right in!
As a Junior Machine Learning Engineer, you‚Äôll use your expertise to deliver tailored, high-quality AI solutions from start to finish.

At Dataroots, we combine our consulting approach with strong technical skills to build machine learning models that help businesses improve how they operate. As a Junior Machine Learning Engineer, you‚Äôll join our team of specialists (including Data Engineers, Cloud Architects, and Data Strategists) working together to design, build, and implement data-powered solutions for our clients.

We also encourage learning and growth! You'll have chances to learn from and mentor other teammates, share what you know, and keep up-to-date with the latest industry trends through our internal training and development programs.

Since 2016, Dataroots has been committing its excellent consulting services to help clients excel in their data-driven operations. Our approach focuses on team well-being, fostering diversity, and promoting knowledge sharing. By focusing on these values, we've achieved healthy and sustainable growth over the years. Through our services, we actively encourage professional growth by exposing our employees to different industries, tools, technologies,... broadening their scope in the process.
As part of the Talan Group, we are able to take this approach to the next level, adding the element of international mobility to our employees‚Äô career journey.
Join a team where your work will have a direct impact on both our clients and our journey. Learn more about our DNA at [https://dataroots.io/our-dna].
You're strongly motivated to become an excellent Machine Learning Engineer.
Solving problems is what drives you, and you understand Machine Learning is a means to achieve this, not the end itself.
You have a solid foundation in Machine Learning theory and have trained and/or deployed your first AI models.
GenAI is more than a vague news term to you. You‚Äôre familiar with the concept on a more than superficial level.
Programming in Python and SQL is something you‚Äôre very comfortable with.
Cloud platforms like AWS, GCP or Azure are not entirely new to you. You‚Äôve been in contact with at least one.
You have heard of tools like Apache Spark and Databricks and understand their use in the data landscape.
CI/CD or MLOps aren't Star Wars characters and you‚Äôre aware of this. You are interested in learning about data architecture and infrastructure.
Picking up on new technologies and frameworks comes naturally to you and doesn‚Äôt scare you.
You have an analytics and solution oriented mindset.
Helping clients in overcoming their challenges energizes you. You have strong communication skills and like putting them to use.
A first practical experience is considered a big plus (internship, personal project, first professional experience,‚Ä¶)
You speak Dutch & English fluently, knowledge of French is a plus.

This list was probably a bit much. Don't worry, we don't expect you to tick every box from the beginning. Most of all: we are looking for colleagues with the same passion for personal and team development as the rest of us
An attractive salary with extralegal benefits, including:
Mobility budget or a company car with fuel/charging card

Diverse and welcoming work environment, where you‚Äôll collaborate & unwind with colleagues from different cultures and disciplines. The organization of both fun & professional events and initiatives is actively encouraged and supported.
Opportunities for individual training and team learning.
Tons of team-building events and sports initiatives to stay connected and unwind.

Our main offices are in Leuven and Ghent, with co-working spaces in Antwerp. These spaces are perfect for both focusing and unwinding with colleagues, as well as brainstorming sessions and team events. While much of your work can be performed remotely, you will also work on-site with clients.
Excited to shape the future of AI as a Machine Learning Engineer with us? We‚Äôre looking forward to hearing from you! Apply now and start a new chapter with Dataroots!

AI? Then you‚Äôll definitely be interested in our training program for young graduates!

Please note that candidates hired for this position will start on Monday, the 1st of September 2025.

 The Job

If you're excited about data, enjoy exploring new ideas, and want to create machine learning models that make a real difference, you'll fit right in!

As a Junior Machine Learning Engineer, you‚Äôll use your expertise to deliver tailored, high-quality AI solutions from start to finish.

At Dataroots, we combine our consulting approach with strong technical skills to build machine learning models that help businesses improve how they operate. As a Junior Machine Learning Engineer, you‚Äôll join our team of specialists (including Data Engineers, Cloud Architects, and Data Strategists) working together to design, build, and implement data-powered solutions for our clients.

We also encourage learning and growth! You'll have chances to learn from and mentor other teammates, share what you know, and keep up-to-date with the latest industry trends through our internal training and development programs.

What You'll Find At Dataroots

Since 2016, Dataroots has been committing its excellent consulting services to help clients excel in their data-driven operations. Our approach focuses on team well-being, fostering diversity, and promoting knowledge sharing. By focusing on these values, we've achieved healthy and sustainable growth over the years. Through our services, we actively encourage professional growth by exposing our employees to different industries, tools, technologies,... broadening their scope in the process.

As part of the Talan Group, we are able to take this approach to the next level, adding the element of international mobility to our employees‚Äô career journey.

Join a team where your work will have a direct impact on both our clients and our journey. Learn more about our DNA at [https://dataroots.io/our-dna].

What We‚Äôre Looking For

  • You're strongly motivated to become an excellent Machine Learning Engineer.
  • Solving problems is what drives you, and you understand Machine Learning is a means to achieve this, not the end itself.
  • You have a solid foundation in Machine Learning theory and have trained and/or deployed your first AI models.
  • GenAI is more than a vague news term to you. You‚Äôre familiar with the concept on a more than superficial level.
  • Programming in Python and SQL is something you‚Äôre very comfortable with.
  • Cloud platforms like AWS, GCP or Azure are not entirely new to you. You‚Äôve been in contact with at least one.
  • You have heard of tools like Apache Spark and Databricks and understand their use in the data landscape.
  • CI/CD or MLOps aren't Star Wars characters and you‚Äôre aware of this. You are interested in learning about data architecture and infrastructure.
  • Picking up on new technologies and frameworks comes naturally to you and doesn‚Äôt scare you.
  • You have an analytics and solution oriented mindset.
  • Helping clients in overcoming their challenges energizes you. You have strong communication skills and like putting them to use.
  • A first practical experience is considered a big plus (internship, personal project, first professional experience,‚Ä¶)
  • You speak Dutch &

4195447166,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/machine-learning-engineer-at-red-global-4195447166?position=47&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=2RjRsU8THydMC4NQmFcpJA%3D%3D,Machine Learning Engineer,RED Global,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","RED Global is currently recruiting for a Machine Learning Engineer - AI for our client, a global organisation who undertaking a large complex digital transformation program. They are looking to bring on board an experienced ML Engineer ‚Äì AI with extensive experience of Machine Learning, Generative AI, Solution architecture and Data Science platforms.
Responsible to define and implement best practices for building, testing, and deploying scalable AI solutions with a strong focus on generative models and LLM.
Design and implement solutions with the use of ML and Generative AI tools and technologies, with a strong focus on end-to-end automation.
Accountable to build and design cloud hosted generative AI solutions.
Work closely with customers to identify issues and support them in implementation of their ML ecosystem.
Develop Solutions to ensure robust and secure data pipelines and infrastructure to support AI model training and deployment.
Stay updated on the latest trends and technologies in Generative AI and Machine Learning.
Lead the evaluation of new AI tools, frameworks, and methodologies.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and Dutch or French with good senior level stakeholder management soft skills and competencies.
4+ years‚Äô experience in designing and building AI solutions.
Hands on expertise in ML techniques, deep learning frameworks, image processing and AI-related technologies including Generative AI.
Previous worked across various cloud platforms such as AWS and Azure.
Must have experience of using data science platforms such as Databricks, AzureML, SageMaker and frameworks such as TensorFlow or similar.
Good knowledge of DevOps, MLOps, DataOps and LLMOps principles.
Native Dutch or French speaker and professional working proficiency in English.

RED Global is currently recruiting for a Machine Learning Engineer - AI for our client, a global organisation who undertaking a large complex digital transformation program. They are looking to bring on board an experienced ML Engineer ‚Äì AI with extensive experience of Machine Learning, Generative AI, Solution architecture and Data Science platforms.

Key responsibilities:

  • Responsible to define and implement best practices for building, testing, and deploying scalable AI solutions with a strong focus on generative models and LLM.
  • Design and implement solutions with the use of ML and Generative AI tools and technologies, with a strong focus on end-to-end automation.
  • Accountable to build and design cloud hosted generative AI solutions.
  • Work closely with customers to identify issues and support them in implementation of their ML ecosystem.
  • Develop Solutions to ensure robust and secure data pipelines and infrastructure to support AI model training and deployment.
  • Stay updated on the latest trends and technologies in Generative AI and Machine Learning.
  • Lead the evaluation of new AI tools, frameworks, and methodologies.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and Dutch or French with good senior level stakeholder management soft skills and competencies.


Required skills:

  • 4+ years‚Äô experience in designing and building AI solutions.
  • Hands on expertise in ML techniques, deep learning frameworks, image processing and AI-related technologies including Generative AI.
  • Previous worked across various cloud platforms such as AWS and Azure.
  • Must have experience of using data science platforms such as Databricks, AzureML, SageMaker and frameworks such as TensorFlow or similar.
  • Good knowledge of DevOps, MLOps, DataOps and LLMOps principles.
  • Native Dutch or French speaker and professional working proficiency in English.

You will build and deploy AI models that power groundbreaking filmmaking tools. Collaborate globally, code with precision, and drive innovation through data-driven testing.

Big bonus if you have GenAI Experience i.e. Flux, Stable Diffusion

Opportunity to work with cutting-edge tech with cinematic magic.


Position: Machine Learning Engineer

Location: Remote in Europe

Salary up to $90,000


You will build and deploy AI models that power groundbreaking filmmaking tools. Collaborate globally, code with precision, and drive innovation through data-driven testing.


Role:

  • Craft robust and efficient machine learning pipelines tailored for filmmaking applications.
  • Deliver clean, well-documented, and maintainable Python code.
  • Conduct rigorous A/B testing and performance analysis to optimize models and ensure they meet key metrics.
  • Ensure models are deployed effectively in production environments, leveraging cloud services and containerization.


Qualifications:

  • Deep Python/PyTorch expertise
  • 3+ years relevant ML experience

Wij zoeken een AI Developer die mee het verschil wil maken in de verdere ontwikkeling van Sheepblue, onze nieuwe AI-software voor personeelsplanning.

Protime is een succesvolle internationale aanbieder van Workforce Management oplossingen. Met onze software en expertise helpen wij bedrijven om effici√´nter om te gaan met de tijd van hun werknemers: hun Human Capital, dus. Bij Protime krijg je de kans om te groeien, nieuwe dingen te proberen, je talenten te benutten en verder te ontplooien, ‚Ä¶ Er heerst een sfeer van samenwerking: together we get the job done. Je krijgt veel autonomie en kan ownership nemen in je rol, maar je staat er nooit alleen voor.

Om ons workforce management portfolio verder uit te breiden, hebben we recent Sheepblue, een Oostenrijkse start-up, overgenomen. Sheepblue is een AI-software voor personeelsplanning, gespecialiseerd in sectoren die werken met ploegendiensten en nauwkeurige planningsmogelijkheden vereisen, zoals de productie- of logistieke sector.
Wat je zal doen bij Protime als AI Developer

We zijn op zoek naar iemand met een passie voor het optimaliseren van AI-algoritmes, die graag wil bijdragen aan de verdere ontwikkeling van onze Sheepblue-toepassing en de integratie ervan binnen de Protime Suite.
Ondersteunen van complexe planningsscenario‚Äôs en het analyseren van onverklaarbare resultaten van het AI-algoritme.
Diepgaand inzicht verwerven in het AI-planningsalgoritme, met specifieke focus op de Monte Carlo Tree Search-methodiek.
Verbeteren van het algoritme door aanvullende technieken toe te passen, zoals lokale zoekstrategie√´n na Monte Carlo Tree Search.
Nieuwe algoritmes onderzoeken en implementeren om de planningskwaliteit te verhogen.
De AI-module uitbreiden zodat deze compatibel is met Strobbo.
Ben jij de AI Developer die we zoeken?
Je bent een zelfstandige werker met een passie voor artifici√´le intelligentie, innovatie en continue verbetering.
Je beschikt over een master- of bachelordiploma in Computerwetenschappen, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, Toegepaste Informatica of een gelijkwaardige richting.
Je hebt ervaring met AI-gedreven systemen en beschikt over een sterke wiskundige basis in algoritmes, optimalisatie en beslissingsmodellen.
Kennis van productieplannings¬≠processen is een pluspunt.
Sterke programmeervaardigheden (bij voorkeur in Kotlin/Java en Angular) zijn een plus.
Ervaring met .NET Core en/of React is mooi meegenomen.
Je bent een uitstekende communicator en kunt zowel zelfstandig als in teamverband goed werken.
Je hebt een sterk probleemoplossend vermogen en neemt graag initiatief.
Protime is een groeibedrijf met een internationale mindset. Dat betekent dat jij impact kan maken, jezelf voortdurend kan blijven ontwikkelen en kan meegroeien met het bedrijf.
Werken bij Protime staat voor werken binnen een omgeving met snelle beslissingsprocedures en korte communicatielijnen. We omarmen verandering en nieuwe idee√´n worden volop aangemoedigd.
We houden ervan ons werk en elkaar naar een hoger niveau te tillen. Samen presteren op ons best en voldoening halen uit ons werk: daar gaan we voor!
Bij ons werk je hybride: afwisselend vanop ons kantoor in Mechelen en van thuis. De werktijden zijn flexibel. De focus ligt op de kwaliteit van je werk.

Je brutoloon wordt aangevuld met een wagen en tankkaart, maaltijdcheques, hospitalisatieverzekering, groepsverzekering, ecocheques, eindejaarspremie, jaarbonus, voucher voor een GSM, GSM-abonnement, FIP-plan (Flex Income Plan of cafetariaplan).
