4172349919,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/member-of-technical-staff-ai-data-at-microsoft-4172349919?position=6&pageNum=0&refId=7seE469UY6C2FEjLJbbQvg%3D%3D&trackingId=z%2F2FrLg%2BSdybJJrFzb0m2Q%3D%3D,"Member of Technical Staff, AI Data",Microsoft,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","Help build the world‚Äôs most advanced multimodal dataset at Microsoft AI.

We are on a mission to create the largest and most advanced multimodal dataset in the world. This dataset, spanning all modalities from across the web and beyond, will power the training of the world‚Äôs most capable AI frontier models, pushing the boundaries of scale, performance, and product deployment.

The AI Data team at Microsoft AI is responsible for all aspects of data preparation to support our model pre-training operations, including collecting data from the source, extracting and transforming the most useful data, and understanding the impact of changes to data by training and evaluating new models. We are an interdisciplinary team of engineers and scientists, learning from each other, and collaborating to create the best models and products. We work closely with the teams that transform pre-trained models into the models that power the consumer Copilot experience.
We are looking for outstanding individuals excited about contributing to the next generation of systems that will transform the field. In particular, we are looking for candidates who:
Are passionate about the role of data in large-scale AI model training
Will thrive in a highly collaborative, fast-paced environment
Have a high degree of craftsmanship and pay close attention to details
Demonstrate a proactive attitude and enthusiasm for exploring new methods and technologies
Effectively manage multiple responsibilities and can adjust to shifting priorities.
Design and develop data pipelines that ingest enormous amounts of multi-modal training data (text, audio, images, video).
Build and maintain cutting-edge infrastructure that can store and process the petabytes of data needed to power models.
Partner with the pretraining and post-training teams to improve our data recipe by rigorous and careful experimentation.
Collaborate with the product team and other engineers and researchers across Microsoft AI to identify gaps in the current generation of models.

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Math, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field AND experience in business analytics, data science, software development, data modeling or data engineering work

OR Master's Degree in Computer Science, Math, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field AND experience in business analytics, data science, software development, or data engineering work

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Help build the world‚Äôs most advanced multimodal dataset at Microsoft AI.

We are on a mission to create the largest and most advanced multimodal dataset in the world. This dataset, spanning all modalities from across the web and beyond, will power the training of the world‚Äôs most capable AI frontier models, pushing the boundaries of scale, performance, and product deployment.

The AI Data team at Microsoft AI is responsible for all aspects of data preparation to support our model pre-training operations, including collecting data from the source, extracting and transforming the most useful data, and understanding the impact of changes to data by training and evaluating new models. We are an interdisciplinary team of engineers and scientists, learning from each other, and collaborating to create the best models and products. We work closely with the teams that transform pre-trained models into the models that power the consumer Copilot experience.

About

We are looking for outstanding individuals excited about contributing to the next generation of systems that will transform the field. In particular, we are looking for candidates who:

  • Are passionate about the role of data in large-scale AI model training
  • Will thrive in a highly collaborative, fast-paced environment
  • Have a high degree of craftsmanship and pay close attention to details
  • Demonstrate a proactive attitude and enthusiasm for exploring new methods and technologies
  • Effectively manage multiple responsibilities and can adjust to shifting priorities.

Responsibilities

  • Design and develop data pipelines that ingest enormous amounts of multi-modal training data (text, audio, images, video).
  • Build and maintain cutting-edge infrastructure that can store and process the petabytes of data needed to power models.
  • Partner with the pretraining and post-training teams to improve our data recipe by rigorous and careful experimentation.
  • Collaborate with the product team and other engineers and researchers across Microsoft AI to identify gaps in the current generation of models.
  • Embody our culture and values.

Qualifications

Required/Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Math, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field AND experience in business analytics, data science, software development, data modeling or data engineering work
  • OR Master's Degree in Computer Science, Math, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field AND experience in business analytics, data science, software development, or data engineering work
  • OR equivalent experience.

#Copilot #MicrosoftAI

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

4182736562,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-machine-learning-engineer-at-deeprec-ai-4182736562?position=7&pageNum=0&refId=7seE469UY6C2FEjLJbbQvg%3D%3D&trackingId=8llhYKjPXy4UefmkAtrjjw%3D%3D,Senior Machine Learning Engineer,DeepRec.ai,"Zurich, Switzerland","Job Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer

DeepRec.ai is collaborating with a rapidly growing, innovative Biotech company focused on transforming Drug Discovery through AI. if you're passionate about AI for Science, we're seeking a Senior Machine Learning Engineer to join their growing team.

As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer, you will be joining a high-impact, mission-driven team working on the forefront of AI research. You'll have the opportunity to contribute to the development of generative modeling techniques and large language models. Your role will involve building and optimizing state-of-the-art deep learning models, deploying them at scale, and working in a collaborative environment with some of the best minds in AI and Biotech.
This is a unique opportunity to make a significant impact at a well-funded, fast-growing company that is defining the future of AI in the Biotech space.
Design, implement, and deploy machine learning models with a focus on large language models and generative modeling.
Fine-tune and optimize deep learning models at scale, applying advanced hyperparameter tuning techniques.
Collaborate closely with a highly skilled, interdisciplinary team of researchers, engineers, and Biotech experts to integrate AI solutions into real-world applications.
Drive continuous improvements in model performance and scalability.
Stay up-to-date with the latest research and technological advancements in AI/ML and contribute innovative ideas to the team.
3+ years of industry experience in Machine Learning and AI.
Strong expertise in large language models (LLMs), including experience coding, deploying, evaluating, and fine-tuning these models.
Hands-on experience with deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar, and a strong understanding of model training and evaluation.
Proficiency in deploying machine learning models at scale in cloud-based environments (AWS, GCP, Azure, etc.).
Experience with hyperparameter tuning and optimization techniques.
Solid understanding of machine learning algorithms and techniques, particularly in generative modeling and NLP.

Job Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer

Location: Zurich / Remote

Contract: 6-month Freelance (with possibility of extension)


Company Overview:

DeepRec.ai is collaborating with a rapidly growing, innovative Biotech company focused on transforming Drug Discovery through AI. if you're passionate about AI for Science, we're seeking a Senior Machine Learning Engineer to join their growing team.


Job Description:

As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer, you will be joining a high-impact, mission-driven team working on the forefront of AI research. You'll have the opportunity to contribute to the development of generative modeling techniques and large language models. Your role will involve building and optimizing state-of-the-art deep learning models, deploying them at scale, and working in a collaborative environment with some of the best minds in AI and Biotech.

This is a unique opportunity to make a significant impact at a well-funded, fast-growing company that is defining the future of AI in the Biotech space.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Design, implement, and deploy machine learning models with a focus on large language models and generative modeling.
  • Fine-tune and optimize deep learning models at scale, applying advanced hyperparameter tuning techniques.
  • Collaborate closely with a highly skilled, interdisciplinary team of researchers, engineers, and Biotech experts to integrate AI solutions into real-world applications.
  • Drive continuous improvements in model performance and scalability.
  • Stay up-to-date with the latest research and technological advancements in AI/ML and contribute innovative ideas to the team.


Required Skills:

  • 3+ years of industry experience in Machine Learning and AI.
  • Strong expertise in large language models (LLMs), including experience coding, deploying, evaluating, and fine-tuning these models.
  • Hands-on experience with deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar, and a strong understanding of model training and evaluation.
  • Proficiency in deploying machine learning models at scale in cloud-based environments (AWS, GCP, Azure, etc.).
  • Experience with hyperparameter tuning and optimization techniques.
  • Solid understanding of machine learning algorithms and techniques, particularly in generative modeling and NLP.

4203352781,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-60-100%25-at-diabetes-center-berne-4203352781?position=8&pageNum=0&refId=7seE469UY6C2FEjLJbbQvg%3D%3D&trackingId=xsWF4JciOQCZZz2oumv7KA%3D%3D,Data Scientist (60 - 100%),Diabetes Center Berne,"Bern, Berne, Switzerland","The Diabetes Center Berne (DCB) is a private, independent Swiss foundation dedicated to making life with diabetes easier. DCB supports innovative ideas and projects in the field of diabetes technology worldwide by offering expertise, access to clinical research facilities, and its own state-of-the-art laboratories. As a non-profit organization, DCB is driven by a commitment to generate new insights and innovations in diabetes management and to foster a vibrant community.
To support our mission, we are currently looking for a Data Scientist.
Develop, implement and apply semi-physiological models for glucose-insulin metabolism
Analyse complex datasets (high resolution medical device data) using advanced statistical and mathematical models
Strengthen DCB‚Äôs data science capabilities and contribute to its visibility
Support start-ups and partners in tasks related to data science, such as algorithm development or validation
Identify elements and software components to build up the DCB data infrastructure
Provide programming for statistical analysis where required
column2: review and generate study metrics and status reports within and across several studies

column1: Manage, store and process data in accordance with data transfer agreements and client-specific requirements
Write, review, and approve study data analysis documents in compliance with DCB or client SOPsCollaborate closely with clinical project managers and other data team members
Higher education (MSc/PhD in mathematics, statistics, physics, bioinformatics or related field)
Proven experience in analysing health data, ideally in diabetes and/or women‚Äôs health
Solid experience in Python, R or scientific computation
Familiarity with clinical trials, from first-in-human through post marketing
Professional fluency in English, both written and spoken Strong interpersonal skills, with a proactive and collaborative mindset
A modern workplace located in Bern, with the option to work from home (max two days per week)
A diverse and engaging role in a flexible, forward-thinking work environment
A supportive, appreciative, and dynamic team culture ‚Äì shaped by dedicated individuals who stand out through their expertise, service mindset, and personality
Interested? We look forward to receiving your application.
Please note: This position is being filled without the involvement of external recruitment agencies.

The Diabetes Center Berne (DCB) is a private, independent Swiss foundation dedicated to making life with diabetes easier. DCB supports innovative ideas and projects in the field of diabetes technology worldwide by offering expertise, access to clinical research facilities, and its own state-of-the-art laboratories. As a non-profit organization, DCB is driven by a commitment to generate new insights and innovations in diabetes management and to foster a vibrant community.


To support our mission, we are currently looking for a Data Scientist.


Tasks

  • Develop, implement and apply semi-physiological models for glucose-insulin metabolism

  • Analyse complex datasets (high resolution medical device data) using advanced statistical and mathematical models

  • Strengthen DCB‚Äôs data science capabilities and contribute to its visibility

  • Support start-ups and partners in tasks related to data science, such as algorithm development or validation

  • Identify elements and software components to build up the DCB data infrastructure

  • Provide programming for statistical analysis where required
column2:
review and generate study metrics and status reports within and across several studies
  • Manage, store and process data in accordance with data transfer agreements and client-specific requirements

  • Write, review, and approve study data analysis documents in compliance with DCB or client SOPsCollaborate closely with clinical project managers and other data team members


    • Requirements

    • Higher education (MSc/PhD in mathematics, statistics, physics, bioinformatics or related field)

    • Proven experience in analysing health data, ideally in diabetes and/or women‚Äôs health

    • Strong foundation in mathematics/statistics (required)

    • Solid experience in Python, R or scientific computation

    • Familiarity with clinical trials, from first-in-human through post marketing

    • Professional fluency in English, both written and spoken Strong interpersonal skills, with a proactive and collaborative mindset


    Benefits

    • A modern workplace located in Bern, with the option to work from home (max two days per week)

    • A diverse and engaging role in a flexible, forward-thinking work environment

    • A supportive, appreciative, and dynamic team culture ‚Äì shaped by dedicated individuals who stand out through their expertise, service mindset, and personality


    Interested? We look forward to receiving your application.


    Please note: This position is being filled without the involvement of external recruitment agencies.

4162279909,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/research-scientist-machine-learning-lausanne-at-isomorphic-labs-4162279909?position=12&pageNum=0&refId=7seE469UY6C2FEjLJbbQvg%3D%3D&trackingId=zjHyT%2FNmWNsYsisbpt5MEw%3D%3D,"Research Scientist, Machine Learning, Lausanne",Isomorphic Labs,"Lausanne, Vaud, Switzerland","Isomorphic Labs is a new Alphabet company that is reimagining drug discovery through a computational- and AI-first approach.

We are on a mission to accelerate the speed, increase the efficacy and lower the cost of drug discovery. You'll be working at the cutting edge of the new era of 'digital biology' to deliver a transformative social impact for the benefit of millions of people.

Come and be part of an interdisciplinary team driving groundbreaking innovation and play a meaningful role in contributing towards us achieving our ambitious goals, while being a part of an inspiring, collaborative and entrepreneurial culture.

As a Research Scientist in machine learning (ML), you will play an exciting role in building greenfield machine learning based models and algorithms that will power our platform to transform the drug discovery world as we know it.

Working in a highly creative, fast-paced and interdisciplinary environment, you will be partnering with leading engineers and scientists to conceive, design, and develop cutting edge machine learning algorithms to unlock new modelling and predictive power which will be critical to the organisation‚Äôs success. You will draw upon your existing deep research experience whilst learning from those around you, to apply novel techniques and ideas to newly encountered computational biology and chemistry problems.

You will create and lead projects, bringing together a variety of disciplined scientists and engineers to pursue some of the most ambitious modelling problems with deep learning - as well as providing technical mentorship and people management for others in the ML community at Isomorphic Labs

You will be instrumental in leading greenfield machine learning based research projects, building the models, and algorithms that will power our platform to transform the drug discovery world as we know it.
Contribute to our research directions in machine learning by using your extensive knowledge of the field to apply world-leading ML algorithms to drug discovery.
Identify and create novel ML techniques and the required data to train.
Develop the architectures and training algorithms of machine learning models.
Analyse and tune experimental results to inform future experimental directions.
Implement and scale training and inference engineering frameworks.
Report and present research findings and developments clearly and efficiently, to both other ML scientists and scientists of different disciplines.
Iterate collaboratively with scientists and domain experts, sharing your own domain experience.
Suggest and engage in team collaborations to meet ambitious research goals.
Provide technical mentorship and guidance to the ML research community, advising on projects, and shaping our research roadmap based on your deep technical expertise.
Provide developmental support to other ML research scientists.
Create, lead, and run ML research projects, fostering collaborative and diverse teams to solve high priority modelling problems.Cultivate a diverse and inclusive research culture.
PhD or equivalent practical experience in a technical field.
A proven track record in machine learning using deep learning techniques, including designing new architectures, hands-on experimentation, analysis, and visualisation.
Strong knowledge of linear algebra, calculus and statistics.
Experience using ML frameworks such as JAX, PyTorch, or TensorFlow, and scientific software such as NumPy, SciPy, or Pandas.
A passion for applying ML research to real world problems.
Depending on your experience: project supervision, leadership, or management.
PhD in machine learning or computer science.
Relevant research experience to the position such as post doctoral roles, a proven track record of publications, or contributions to machine learning codebases.
Experience working in a scientific environment across disciplines (particularly biology, chemistry, physics).
Experience working with biological or chemical data and biological or chemistry software.

Experience in any of: large scale deep learning, generative models, graph neural networks, deep learning for drug discovery, deep learning for computer vision, 3D graphics/robotics, real-world applied RL.
We are guided by our shared values. It's not about finding people who think and act in the same way. These values help to guide our work and will continue to strengthen it.
Thoughtful at Iso is about curiosity, creativity and care. It is about good people doing good, rigorous and future-making science every single day.
Brave at Iso is about fearlessness, but it‚Äôs also about initiative and integrity. The scale of the challenge demands nothing less.
Determined at Iso is the way we pursue our goal. It‚Äôs a confidence in our hypothesis, as well as the urgency and agility needed to deliver on it. Because disease won‚Äôt wait, so neither should we.

Together at Iso is about connection, collaboration across fields and catalytic relationships. It‚Äôs knowing that transformation is a group project, and remembering that what we‚Äôre doing will have a real impact on real people everywhere.

We believe that to be successful we need a team with a range of skills and talents. We're building an environment where collaboration is fundamental, learning is shared and every employee feels supported and able to thrive. We value unique experiences, knowledge, backgrounds, and perspectives, and harness these qualities to create extraordinary impact.

We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of sex, race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy or related condition (including breastfeeding) or any other basis protected by applicable law. If you have a disability or additional need that requires accommodation, please do not hesitate to let us know.

It‚Äôs hugely important for us to share knowledge and build strong relationships with each other, and we find it easier to do this if we spend time together in person. This is why we follow a hybrid model, and would require you to be able to come into the office 3 days a week (currently Tuesday, Wednesday, and one other day depending on which team you‚Äôre in). If you have additional needs that would prevent you from following this hybrid approach, we‚Äôd be happy to talk through these if you‚Äôre selected for an initial screening call.
Please note that when you submit an application, your data will be processed in line with our privacy policy.
>> Click to view other open roles at Isomorphic Labs

Isomorphic Labs is a new Alphabet company that is reimagining drug discovery through a computational- and AI-first approach.

We are on a mission to accelerate the speed, increase the efficacy and lower the cost of drug discovery. You'll be working at the cutting edge of the new era of 'digital biology' to deliver a transformative social impact for the benefit of millions of people.

Come and be part of an interdisciplinary team driving groundbreaking innovation and play a meaningful role in contributing towards us achieving our ambitious goals, while being a part of an inspiring, collaborative and entrepreneurial culture.

Your impact

As a Research Scientist in machine learning (ML), you will play an exciting role in building greenfield machine learning based models and algorithms that will power our platform to transform the drug discovery world as we know it.

Working in a highly creative, fast-paced and interdisciplinary environment, you will be partnering with leading engineers and scientists to conceive, design, and develop cutting edge machine learning algorithms to unlock new modelling and predictive power which will be critical to the organisation‚Äôs success. You will draw upon your existing deep research experience whilst learning from those around you, to apply novel techniques and ideas to newly encountered computational biology and chemistry problems.

Depending on your experience:

You will create and lead projects, bringing together a variety of disciplined scientists and engineers to pursue some of the most ambitious modelling problems with deep learning - as well as providing technical mentorship and people management for others in the ML community at Isomorphic Labs

You will be instrumental in leading greenfield machine learning based research projects, building the models, and algorithms that will power our platform to transform the drug discovery world as we know it.

What You Will Do

  • Contribute to our research directions in machine learning by using your extensive knowledge of the field to apply world-leading ML algorithms to drug discovery.
  • Identify and create novel ML techniques and the required data to train.
  • Develop the architectures and training algorithms of machine learning models.
  • Analyse and tune experimental results to inform future experimental directions.
  • Implement and scale training and inference engineering frameworks.
  • Report and present research findings and developments clearly and efficiently, to both other ML scientists and scientists of different disciplines.
  • Iterate collaboratively with scientists and domain experts, sharing your own domain experience.
  • Suggest and engage in team collaborations to meet ambitious research goals.
  • Depending on your experience:
  • Provide technical mentorship and guidance to the ML research community, advising on projects, and shaping our research roadmap based on your deep technical expertise.
  • Provide developmental support to other ML research scientists.
  • Create, lead, and run ML research projects, fostering collaborative and diverse teams to solve high priority modelling problems.Cultivate a diverse and inclusive research culture.

Essential

Skills and qualifications

  • PhD or equivalent practical experience in a technical field.
  • A proven track record in machine learning using deep learning techniques, including designing new architectures, hands-on experimentation, analysis, and visualisation.
  • Strong knowledge of linear algebra, calculus and statistics.
  • Experience using ML frameworks such as JAX, PyTorch, or TensorFlow, and scientific software such as NumPy, SciPy, or Pandas.
  • A passion for applying ML research to real world problems.
  • Depending on your experience: project supervision, leadership, or management.

Nice to have

  • PhD in machine learning or computer science.
  • Relevant research experience to the position such as post doctoral roles, a proven track record of publications, or contributions to machine learning codebases.
  • Experience working in a scientific environment across disciplines (particularly biology, chemistry, physics).
  • Experience working with biological or chemical data and biological or chemistry software.
  • Experience working with real-world datasets.
  • Experience with ML on accelerators.
  • Experience in any of: large scale deep learning, generative models, graph neural networks, deep learning for drug discovery, deep learning for computer vision, 3D graphics/robotics, real-world applied RL.

Culture and values

We are guided by our shared values. It's not about finding people who think and act in the same way. These values help to guide our work and will continue to strengthen it.

Thoughtful

Thoughtful at Iso is about curiosity, creativity and care. It is about good people doing good, rigorous and future-making science every single day.

Brave

Brave at Iso is about fearlessness, but it‚Äôs also about initiative and integrity. The scale of the challenge demands nothing less.

Determined

Determined at Iso is the way we pursue our goal. It‚Äôs a confidence in our hypothesis, as well as the urgency and agility needed to deliver on it. Because disease won‚Äôt wait, so neither should we.

Together

Together at Iso is about connection, collaboration across fields and catalytic relationships. It‚Äôs knowing that transformation is a group project, and remembering that what we‚Äôre doing will have a real impact on real people everywhere.

Creating An Extraordinary Company

We believe that to be successful we need a team with a range of skills and talents. We're building an environment where collaboration is fundamental, learning is shared and every employee feels supported and able to thrive. We value unique experiences, knowledge, backgrounds, and perspectives, and harness these qualities to create extraordinary impact.

We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of sex, race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy or related condition (including breastfeeding) or any other basis protected by applicable law. If you have a disability or additional need that requires accommodation, please do not hesitate to let us know.

Hybrid working

It‚Äôs hugely important for us to share knowledge and build strong relationships with each other, and we find it easier to do this if we spend time together in person. This is why we follow a hybrid model, and would require you to be able to come into the office 3 days a week (currently Tuesday, Wednesday, and one other day depending on which team you‚Äôre in). If you have additional needs that would prevent you from following this hybrid approach, we‚Äôd be happy to talk through these if you‚Äôre selected for an initial screening call.

Please note that when you submit an application, your data will be processed in line with our privacy policy.

4190952412,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/ml-engineer-agentic-ai-at-kaiko-ai-4190952412?position=14&pageNum=0&refId=7seE469UY6C2FEjLJbbQvg%3D%3D&trackingId=b5zdzAN5IjtRJV8un0bOow%3D%3D,ML Engineer - Agentic AI,kaiko.ai,Z√ºrich Metropolitan Area,"About kaiko

In cancer care, treatment decisions can take many days‚Äîbut patients don‚Äôt have that time. One of the reasons for delays? Cancer patients' data is scattered across many places: doctor‚Äôs notes, medical imagery, genomics data. At kaiko, we are developing AI foundational models to bring this data together and integrate it into clinical workflows, enabling doctors to make faster, more effective treatments decisions.

We also collaborate closely with the leading Dutch cancer research institute (NKI) on multiple AI research projects and a joint clinical validation initiative. In 2025, we plan on expanding our partnerships to even more hospitals.
We raised significant long-term funding and have offices in Zurich and Amsterdam. Over the past year, our team has nearly doubled in size, now comprising 70+ people from 25 countries.

As oncology inherently involves numerous data types such as imaging, pathology, genomics, clinical data, and patient histories, we are looking for visionary engineers to help us create an agentic AI system that can seamlessly integrate these modalities to support oncologists and ultimately improve patient outcomes. You will be joining the agentic AI team, where you will help develop a system capable of processing and reasoning across these different data modalities. You will be based in Zurich, Switzerland, with the expectation of spending at least 50% of your time at the office.
Develop and implement an agentic AI system that can process and reason on multimodal oncology data including medical imaging, pathology slides, genomic profiles, and clinical information.
Create novel agent workflows that mimic the collaborative, multidisciplinary approach of tumor boards and oncology care teams.
Build and implement systems that can understand the relationships between different data types and extract clinically relevant insights.
Develop evaluation frameworks to rigorously test agent performance across diverse oncology scenarios.
Research and implement state-of-the-art techniques that leverage Large Language Models (LLMs) and Vision Language Models (VLMs) in agentic settings.
Strong programing skills in Python and PyTorch
Strong foundation in deep learning, particularly in transformer architectures
Experience training and fine-tuning foundation models
Experience in prompting and/or developing products with LLMs
Familiarity with the architecture and operation of LLMs and VLMs
Experience with Agentic AI or knowledge of recent literature
At kaiko, we believe the best ideas come from collaboration, ownership and ambition. We‚Äôve built a team of international experts where your work has direct impact. Here‚Äôs what we value:
Ownership: You‚Äôll have the autonomy to set your own goals, make critical decisions, and see the direct impact of your work.
Collaboration: You‚Äôll have to approach disagreement with curiosity, build on common ground and create solutions together.

Ambition: You‚Äôll be surrounded by people who set high standards for themselves and others, who see obstacles as opportunities, and who are relentless in their work to create better outcomes for patients.
An attractive and competitive salary, a good pension plan and 25 vacation days per year.
Great offsites and team events to strengthen the team and celebrate successes together.
A EUR 1000 learning and development budget to help you grow.
Autonomy to do your work the way that works best for you, whether you have a kid or prefer early mornings.

We are excited to gather a broad range of perspectives in our team, as we believe it will help us build better products to support a broader set of people. If you‚Äôre excited about us but don‚Äôt fit every single qualification, we still encourage you to apply: we‚Äôve had incredible team members join us who didn‚Äôt check every box!

About kaiko

In cancer care, treatment decisions can take many days‚Äîbut patients don‚Äôt have that time. One of the reasons for delays? Cancer patients' data is scattered across many places: doctor‚Äôs notes, medical imagery, genomics data. At kaiko, we are developing AI foundational models to bring this data together and integrate it into clinical workflows, enabling doctors to make faster, more effective treatments decisions.

We also collaborate closely with the leading Dutch cancer research institute (NKI) on multiple AI research projects and a joint clinical validation initiative. In 2025, we plan on expanding our partnerships to even more hospitals.

We raised significant long-term funding and have offices in Zurich and Amsterdam. Over the past year, our team has nearly doubled in size, now comprising 70+ people from 25 countries.


About the role

As oncology inherently involves numerous data types such as imaging, pathology, genomics, clinical data, and patient histories, we are looking for visionary engineers to help us create an agentic AI system that can seamlessly integrate these modalities to support oncologists and ultimately improve patient outcomes. You will be joining the agentic AI team, where you will help develop a system capable of processing and reasoning across these different data modalities. You will be based in Zurich, Switzerland, with the expectation of spending at least 50% of your time at the office.

Some areas of responsibility

  • Develop and implement an agentic AI system that can process and reason on multimodal oncology data including medical imaging, pathology slides, genomic profiles, and clinical information.
  • Create novel agent workflows that mimic the collaborative, multidisciplinary approach of tumor boards and oncology care teams.
  • Build and implement systems that can understand the relationships between different data types and extract clinically relevant insights.
  • Develop evaluation frameworks to rigorously test agent performance across diverse oncology scenarios.
  • Research and implement state-of-the-art techniques that leverage Large Language Models (LLMs) and Vision Language Models (VLMs) in agentic settings.


About you

  • Strong programing skills in Python and PyTorch
  • Strong foundation in deep learning, particularly in transformer architectures
  • Experience training and fine-tuning foundation models
  • Experience in prompting and/or developing products with LLMs
  • Familiarity with the architecture and operation of LLMs and VLMs

Nice to have:

  • Experience with Agentic AI or knowledge of recent literature
  • Experience with Reinforcement learning



Why kaiko

At kaiko, we believe the best ideas come from collaboration, ownership and ambition. We‚Äôve built a team of international experts where your work has direct impact. Here‚Äôs what we value:

  • Ownership: You‚Äôll have the autonomy to set your own goals, make critical decisions, and see the direct impact of your work.
  • Collaboration: You‚Äôll have to approach disagreement with curiosity, build on common ground and create solutions together.
  • Ambition: You‚Äôll be surrounded by people who set high standards for themselves and others, who see obstacles as opportunities, and who are relentless in their work to create better outcomes for patients.


In addition, we offer:

  • An attractive and competitive salary, a good pension plan and 25 vacation days per year.
  • Great offsites and team events to strengthen the team and celebrate successes together.
  • A EUR 1000 learning and development budget to help you grow.
  • Autonomy to do your work the way that works best for you, whether you have a kid or prefer early mornings.
  • An annual commuting subsidy.


We are excited to gather a broad range of perspectives in our team, as we believe it will help us build better products to support a broader set of people. If you‚Äôre excited about us but don‚Äôt fit every single qualification, we still encourage you to apply: we‚Äôve had incredible team members join us who didn‚Äôt check every box!

4202444043,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/machine-learning-engineer-oss-in-a-fast-growing-ai-startup-at-lightly-4202444043?position=18&pageNum=0&refId=7seE469UY6C2FEjLJbbQvg%3D%3D&trackingId=TW%2F5pbFm6qgiS6TRYnhSDA%3D%3D,Machine Learning Engineer (OSS) in a fast-growing AI Startup,Lightly,Switzerland,"At the ETH spin-off Lightly, we build software solutions to help companies improve their deep learning models. The available data for deep learning grows faster than human tagging and available compute power. Our customers already face this problem and have too much data to process. As a solution, we built software to identify and work with the most relevant samples only. Learn more about us on our website.
We are a team of talented developers and researchers in Zurich, Prague and San Francisco and are backed by YCombinator. Every member of the team is going to have a massive impact.

Thus, we are looking for an experienced engineer with lots of passion for the subject. We offer attractive cash- & equity package for you to become part-owner of Lightly. Remote work is also possible.
We use a modern stack of:
PyTorch, Python, Typescript, C++, Rust, React, NodeJS
Docker, Kubernetes, Google Cloud Platform, AWS
As a Machine Learning Engineer in the core ML team, you will be part of a team which works mainly on our open-source package for self-supervised learning and similar internal frameworks.
Work on our open-source Python package for self-supervised learning: https://github.com/lightly-ai/lightly.
Add support for finetuning pretrained models for downstream tasks including many different computer vision tasks like object detection, segmentation, tracking, and more.
Keep up with current research in self-supervised learning and multi-modal models.
All these tasks will include working with state-of-the-art technology such as self-supervised learning, model distillation, vision language models and deep learning for computer vision in general.
Participate in and hold paper sessions about the latest papers in the field.
Represent the company at machine learning conferences and engage with the community.
In general, for this role expect to use the stack we use for our open-source package https://github.com/lightly-ai/lightly.
MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
Experience in deep learning and computer vision, ideally in self-supervised learning and you have worked with PyTorch.
Excellent Python coding skills and knowledge of software engineering best practices. Experience with testing and typed Python is a big plus.
Experience with building and shipping software solutions.
Strong passion for new technologies and interest in keeping up with the latest technologies and publications in deep learning.
We offer attractive cash- & equity package for you to become part-owner of Lightly. Remote work is also possible.
We look forward to getting to know you!

At the ETH spin-off Lightly, we build software solutions to help companies improve their deep learning models. The available data for deep learning grows faster than human tagging and available compute power. Our customers already face this problem and have too much data to process. As a solution, we built software to identify and work with the most relevant samples only. Learn more about us on our website.


We are a team of talented developers and researchers in Zurich, Prague and San Francisco and are backed by YCombinator. Every member of the team is going to have a massive impact.


Thus, we are looking for an experienced engineer with lots of passion for the subject. We offer attractive cash- &
column2:
equity package for you to become part-owner of Lightly. Remote work is also possible.


We use a modern stack of:



  • PyTorch, Python, Typescript, C++, Rust, React, NodeJS

  • Docker, Kubernetes, Google Cloud Platform, AWS


Tasks

As a Machine Learning Engineer in the core ML team, you will be part of a team which works mainly on our open-source package for self-supervised learning and similar internal frameworks.


Particularly, you will get to:



  • Work on our open-source Python package for self-supervised learning: https://github.com/lightly-ai/lightly.

  • Add support for finetuning pretrained models for downstream tasks including many different computer vision tasks like object detection, segmentation, tracking, and more.

  • Keep up with current research in self-supervised learning and multi-modal models.

  • All these tasks will include working with state-of-the-art technology such as self-supervised learning, model distillation, vision language models and deep learning for computer vision in general.

  • Participate in and hold paper sessions about the latest papers in the field.

  • Represent the company at machine learning conferences and engage with the community.


In general, for this role expect to use the stack we use for our open-source package https://github.com/lightly-ai/lightly.


Requirements

Ideally, you have:



  • MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field

  • Experience in deep learning and computer vision, ideally in self-supervised learning and you have worked with PyTorch.

  • Excellent Python coding skills and knowledge of software engineering best practices. Experience with testing and typed Python is a big plus.

  • Experience with building and shipping software solutions.

  • Strong passion for new technologies and interest in keeping up with the latest technologies and publications in deep learning.


Benefits

We offer attractive cash- &
column3:
equity package for you to become part-owner of Lightly. Remote work is also possible.


Interested? Contact us!


We look forward to getting to know you!

4192207557,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/scientific-machine-learning-engineering-intern-at-corintis-4192207557?position=19&pageNum=0&refId=7seE469UY6C2FEjLJbbQvg%3D%3D&trackingId=jB1pSVFbEgB8SAY61gfpxA%3D%3D,Scientific Machine Learning Engineering Intern,Corintis,"Lausanne, Vaud, Switzerland","About Corintis

Corintis offers innovative microfluidic cooling technologies for data centers. Our solutions improve compute sustainability and tackle the excessive electricity consumption associated with data center cooling, which consumes more electricity than New York and London combined. By integrating cooling directly inside the chip, we pave the way for the next generation of AI workloads, supporting applications like generative AI systems, climate modeling, and drug discovery to enable the future of sustainable computing.

Corintis offers a friendly and team-oriented workplace bringing together a diverse group of nationalities to solve the biggest computing challenges of tomorrow. Based on the EPFL campus near Lausanne, we are closely connected to the local ecosystem and are located a few minutes walk from Lake Geneva.

As a Scientific Machine Learning Engineering Intern at Corintis, you'll play a crucial role by leveraging your skills in Scientific Machine Learning (ML) and Computational Science & Engineering to accelerate the optimization of our groundbreaking microfluidic cooling technology. This role offers an exciting opportunity to directly contribute to the evolution of sustainable computing solutions, including, but not limited to, future AI workloads. In essence, you'll be employing ML to accelerate the design of a cooling system for the very same machine - or its future iteration - enhancing its performance and efficiency.
Apply ML methods such as Neural Operators for Partial Differential Equations (PDEs) to predict the performance of microfluidics for microchip cooling.

Enhance current ML models and algorithms for improved prediction accuracy and computational efficiency. We would be interested in investigating Group Equivariant Neural Networks for rotation invariance or implementing various data enhancement techniques such as Neural Field Representations, and others.
Collaborate with a cross-functional team of engineers and scientists to integrate ML solutions into our Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) framework and our design and optimization process.
Continuously monitor and incorporate the latest research and developments in the fields of ML, CFD and topology optimization into our methodologies.
Analyze complex datasets, interpret patterns and trends, and contribute to the evolution of our topology optimization strategies.
Contribute to the formulation of objective functions based on specific design criteria and constraints.
Develop creative and innovative solutions that address the complex challenges of integrating ML, fluid dynamics and microfluidics.
Background in computational engineering, computational science, mathematics, physics, or mechanical engineering.
Extensive knowledge of Machine/Deep Learning techniques and architectures.
Proficient in Python and an ML open source library, preferably PyTorch.
Experience in working with open source tools and Git (GitHub).
Interest in CFD and experience with simulation methods.
Ability to think outside of the box and freely discuss creative solutions.
Demonstrated ability to write clear, high-quality technical documentation.
Autonomous and proactive working style with excellent organization and work ethics.
Effective communication skills and the ability to work in a team with diverse professions and cultural backgrounds.
Please attach a letter of motivation with your CV
Experience with training large datasets using GPUs, preferably multi-thread training on High Performance Computing (HPC) Systems.
Familiarity with using Partial Differential Equations (PDEs) for modeling physical phenomena.
Familiarity with the Finite Element Method (FEM) for the numerical solution of PDEs.
Experience in reduced-order modeling for the numerical solution of PDEs and/or scientific ML.
Experience in applying the aforementioned techniques for fluid dynamics problems (Navier-Stokes and/or Darcy flow).
A dynamic, flexible, innovative, and multicultural work environment
Contract: Paid Internship (6-months preferred, flexible) 2,500 CHF gross per month
Location: On-site, Corintis SA (Building C), EPFL Innovation Park, Switzerland

About Corintis


Corintis offers innovative microfluidic cooling technologies for data centers. Our solutions improve compute sustainability and tackle the excessive electricity consumption associated with data center cooling, which consumes more electricity than New York and London combined. By integrating cooling directly inside the chip, we pave the way for the next generation of AI workloads, supporting applications like generative AI systems, climate modeling, and drug discovery to enable the future of sustainable computing.


Working at Corintis


Corintis offers a friendly and team-oriented workplace bringing together a diverse group of nationalities to solve the biggest computing challenges of tomorrow. Based on the EPFL campus near Lausanne, we are closely connected to the local ecosystem and are located a few minutes walk from Lake Geneva.


Job Description


As a Scientific Machine Learning Engineering Intern at Corintis, you'll play a crucial role by leveraging your skills in Scientific Machine Learning (ML) and Computational Science &
column2:
Engineering to accelerate the optimization of our groundbreaking microfluidic cooling technology. This role offers an exciting opportunity to directly contribute to the evolution of sustainable computing solutions, including, but not limited to, future AI workloads. In essence, you'll be employing ML to accelerate the design of a cooling system for the very same machine - or its future iteration - enhancing its performance and efficiency.


Responsibilities


  • Apply ML methods such as Neural Operators for Partial Differential Equations (PDEs) to predict the performance of microfluidics for microchip cooling.
  • Enhance current ML models and algorithms for improved prediction accuracy and computational efficiency. We would be interested in investigating Group Equivariant Neural Networks for rotation invariance or implementing various data enhancement techniques such as Neural Field Representations, and others.
  • Collaborate with a cross-functional team of engineers and scientists to integrate ML solutions into our Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) framework and our design and optimization process.
  • Continuously monitor and incorporate the latest research and developments in the fields of ML, CFD and topology optimization into our methodologies.
  • Analyze complex datasets, interpret patterns and trends, and contribute to the evolution of our topology optimization strategies.
  • Contribute to the formulation of objective functions based on specific design criteria and constraints.
  • Develop creative and innovative solutions that address the complex challenges of integrating ML, fluid dynamics and microfluidics.


Requirements


  • Background in computational engineering, computational science, mathematics, physics, or mechanical engineering.
  • Extensive knowledge of Machine/Deep Learning techniques and architectures.
  • Proficient in Python and an ML open source library, preferably PyTorch.
  • Experience in working with open source tools and Git (GitHub).
  • Interest in CFD and experience with simulation methods.
  • Ability to think outside of the box and freely discuss creative solutions.
  • Demonstrated ability to write clear, high-quality technical documentation.
  • Autonomous and proactive working style with excellent organization and work ethics.
  • Effective communication skills and the ability to work in a team with diverse professions and cultural backgrounds.
  • Fluent in English.
  • Please attach a letter of motivation with your CV


Strongly desirable


  • Experience with training large datasets using GPUs, preferably multi-thread training on High Performance Computing (HPC) Systems.
  • Familiarity with using Partial Differential Equations (PDEs) for modeling physical phenomena.
  • Familiarity with the Finite Element Method (FEM) for the numerical solution of PDEs.
  • Experience in reduced-order modeling for the numerical solution of PDEs and/or scientific ML.
  • Experience in applying the aforementioned techniques for fluid dynamics problems (Navier-Stokes and/or Darcy flow).


What we offer


A dynamic, flexible, innovative, and multicultural work environment

Start date: Immediately

Contract: Paid Internship (6-months preferred, flexible) 2,500 CHF gross per month

Activity rate: 100%

Location: On-site, Corintis SA (Building C), EPFL Innovation Park, Switzerland

4189641412,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/machine-learning-engineer-gemini-safety-at-google-deepmind-4189641412?position=20&pageNum=0&refId=7seE469UY6C2FEjLJbbQvg%3D%3D&trackingId=Q4pa3YUswq0MxM7s%2BtFrQg%3D%3D,"Machine Learning Engineer, Gemini Safety",Google DeepMind,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","Snapshot

You are an experienced Machine Learning Engineer with a strong engineering and research background who is excited about improving safety and alignment of the ""Gemini"" end-user product, delivering state-of-the art language models to our users.

Artificial Intelligence could be one of humanity‚Äôs most useful inventions. At Google DeepMind, we‚Äôre a team of scientists, engineers, machine learning experts and more, working together to advance the state of the art in artificial intelligence. We use our technologies for widespread public benefit and scientific discovery, and collaborate with others on critical challenges, ensuring safety and ethics are the highest priority.

Our team works on developing safe, aligned, and helpful Gemini models across all modalities (text, images, audio) as well as novel ways of evaluating them through superhuman autoraters or automated red teaming.

To that end, we are advancing the state-of-the-art on the entire post-training pipeline. This includes innovations in RLHF/RL*F tailored to safety and alignment, novel and scalable ways of evaluating models to find weaknesses, as well as improvements in model understanding to guide future research.
We are looking for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer excited to push the state of the art in these areas.
Apply and innovate on state-of-the-art modeling techniques with the goal of reducing safety violations while increasing human alignment using post-training approaches (e.g. SFT, RLHF/RL*F).
Collaborate with peers and cross-functional research teams on applying state-of-the-art machine learning approaches to LLM-based products.
Propose and quickly prototype novel ideas and implement advances in Gemini's production systems.
Have bias for action: our team operates in a high-reward and fast-paced environment.
In summary: we are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer with strong intuition and the ability to drive ambiguous projects end-to-end to push the boundaries of Safety and Alignment on LLMs.
In order to set you up for success as a machine learning-focused software engineer at Google DeepMind, we look for the following skills and experience:
MSc degree in computer science or machine learning or similar experience working in industry.
3+ years of experience with ML modeling and generative AI, working with data, model evaluations, and quality iterations.
Proven knowledge and experience of Python, one or several machine learning frameworks (Jax, TensorFlow, or PyTorch), as well as algorithms and data structures.
Ability to grow in high-stakes, high-visibility environments.
In addition, the following would be an advantage:
PhD in Machine Learning or a related field.
Experience with training and optimizing large language models.

At Google DeepMind, we value diversity of experience, knowledge, backgrounds and perspectives and harness these qualities to create extraordinary impact. We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of sex, race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, or related condition (including breastfeeding) or any other basis as protected by applicable law. If you have a disability or additional need that requires accommodation, please do not hesitate to let us know.

Note: In the event your application is successful and an offer of employment is made to you, any offer of employment will be conditional on the results of a background check, performed by a third party acting on our behalf. For more information on how we handle your data, please see our Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy.

Snapshot

You are an experienced Machine Learning Engineer with a strong engineering and research background who is excited about improving safety and alignment of the ""Gemini"" end-user product, delivering state-of-the art language models to our users.

About Us

Artificial Intelligence could be one of humanity‚Äôs most useful inventions. At Google DeepMind, we‚Äôre a team of scientists, engineers, machine learning experts and more, working together to advance the state of the art in artificial intelligence. We use our technologies for widespread public benefit and scientific discovery, and collaborate with others on critical challenges, ensuring safety and ethics are the highest priority.

The role

Our team works on developing safe, aligned, and helpful Gemini models across all modalities (text, images, audio) as well as novel ways of evaluating them through superhuman autoraters or automated red teaming.

To that end, we are advancing the state-of-the-art on the entire post-training pipeline. This includes innovations in RLHF/RL*F tailored to safety and alignment, novel and scalable ways of evaluating models to find weaknesses, as well as improvements in model understanding to guide future research.

We are looking for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer excited to push the state of the art in these areas.

Key responsibilities

  • Apply and innovate on state-of-the-art modeling techniques with the goal of reducing safety violations while increasing human alignment using post-training approaches (e.g. SFT, RLHF/RL*F).
  • Collaborate with peers and cross-functional research teams on applying state-of-the-art machine learning approaches to LLM-based products.
  • Propose and quickly prototype novel ideas and implement advances in Gemini's production systems.
  • Have bias for action: our team operates in a high-reward and fast-paced environment.
  • In summary: we are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer with strong intuition and the ability to drive ambiguous projects end-to-end to push the boundaries of Safety and Alignment on LLMs.

About You

In order to set you up for success as a machine learning-focused software engineer at Google DeepMind, we look for the following skills and experience:

  • MSc degree in computer science or machine learning or similar experience working in industry.
  • 3+ years of experience with ML modeling and generative AI, working with data, model evaluations, and quality iterations.
  • Proven knowledge and experience of Python, one or several machine learning frameworks (Jax, TensorFlow, or PyTorch), as well as algorithms and data structures.
  • Ability to grow in high-stakes, high-visibility environments.

In addition, the following would be an advantage:

  • PhD in Machine Learning or a related field.
  • Experience with training and optimizing large language models.

At Google DeepMind, we value diversity of experience, knowledge, backgrounds and perspectives and harness these qualities to create extraordinary impact. We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of sex, race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, or related condition (including breastfeeding) or any other basis as protected by applicable law. If you have a disability or additional need that requires accommodation, please do not hesitate to let us know.

Application deadline: 12pm GMT Friday April 16th 2025

Note: In the event your application is successful and an offer of employment is made to you, any offer of employment will be conditional on the results of a background check, performed by a third party acting on our behalf. For more information on how we handle your data, please see our Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy.

  • Du hast nicht nur das technische Know-how, sondern kannst auch die Ergebnisse deiner Analysen verst√§ndlich f√ºr das Business kommunizieren.

  • Idealerweise hast du bereits erste Erfahrungen in der Versicherungs- oder Finanzbranche gesammelt ‚Äì falls nicht, bist du motiviert, dich in diese Dom√§ne einzuarbeiten.

  • Dein Wohnort befindet sich in der Schweiz.


Deine Aufgaben



  • Du entwickelst KI- und Machine-Learning-Modelle, um unsere Produkte und Prozesse zu optimieren (z. B. Schadensprognosen, Risikobewertung, optimale Kundenansprache, Produktempfehlung, Betrugserkennung, Pricing-Modelle).

  • Du baust Predictive Analytics Pipelines und nutzt moderne Modellierungsmethoden, um datengetriebene Entscheidungen im gesamten Unternehmen zu f√∂rdern.

  • Du trainierst und evaluierst Deep-Learning- und Machine-Learning-Modelle, optimierst deren Performance und bringst sie in Produktion.

  • Du arbeitest eng mit unserem CTO und den Business-Teams zusammen, um Anforderungen zu verstehen und datengetriebene L√∂sungen zu entwickeln.

  • Du bereitest grosse Mengen an strukturierten und unstrukturierten Daten auf, f√ºhrst Explorative Datenanalysen (EDA) durch und entwickelst automatisierte Feature-Engineering-Prozesse.

  • Du implementierst ML-Ops-Prozesse, um Modelle in einer produktiven Umgebung effizient zu verwalten, zu √ºberwachen und zu verbessern.

  • Du k√ºmmerst dich um die Optimierung von Datenqualit√§t und Data Governance, um sicherzustellen, dass unsere Modelle auf soliden Grundlagen basieren.

  • Du arbeitest mit externen Data-Science- und KI-Anbietern zusammen, um Best Practices zu integrieren und unsere KI-Strategie weiterzuentwickeln.

  • Du bringst dein Wissen √ºber neue Entwicklungen in Machine Learning und KI ins Team ein und treibst Innovationen voran.


Qualifikation

Das bringst du mit



  • Erfahrung in der Entwicklung von Machine-Learning- und KI-Modellen, insbesondere in den Bereichen Supervised Learning, Unsupervised Learning, NLP oder Deep Learning.

  • Einen Hochschulabschluss im Bereich Informatik, Mathematik, Statistik, einer Naturwissenschaft, √ñkonomieo.√Ñ.

  • Sehr gute Kenntnisse in Python (z. B. Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch) oder R.

  • Erfahrung mit Predictive Analytics, statistischer Modellierung und Data Engineering.

  • Kenntnisse in Datenbanken (SQL, NoSQL) und verteilten Datenverarbeitungssystemen.

  • Idealerweise Erfahrung mit Big Data Technologien (Spark, Dask, Hadoop) oder Cloud-ML-Plattformen (AWS Sagemaker, Google Vertex AI, Azure ML).

  • Erfahrung mit ML-Ops und Deployment von Machine-Learning-Modellen.

  • Gute Kenntnisse in Datenvisualisierungstools (z. B. Tableau, Power BI, Matplotlib, Seaborn).

  • Idealerweise erste Erfahrung in der Versicherungsbranche oder mit Finanzdaten, aber nicht zwingend notwendig.

  • Sehr gute Kommunikationsf√§higkeiten in Deutsch und Englisch.


Benefits

Das bieten wir



  • Eine zentrale Rolle in einem wachsenden-Startup mit viel Gestaltungsspielraum und Selbstst√§ndigkeit.

  • Arbeiten an spannenden, realen Machine-Learning-Projekten, die einen direkten Einfluss auf das Business haben.

  • Zugang zu vielseitigen Datens√§tzen, die f√ºr Analytics und KI genutzt werden k√∂nnen.

  • Die M√∂glichkeit, neue Technologien und Methoden selbstst√§ndig auszuprobieren und in Produktion zu bringen.

  • Ein dynamisches und motiviertes Team mit einer agilen und innovativen Unternehmenskultur.

  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten &
column2:
Remote-Optionen.

Du m√∂chtest mithelfen sowohl unsere eigenen Softwarel√∂sungen als auch Integrationen mit externen Partnern bzw. Anbietern zu entwickeln? Dann freuen wir uns sehr darauf, von dir zu h√∂ren.

The‚ÄØ Microsoft Spatial AI Lab in Zurich , Switzerland, is a research and development team building the future of spatial computing. We are looking for computer vision and machine learning scientists who share our passion for developing innovative technology that can be deployed to the cloud and utilized by millions of users. We are based near ETH Zurich, the top technical school in continental Europe, enabling close collaboration in multiple areas.‚ÄØ

You will conduct research at the intersection of computer vision, machine learning/AI, robotics and cloud computing. This research will help humans and robotic agents to understand the environment, recognize objects, and perform tasks.‚ÄØ

This opportunity will allow you to grow your expertise in Spatial AI, learn more about deployment of algorithms to Copilot+ PC s with neural processing unit (NPU) or to cloud environments and supervise interns or be involved in joint research projects with ETH.‚ÄØ

Microsoft‚Äôs mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.‚ÄØ
Works within a team to achieve goals and objectives across services, including understanding user requirements, design, and coding.‚ÄØ
Brings the State of the Art to Products - collaborates in an interdisciplinary team to bridge the gap between research and development.‚ÄØ
Grows expertise in one or more subareas of research.‚ÄØ
Develops a deep understanding of tools, technologies and methods that can be utilized to deploy product-grade, robust and efficient code in the cloud.‚ÄØ
Grows our relationships with the research community. May contribute to publications, workshops, or the supervision of interns & PhD/MS students.‚ÄØ
PhD in Computer Vision or AI/Machine Learning or Robotics or similar professional experience.‚ÄØ
Demonstrated coding, debugging, and engineering skills in programming languages such as C++ or Python.‚ÄØ
Hands-on experience with deep learning and/or computer vision methods.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
Self-motivated team-player, problem solver, and keen to learn.‚ÄØ
Ability to present complex technical concepts to a diverse audience.‚ÄØ
Prior research in one or more of the following areas:‚ÄØ
3D scene reasoning with open vocabularies, Vision-L anguage Models ( V LMs).‚ÄØ
Experience with deep learning models like transformers and attention mechanisms for sequence modeling.‚ÄØ
Video understanding, action and activity recognition.‚ÄØ
Experience with spatio-temporal feature extraction techniques.‚ÄØ
Robot-environment / robot-human interaction, particularly through natural language.
Publication record at top-tier conferences and journals (e.g., CVPR, ECCV, ICCV,‚ÄØ NeurIPS, ICLR, CoRL).‚ÄØ

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form .
Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

4185953501,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/ai-engineer-at-pixel-plus-ag-4185953501?position=25&pageNum=0&refId=7seE469UY6C2FEjLJbbQvg%3D%3D&trackingId=1NVh9aw8neFcvAR1CxIwCg%3D%3D,AI Engineer,Pixel Plus AG,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","At Pixel Plus, we are pioneering AI-driven solutions, combining Azure AI Foundry with open-source technologies to build scalable, cutting-edge AI platforms tailored to our clients' needs. Our AI-powered platform enables rapid development and deployment of AI applications.
We are now looking for an AI Engineer to join our team and help shape the future of AI in our projects.
üöÄ Join us and drive innovation at the intersection of proprietary and open-source AI!
Design, develop, and optimize AI models by combining Azure AI Foundry with open-source technologies, LLMs, and machine learning services.
Enhance and scale our AI Platform, integrating RAG, LLMs, and ML pipelines into real-world applications.
Develop AI agents leveraging Azure AI Foundry and open-source frameworks, enabling a ChatGPT-like experience tailored to different industries.
Work closely with engineering teams to implement best practices in AI deployment, security, and performance.
Collaborate with clients to understand business needs and transform them into scalable AI-driven solutions.
Ensure seamless integration with Azure services and open-source tools, including Cognitive Services, OpenAI models, and vector databases.
Proven experience working with Azure AI Foundry and open-source AI ecosystems.
Strong background in LLM fine-tuning, RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation), and AI-driven application development.
Proficiency in Python, ML frameworks, and cloud-native AI solutions.
Hands-on experience with Azure Cognitive Services, OpenAI APIs, and vector search.
Experience in AI security, MLOps, and deploying scalable AI solutions.
Ability to troubleshoot and optimize AI models for performance and accuracy.
Fluent in English (German is a plus).
Exciting AI-driven projects with a strong focus on innovation.
Flexible work environment (remote or hybrid options).
Opportunity to lead AI initiatives in a fast-growing company.
Collaboration with AI & cloud experts shaping the future of AI.

Pixel Plus is an equal opportunity employer, and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

At Pixel Plus, we are pioneering AI-driven solutions, combining Azure AI Foundry with open-source technologies to build scalable, cutting-edge AI platforms tailored to our clients' needs. Our AI-powered platform enables rapid development and deployment of AI applications.


We are now looking for an AI Engineer to join our team and help shape the future of AI in our projects.


üöÄ Join us and drive innovation at the intersection of proprietary and open-source AI!


Tasks

  • Design, develop, and optimize AI models by combining Azure AI Foundry with open-source technologies, LLMs, and machine learning services.

  • Enhance and scale our AI Platform, integrating RAG, LLMs, and ML pipelines into real-world applications.

  • Develop AI agents leveraging Azure AI Foundry and open-source frameworks, enabling a ChatGPT-like experience tailored to different industries.

  • Work closely with engineering teams to implement best practices in AI deployment, security, and performance.

  • Collaborate with clients to understand business needs and transform them into scalable AI-driven solutions.

  • Ensure seamless integration with Azure services and open-source tools, including Cognitive Services, OpenAI models, and vector databases.


Requirements

  • Proven experience working with Azure AI Foundry and open-source AI ecosystems.

  • Strong background in LLM fine-tuning, RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation), and AI-driven application development.

  • Proficiency in Python, ML frameworks, and cloud-native AI solutions.

  • Hands-on experience with Azure Cognitive Services, OpenAI APIs, and vector search.

  • Experience in AI security, MLOps, and deploying scalable AI solutions.

  • Ability to troubleshoot and optimize AI models for performance and accuracy.

  • Fluent in English (German is a plus).


Benefits

  • Exciting AI-driven projects with a strong focus on innovation.

  • Flexible work environment (remote or hybrid options).

  • Opportunity to lead AI initiatives in a fast-growing company.

  • Competitive salary &

Interested in working in finance, specifically as a wealth management professional serving clients, but not sure where to start? Do you want to work for a firm with a truly global footprint that consistently ranks among the world's top financial institutions? Are you passionate about mixing technology to derive business value and excited by the prospect of helping to drive and deliver change that will positively impact the way every research analyst works in the GWM Chief Investment Office (CIO)?
We're looking for ambitious students to join our 2025 Off-cycle Internship Program within our Global Wealth Management business.
support the delivery of solutions that improve the productivity and effectiveness of analysts' community within CIO
support building a modern cloud-based data platform
generate insights and models based on transactional and behavioral data
collaborate with different teams on strategic projects with a goal of improving our client experience and driving engagement
build an understanding of our industry, culture, and strategy, while learning about how we operate to effectively meet the needs of our clients
develop professionally by establishing a network of mentors and business contacts we believe are some of the best in the business
attend educational events led by senior leaders that provide extensive exposure and insight into the business

You‚Äôll be working in our Global Wealth Management team in Z√ºrich. We provide advice-based solutions to deliver products and services designed to address the needs of ultra-high net worth and high-net worth individuals and families. We‚Äôve successfully built the number one wealth management franchise in the world. You‚Äôll work with the best talent in the industry, as we help manage, preserve and grow the wealth of our clients.

You will be part of the CIO Data Analytics team in Chief Investment Office (CIO) in our Zurich location. Our Data team is at the heart of CIO to manage and support data science efforts across different business areas. It is a global team based in Switzerland. At the heart of this project is the ability to systematically analyze and build models supporting business to make data driven decisions. Our focus is always the client!
We‚Äôre looking for a candidate who

has completed at least 4 semesters of a bachelor's degree, and graduated no longer than six months ago (bachelor's or master's degree, preferably in an analytical field e.g. Statistics, Physics, Finance, IT, Engineering)
has strong analytical and problem-solving skills, propensity to move from prototyping to concrete implementation avoiding ‚Äúanalysis paralysis‚Äù
has hands on experience with one or more programming languages (i.e. Python, R, NodeJs), Python is a must
has hands on experience with data science libraries like scikit, pandas, NumPy, TensorFlow
is experienced with scripting languages (bash, etc.)
has an understanding of a broad range of platforms and technologies (e.g. GitLab, Jenkins, AirFlow)
has an understanding of Agile Development's best practices
has high level of curiosity and awareness of emerging technologies, particularly in large language models like ChatGPT
has values that align with ours hard-working, trustworthy, dedicated and collaborative
is a strategic thinker with strong communication skills
is motivated to work in a business with high demands and tight deadlines

We‚Äôre looking for someone who‚Äôs curious and wants to thrive in a business that never stops moving. We welcome all majors, but it‚Äôs important to have an interest in the financial industry. We want to see what makes you unique and discover what you can bring to our team. Perhaps you‚Äôve organized a fundraising event or taken part in team sports? Or stepped out of your comfort zone to learn about a subject you found challenging? Let us know how your achievements match the skills we‚Äôre after.

UBS is the world‚Äôs largest and only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors.

With our large and diverse team operating internationally, we have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries. Although we all come from different backgrounds and specializations, two things unite us the conviction that we‚Äôre stronger together, and the will and curiosity to constantly improve.

We know that it's our people, with their unique backgrounds, skills, experience levels and interests, who drive our ongoing success. You‚Äôll get to learn from the best at UBS, inspirational leaders from across the business and experts in everything financial industry. Together we‚Äôre more than ourselves. Ready to be part of #teamUBS and make an impact?
